actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: On April 6, presumed Katiba Macina (JNIM) militants abducted two farmers in Tabia.

On April 06, 2019, YPG fighters carried out raids and arrests in Al-Hasakeh city's neighborhoods as well as the village and towns of its countryside. An unknown number of young men were arrested and taken to unknown destinations for forced conscription.
05 April. A soccer coach is abducted by an unidentified armed group in Bamenda of Mezam. Reasons unclear.
On April 05, 2019, HTS fighters arrested a civilian in Tremseh area in the southern countryside of Idleb over allegations of being a member of an armed sleeper cell.

As reported on 4 April, 16 migrants from Pakistan and Bangladesh had been held hostage in a warehouse at the district of Ionia in Thessaloniki and were forced to demand money from their families. The migration management unit of Greek police in Thessaloniki along with police officers of the OPKE unit for reinstatement of order rescued them on 4 April. A Moldavian, a Pakistani and an Indian national were arrested.

assoc_actor_2: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
notes: 04 April (or around). MASSOB claimed that five members were abducted by security forces in Isieke, Ishiagu and Enyiogugu Mbaise.

notes: 04 April (or around). MASSOB claimed that five members were abducted by security forces in Isieke, Ishiagu and Enyiogugu Mbaise.

notes: 04 April (or around). MASSOB claimed that five members were abducted by security forces in Isieke, Ishiagu and Enyiogugu Mbaise.

On 4 April, anti-Houthi forces reportedly abducted a woman and 2 children from Al Buqah village of Al Mutaynah area in At Tuhayat district, west of Zabid city, western Yemen, also destroying their house. No fatalities nor injuries reported.

On 03 April, 2019, opposition factions, once under Operation Olive Branch in Afrin district, detained the director of a music institution in Jandairis sub-district of Afrin district, Aleppo province, over accusations of having ties to Kurdish units.
On 03 April, 2019, YPG arrested numerous civilians for conscription in al-Hasakeh countryside.
On 03 April, 2019, members of the Muntasr Billah Battalion detained 2 civilians, a man and a woman, from Hobbo village in Ma'btali sub-district of Afrin district, northern Aleppo countryside.
The former anti-crime chief of an assassinated mayor and his aid were kidnapped by unidentified armed assailants at a hotel in Santa Rosa City, Laguna province on April 3, 2019.
02 April. A business person from Tiko of Fako was abducted and beaten by Ambazonian separatists, they released him after a ransom was paid.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims and/or Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
source: Whatsapp; Infowakat; Burkina24; Anadolu Agency; Xinhua; AFP; RFI
notes: On April 2, suspected JNIM and/or ISGS militants abducted four members of the Foulse community in Yalanga.
On 2 April 2019, QSD forces arrested four civilians in the village of Hreiji on unknown charges.
01 April 2019. The NDC-Renove abducted a civilian from Lwama, Bashali. The assailants accused the man of collaborating with the Nyatura Jean-Marie.

actor1: Former Military Forces of Madagascar (2014-2019) Gendarmerie
notes: 01 April. 2 former gendarmes kidnap a taxi driver in Soavinandriana of Itasy near the hospital.
01 April. A clan elder was abducted by armed gunmen on the outskirts of Balcad town.
01 April. Suspected Al Shabaab militants kidnapped a government worker and his two sons in Dharkinlay district.
On 1 April 2019, YPG forces launched a campaign of arrests in the town of Darbasiyah with the aim of forcing young men into military service.
31 March. 12 firewood traders were abducted by unidentfied gunmen at Dagafada village (Birnin-Gwari LGA)
On 31 March 2019, QSD forces arrested 7 individuals in the village of Darnaj who were attempting to smuggle oil to regime-held areas.
30 March. A group of pirates from Nigeria hijacked a Liberian ship and kidnapped the crew off of the coast of Cameroon. The ship continued after the abduction to the docks at Douala port.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims and/or Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
notes: On March 30, presumed JNIM and/or ISGS militants seized a vehicle and abducted a mining company employee between Saouga and Doumam (coded as Saouga at geoprecision 2).
On March 30, unknown gunmen abducted a journalist in Tripoli.
On March 30, suspected Ganda Izo militiamen attaced a medical center in Boya, two health workers were abducted

On 30 March 2019, in Paletwa Township, in Chin State, the Arakan Army abducted 13 employees of the Hsu Htoo San Construction Company on the charges of collecting intelligence on AA under cover. The company was building a portion of Paletwa-Mizoram road in the township.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On March 29, presumed ISWAP/Boko Haram militants abducted three youths in Lada, one managed to escape.

On 29 March 2019, National Police Forces arrested 9 teachers and a school principal from two schools in the al-Ashrafiyeh neighborhood of Afrin city and were taken to an undisclosed location. The reason for their arrest was unknown.
On 28 March 2019, Asayish and QSD forces arrested 4 former Islamic State fighters in the Basira area.
On 28 March 2019, unidentified gunmen abducted 3 workers from a gas station in the town of Qarayya.
On 28 March 2019, unidentified gunmen abducted a man and his son near the town of Mardak.
On 28 March 2019, unidentified gunmen abducted a man from al-Fayha'a Park in the city of As-Sweida and demanded a ransom for his release.
On 28 March 2019, unidentified gunmen abducted a veterinarian from his car as he was traveling through southern As-Sweida province. The kidnappers later demanded a ransom for his release.
27 March. Unidentified gunmen ambushed the bus of a leader of the NUJ, they fired gunshots and abducted four women
27 March. Unidentified gunmen abducted a former chairman of the NBA in Jalingo

26 March 2019. Suspected Anti-Balaka forces raided the Danga village (no coordinates available, located in the Damara district- 65 km from Bangui). The assailants fired shots and went door-to-door abducting four civilians. More than 1,000 local residents fled to the bush and Bangui.
26 March 2019. The LRA abducted 10 people, 35 km from Bili, Bondo. The assailants also looted livestock and other goods.
On or about 29 March 2019, HTS forces arrested two staff members of the Free Aleppo University in the town of Atareb.
25 March. An unidentified armed group abducted an IDP child in Douala of Wouri, demanding a ransom for the release.
25 March. A catholic priest was abducted from Ankuwa village by an unidentified armed group
On March 25, 2019, YPG arrested several young males in Quamishli in eastern al-Hasakeh countryside for conscription purposes.
On March 24, 2019, unidentified gunmen kidnapped 2 men in Dar'a city who work in the collection of haberdashery in As-Sweida countryside. The kidnappers demanded a SYP 10M in ransom.

23 March 2019. The Raia Mutomboki Mabala attacked Ngolombe, Shabunda. The assailants looted livestock and other goods. They abducted 10 people to port the stolen property (no indication if they were released).
On March 22, unknown gunmen abducted an Islamic scholar in the town of Umm ar Rizam.

actor1: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: On March 22, GATIA militiamen aboard pickups attacked the village of Nokara, several shops were destroyed and cash seized, four members of the Fulani community were abducted near the village.

On March 22nd, four pregnant women belonging to the Ngok Dinka group were abducted by an unspecified group which the source strongly implies are northern Sudanese pastoralists (though no ethnic identity is specified) returning to the north. The event occured at Tol Mach outside Abyei town (coordinates for Abyei used at prec 2), and the victims were rescued by UNIFSA peacekeepers on or before March 26th.

On 21 March 2019, Islamist faction fighters that formerly operated as part of Operation Olive Branch arrested a number of men in the Afrin area for celebrating Nowruz.
On 21 March 2019, Islamist faction fighters that formerly operated as part of Operation Olive Branch arrested a number of men in the Kafr Safra area for celebrating Nowruz.
21 March. Boko Haram attack Lake Chad locations near Waza of Logone-Et-Chari, kidnapping 1 fisherman, stealing over 700 cattle and forcing others to flee.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

20 March. 15 university student football players are kidnapped by an unidentified armed group in Buea at the university sports grounds.
20 March. The former Secretary of State, Emmanuel Ngafeeson, is kidnapped by an unidentified armed group in Bamenda of Mezam.

source: Mosaique FM; Shems FM; Tunisie Numerique
notes: On 20 March 2019, four men and two women were kidnapped by an unidentified armed group on Jebel Mghila and then released in Sabeiba.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims and/or Islamic State (Greater Sahara)

19 March. An unidentified armed group kidnaps a sports coach from Yong Sports Academy, Emmanuel Ndoumbe Bosso, in Bamenda of Mezam.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)

19 March (or around). Unidentified gunmen kidnapped an INEC official on the Gwiwa road in Jigawa state
On 19 March 2019, YPG fighters arrested a man, presumably for the purposes of forced conscription, after a raid in the Ghuyaran district of the city of Al-Hasakeh.

On 19 March 2019, Menbij Internal Security Forces arrested four individuals accused of being part of the cell that was responsible for the suicide attack on American and Menbij Military Council forces on the 16th of January.
18 March. Ambazonian separatists kidnap around 20 pineapple plantation workers in Ndo 3 area of Mbanga in the Moungo department and set fire to the plantation, destroying tools and other goods.
On 18 March 2019, HTS forces arrested several people in the town of Huweiz who had argued with HTS fighters when a Turkish patrol entered the town the day prior.

On March 18, 2019, YPG forces arrested several shop owners in the town of Ras Al Ain in Al-Hasakeh for allegedly refusing to close their shops and participate in a demonstration denouncing Turkish forces and the Free Syrian Army.
On March 18, 2019, Coalition Forces raided a civilian property in the town of Kishkiyeh in Deir-ez-Zor and arrested 6 people suspected of being IS sleeper cells.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims and/or Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
notes: On March 17, presumed JNIM and/or ISGS militants abducted a priest in the area of Sergoussouma.

On March 17, Police Forces raided houses in Diyard Najm and other neighbouring villages, and arrested 3 men. Their whereabouts are unknown. Several people were also allegedly arrested the day before in Abou Baker village.

On March 17, 2019, Menbij Military Council carried out raids and arrests in Menbij area as part of a sweeping operation in search of sleeper cells affiliated with regime forces, IS, Turkish forces, and rebel and opposition forces. Approximately 100 people were arrested over allegations of carrying out bombings and assassinations in the area. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: On March 16, presumed Katiba Macina (JNIM) militants abducted a civilian accused of being an army informant in Debere.

On March 15, unknown gunmen abducted a civilian west of Sirte.
On March 15, 2019, YPG forces carried out a raid in the village of Kbeibah in Tal Hmis town district in Al-Hasakeh and arrested two men wanted for forced conscription.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

On March 14, 2019, YPG arrested and conscripted 2 males after storming Tall Kubaybah in eastern al-Hasakeh countryside.

14 March 2019. The Raia Mutomboki Shabani attacked Lungomangoma (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map) and Miruwa (no coordinates available), Kalehe. The assailants looted food items and livestock. They used six male civilians as porters for the stolen goods, no indication if they were later released.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

12 March. Unidentified gunmen injured and abducted the Security Advisor to the Governor in Calabar. He was rescued by police a while later. A kidnapper died in an accident while being pursued by police.

On March 11, unknown gunmen abducted an NGO worker and seized a vehicle between Namssiguia and Djibo (coded as Namssiguia at geoprecision 2), two teachers were subsequently abducted in a nearby area, presumably by the same group who drove toward the border with Mali aboard the vehicle seized earlier.
11 March. Members of Boko Haram kidnap the son of the village chief in Waro 2, at the outskirts of Sagme (3km). He is released two days later.
On March 11, unknown gunmen aboard a vehicle abducted a resident in Sebha.
11 March. Al-Shabab fighters abducted elders from Gal-qoryale area in Guri'el District for allegedly not paying tax.
On March 11 2019, YPG forces arrested a young man at the entrance to the town of Tal Tamer with the aim of forcing him into military service.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

On 10 March, an off-duty police sub-inspector and a school teacher were abducted by suspected Communist Party of India-Maoist (CPI-Maoist) cadres from Rewali village under Aranpur police station limits (Dantewada, Chhattisgarh). Both victims were released on March 11.
09 March. 20 staff members of INEC were abducted in Danmusa area. 10 of them resurfaced later
09 March. Unidentified gunmen abducted four staff members of INEC in Tarka LGA

09 March 2019. After clashing with the FARDC, the ADF returned to Apetina, Oicha (no coordinates available) and abducted approximately a dozen civilians. Many of the abductees were released with a group of 23 hostages on 12/03.

On 9 March, six suspected Communist Party of India-Maoist (CPI-Maoist) cadres abducted a station master and points man of Hendegir station (Hazaribagh, Jharkhand). The victim was again released on 10 March.

On March 9, an unidentified group of 12 people abducted a textile trader near Bodebarsain Bazaar (Saptari district, Sagarmatha), while he was returning home. The abductors fled after encountering authorities at the Nepal-India border.
On 09-March-2019, in Mrauk-U township, Rakhine state, the Myanmar army forced three villagers to work as guides.
08 March. The traditional ruler, Fon Ta Nfor Nkwi, is kidnapped by Ambazonian separatists in Mpipgo village of Ndu in the North West region.
On 8 March 2019, unidentified gunmen kidnapped a family on the outskirts of As-Sweida city on al-Sahwa road where they released the woman and kept the two men, ostensibly for ransom purposes.

On March 8, Netra Bikram Chand-led Communist Party of Nepal abducted Sudurpaschim Province Assembly lawmaker Devaki Malla from Sainsu locality of Kedarsyu Rural Municipality near Bajhang area (Bajhang district, Seti).
8 March 2019: A local schoolteacher from Tarim town of Hadhramawt was kidnapped by armed men. No further info.

On March 7th, gunmen riding camels abducted two children herding animals in the area of Fallujah in Tawila locality (North Darfur). There is no further information.

As reported on 7 March 2019, several young men had been abducted or arrested in the village of Masikah by Islamist factions formerly operating as part of Operation Olive Branch on charges of having worked with QSD forces.
On 7 March 2019, YPG forces arrested a civilian at the entrance to the town of Darbasiyah on charges of dealing with the Free Syrian Army.

On March 6, in Giza, Police Forces arrested trans woman and militant Malak al-Kashif at her home. She had taken part in the protests in Cairo following the deadly train accident in Ramses Station several days before. Her whereabouts are unknown. Another transgender was also reportedly arrested end of Feb for taking part in the protests.
On March 6, an unknown gunman abducted a 14-year-old girl in the village of Koulbou.

04 March. Dahalo kidnap two people from Ampanasandamba in Tsaratanana and threaten other villagers.

On March 1, in the morning, 7 people were arrested by Military Forces during raids at their homes, in Abu Kabir and in neighbouring villages. Their whereabouts are unknown.
On March 1st, in Santa Police Station, Tanta, militant Islam Khalil was forcibly disappeared by Police Forces after being ordered to be released by a criminal court.
YPG arrested a local singer and members of his band in Halleq in eastern al-Hasakeh countryside.
YPG arrested several IDPs in Hole camp in southern al-Hasakeh countryside following a protest that took place in the camp.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

28 February. The Nsabanga militia (a faction of Kamwina Nsapu) looted Bukondo, Kasai Central. The assailants abducted 10 men to carry the belongings along with three girls.

On Feb 28, following a train accident which left 22 dead in Ramses Station, Cairo, one man staged a protest alone in Tahrir Square to demand the resignation of President Al Sisi. He was arrested by Police Forces along with another man who was taking pictures of him. Their whereabouts are unknown.
27 February. AS ambushed staff members of a local NGO, the staff escaped but two of their drivers were abducted.
On February 27,the Malian army forcibly disappeared seven members of the Fulani community in Gangafani 2.

notes: Houthi forces kidnapped two sisters in an attempt to capture their brother, who has suspected links to AQAP. When the brother turned himself in to Houthi soldiers in Sharab district, Taiz, he was shot and killed.

On February 26, a Fulani family indicated that men of a customary chief had abducted their daughter in Moile (coded as Massenya at geoprecision 2), there were conflicting reports on exactly when she was taken, the allegations were denied by the customary chief and his entourage who provided an alternative version of the circumstances.
QSD forces arrested the head of the Sahm tribe, Sheikh Ahmad Bashir al-Kha'ir, after raiding his home in the village of Fakkeh.

26 February. The ADF abducted two men near Kungubamba, Beni (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The combatants forced the abductees to show them the FARDC base in Mavivi.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 26 February 2019. Two unidentified armed men robbed a vehicle, looted property, and abducted two men near Kitemesho, Uvira.

notes: On February 24, presumed ISWAP militants abducted the village chief of Kagare.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 24 February 2019. Four unidentified armed men abducted a man from Kibanga, Uvira. The assailants demanded a $2,000 ransom.
23 February. Suspected "bandits" or cattle raiders active in Zamfara and Katsina states abducted an undisclosed number of residents from Wanzamai village
23 February. The PDP chieftain of Akwa Ibom and advisor to the Governor was abducted and held in Port Harcourt
23 February. More than 20 elders have been abducted by suspected AS fighters in Xarardheere.
Peoples Protection Units arrested 2 young men in Ras Al Ain in Al-Hasakeh for forced conscription.

On February 23, a group of approximately 16 persons abducted and threatened a man and his family in Hussainpura (Ludhiana, Punjab). It is believe that this event is connected to a land dispute between two groups. [size=16]

On Feb 23, in the morning, 8 people were arrested by Military Forces during raids at their homes, in Markaz Faqous (Sharkia governorate) and in Damanhur (Beheira governorate). Their whereabouts are unknown. (location coded as Damanhur)

On Feb 22, four members of the Dostour Party, known to be opposed to the constitutional amendments that would extend President Sisi's mandate, were arrested by Police Forces at their homes in Cairo and Kom Ombo, Aswan governorate. Their whereabouts are unknown. (location coded as Cairo)
Members of Hamza division abducted a civilian, a cattle herder, in the area near Barad village in the countryside of Afrin in Aleppo.
21 February. A journalist, Ambe Macmillan, is kidnapped by Ambazonian Separatists in Bamenda of Mezem.

As reported by his wife, a Turkish businessman was abducted by a group of gunmen in Edirne province on the night of February 21, 2019. It was claimed by some journalists that the Turkish Intelligence (MIT) abducted the man over his alleged links to Gulen Group, which is accused of planning a coup attempt on July 15, 2016.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 20 February. An unidentified armed group abducted a man from Kambake, Beni (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The perpetrators demanded a ransom.

notes: On February 20, presumed ISWAP militants abducted seven people (one later managed to escape) and seized 200 heads of livestock in the village of Bohouma.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

20 February. Boko Haram kidnap a civilian in Hile Alifa of Logone et Chari in the Far North.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On February 19, presumed ISWAP militants abducted 12 people including nine women in a village named Ngatchia.
On or before: 19 February. AS abducted hundreds of people from around El Bur town for refusing to accept AS's new taxation directive.
On or before: 19 February. AS abducted several people from El Garas in Galgaduud for not respecting AS's new taxation directive.
On Feb 19th, RSF paramilitaries abducted two civilians in the area of Falujah (North Darfur, coordinates for Dobo Umda used). There is no clear motivation behind the abduction.

On Feb 19th, 3 MDC Alliance officials were abducted by eight armed suspected security guards (coded as military). The episode might be linked to President Mnangagwa's threats against pro-democracy NGOs and opposition political parties.
YPG forces raided the village of Al-Tuwinah and arrested two people who they later handed over to regime forces.

19 February. Suspected political militias stormed Lafenwa market in Abeokuta to stop a registration exercise for the 'TraderMoni' scheme and abducted the market's woman leader. She was returned later the same day.
On 19 February 2019, in Kyar Nin Kan Village, in Kyauktaw Township, in Rakhine State, four residents of Kyar Nin Kan village went missing after fighting between the Myanmar military and AA.

On Feb. 19 2019, unknown people kidnapped a government official from the Volnovakha district department of the State Bailiff Service of the Main Territorial Department of Justice in the Donetsk Region while he was visiting relatives in non-government-controlled Makiivka, Donetsk.
18 February. Dahalo militia kidnap 8 civilians and steal cattle in Tsaroanala village of Manja. Fokonolona members follow and find the hostages released outside the city.
18 February. Unknown gunmen abducted the PDP chieftain of Adamawa from his residence in Girei
18 February. Militia from the Sa'ad clan abducted a man from the Omar Mohamoud Clan to allegedly demand the release of their relative.
5 employees of the water company in the Afrin area were abducted by Islamist faction fighters operating as part of Operation Olive Branch and taken to an unknown location.

Two Lumad minors, both girls, were abducted by soldiers from the 88th Infantry Battalion at Barangay Sinuda, Kitaotao town, Bukidnon province on February 18, 2019. They were accused of working with the NPA.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 17 February. The FARDC forced civilians to carry their belongings as they relocated to Kitindi, Shabunda (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map).
17 February. The Raia Mutomboki Lukoba and Ndarumanga ambushed three motorcyclist outside of Nyombe, Shabunda. The assailants looted goods and forced six civilians to carry the goods.
17 February. A South Galkayo Hospital ambulance was carjacked together with the staff and two patients by a Sa'ad clan militia at the outskirts of Bitaale village.
YPG forces detained three men in the Tal Tamer area and took them for forced recruitment.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 16 February. Imbonerakure abducted a man in Murama. The perpetrators were suspicious of the abductee who was not from the area. After interrogating him for seven hours they released him.

16 February. Unidentified armed group kidnap over 100 students and some teachers from St. Augustine College in Kumbo of Jakiri, releasing them a day later following negotiations to shut down the school.

On the weekend of 16 February 2019, a Buddhist monk led a group of villagers to patrol the area of Prey Lang forest coded at Stoung city (Stoung, Khampon Thong), the capital of one of the provinces that border the forest, to preserve the forest from deforestation by illegal loggers. On the patrol they confiscated abandoned wood, chainsaws and even detained a group of loggers they found. The loggers were set free after being advised not to further engage in illegal logging.
On February 15, an unknown armed group abducted 14 Tunisian oil refinery workers on their way to work in Zawiyah, in attempt to force the release of a Libyan detained in Tunisia in a drug case.

source: Al Maloomah; Xinhua General News Service
notes: On Feb 15, IS militants abducted 3 civilians as they went to collect truffles at a desert near the town of Haditha.
On Feb 15, 5 civilians went out to collect truffles and were reportedly abducted by IS militants near the town of Rawa.

On 15 Feb, in Chennai area (Chennai, TN), an anti-Sterlite activist went missing (presumed abducted) during a train journey from Chennai to Madurai, after he released a video to substantiate his claim of the police having orchestrated the Thoothukudi firing on 22 May 2018.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims and/or Islamic State (Greater Sahara)

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency

notes: 14 February. The SNR detained a former FDD rebel in Bubezi, Kayanza. The security forces reportedly accused the man of belonging to a rebel group in the DRC. The victim's family cannot locate the man in any detention facility.

On February 14, 2019, Sharofiddin Gadoyev, a Tajik opposition politician and deputy leader of the National Alliance of Tajikistan, was reportedly abducted in Moscow while meeting with Russian security officials and transported to Tajikistan against his will. Tajik authorities released a statement that Gadoyev returned to Tajikistan of his own free will, but on February 20 NAT released a pre-recorded statement of Gadoyev stating that he had no intentions of returning to Tajikistan and that the video is a precaution to be released on an event of his death or disappearance.
13 February. LRA combatants attacked Ligoua, Obo. The perpetrators looted the town and abducted three civilians.

On February 13, two people were abducted by about 40 men who introduced themselves as undercover armed policemen in Altindag area of Ankara city. The Police Headquarters of Ankara stated that investigation regarding the incident was taking place but no other explanation provided despite the efforts some HDP MPs.
12 February. A member of the APC campaign team in Edo state was abducted by unknown gunmen in Ofosu
On 12 February 2019, in Pyaing Chaung Village, in Buthidaung Township, in Rakhine State, one ethnic Mro man was abducted from his home by four men from the Arakan Army.
12 February 2019. An LRA group - consisting of five women and five men - attacked Ligoua, Haut-Mbomou. The assailants looted goods and abducted three people, including one child.

YPG arrested several male civilians in Ras al Ain in northern al-Hasakeh countryside after unidentified individuals had burnt a YPG bulldozer used in digging trenches in a local area.
QSD carried out arrests against several individuals accused of recruiting volunteers in the Iranian ranks in Deir-ez-Zor.

YPG conducted a search and arrest campaign in Ras al Ain city in northern al-Hasakeh countryside for conscription purposes. Several arrests were reported.

Islamist faction fighters operating as part of Operation Olive Branch arrested a number of residents in the Bulbul countryside on a variety of pretexts.

On January 28, Koglweogo militiamen abducted a member of the Fulani community in the village of Koulpadre (Koulopagare), he was later released safe and sound.

28 January. LRA combatants looted two travelers 11 km northeast of Bilikwa, Haut-Uele. They also looted another traveler 6 km northeast of Bilikwa. The assailants held the men hostage for a few hours before releasing them.
27 January. 3 civilians are abducted from a field around Alagarno of Mora by an unidentified armed group.

actor1: MNDAA: Myanmar National Democratic Alliance Army
notes: On 27 January 2019, in Kunlong Township, in Northern Shan State, the MNDAA arrested 11 villagers from Nam Kyin San village. This is the second time in recent months that villagers have been forcibly recruited by the MNDAA, causing many villagers to flee.
On 27-January-2019, in Gelang Patah, Iskandar Puteri, Johor, a vegetable trader was kidnapped by unidentified armed assailants. He was released after five days.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 27 January. An armed group, who spoke Lingala and an unrecognized language, abducted a man 10 km west of Ngilima, Haut Uele. The abductee was released a few hours later. The group may have links to LRA as the event was reported by source tracking LRA activity.

Between 24 and 26 January 2018, Asayish forces arrested more than 70 individuals in the town of Mansura in Raqqa province as part of raids seeking cells operating on behalf of Turkish forces. The raids also coincided with protests and popular resentment against the killing of a young man by Asayish forces at a checkpoint on the 23rd.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims and/or Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
notes: On January 26, presumed JNIM or ISGS militants attacked the village of Solhan, a bar was torched and a number of men reportedly taken to an unknown destination while women were stripped and had their clothes burned, the owner and bar personnel made it to the town of Sebba where they sought refuge at the gendarmerie.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

26 January. Unknown gunmen in police and military uniforms (assumed as state forces) stormed a football viewing centre in Birnin Magaji and abducted seven people.
Around 26 Jan 2019, in Bangkok, a Vietnamese blogger for Radio Free Asia (RFA) appeared to have gone missing after applying for asylum at the UN Refugee Agency.

Since 26 January 2019, a popular blogger has been missing since he fled his home in Da Nang. It is surmised that he was abducted for imprisonment and interrogation. Sources claim the blogger sought asylum in Thailand on 25 January 2019 at the UNHCR in Bangkok, but the Thai government says it has no record of him entering the country.
YPG forces carried out a campaign of arrests in the city of Shadadah with the purpose of forcing men into military service.

25 January. 5 students are abducted from a secondary school near Natcho in Bamenda by an unidentified armed group, Cameroon government officials and Ambazonian separatists blame each other for the ongoing abductions.
25 January. 2 Lawyers are abducted in Buea near Mile 16 neighborhood by an unidentified armed group. Cameroon government officials and Ambazonian separatists blame each other for ongoing abductions.

A suspect was arrested by rebel forces in the town of Al Bab after a motorcycle IED killed and injured several people.
YPG forces carried out a campaign of arrests in the city of Shadadah with the purpose of forcing men into military service.

Members of the NPA burned heavy equipment owned by Pacific Summit Construction Group at Barangay Maragondon, Real town, Quezon province on January 24, 2019. Workers of the construction company were held at gunpoint on site as the NPA burned the equipment.
23 January. A teacher at Polytechnic school is abducted in Bambui by 3 from an unidentified armed group.
23 January. Charles Kakule's militia abducted 30 fishermen on Lake Edward. Some of the abductees managed to escape, while the others were released following ransom payments.

At an unspecified time (though likely in late January), gunmen from Tonj East abducted three children from an unspecified location in the disputed Gok state (coordinates for Cueibet, Lakes state, used), and stole 150 head of cattle.

QSD forces carried out raids and arrests in the towns and villages of the southern countryside of Shadadah town in Al-Hasakeh in search of IS sleeper cells allegedly responsible for the explosive attack on checkpoint 47.

22 January. Mayi Mayi Buhirwa abducted a man from Narunanga, Uvira. The assailants demanded a $2,000 ransom.
21 January. The LRA barricaded the Dungu-Doruma road at Kana village. They then abducted 15 people and looted property, food, and money.

On January 21, a boy was abducted by an active member of the KNF (N), in Bishnupur area (Bishnupur, Manipur). On January 29, the boy was rescued and the man arrested by a combined team of CDO-BPR.

On 21 January 2019, a man who was the main community representative in an ongoing land conflict between hundreds of families and a company granted a land concession was last seen in the environment office of the Kulen Promtep Wildlife Sanctuary in Choam Ksant district, Preah Vihear province after he was arrested with his son by soldiers the day before.

11 January. LRA forces ambushed civilians 5 km south of Bambangana, Haut Uele. The assailants looted goods and held 36 civilians hostage (including six children), and released them at the end of the day.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 11 January. Soldiers forced 16 civilians to carry military belongings to Swima, Fizi. No indication if/when the civilians were released.

Beginning of January (date unclear), 6 Egyptians, among which 2 students and 2 teachers, allegedly Muslim Brotherhood activists, deported by Malaisian authorities, were arrested by Security Forces in Egypt. Their whereabouts are unknown. (location unknown coded as Cairo)
On January 10, unknown gunmen abducted three livestock traders between Gomso and Yense (coded as Gomso at geoprecision 2), two were released the following day.
On 10 January, a Dalit girl was abducted in Ferozewala Bada village of Dharamkot (Moga, Punjab). No further details.
On 10 January, a 17 year old Dalit girl was abducted in Moga city (Moga, Punjab) while going to her job. No further details.
On January 10, presumed ISGS militants abducted five Malian refugees of the Imghad Tuareg community in the area of Dibissi, four were later released.
On Jan 9, Military Forces raided houses in Tafah area, close to Bir Al-Abd (geoprecision 2, coded as Bir Al-Abd), allegedly abducting an unknown number.
On January 10, presumed ISGS militants abducted two civilians in the area of Inagagay, near In-Ates.
On Jan 4, pro-government militias raided houses in Jandal Street and allegedly abducted 4 women and their children in Al Arish.
On Jan 9, in Markaz El-Hosayneya, pro-government militias raided houses and abducted 4 people, taking them to an unknown location.

On 9 Jan 2019, Al Shabaab militants arrested and abducted at least six farmers in Ali Fool-Dheere village in Mahaday district. The abduction was carried out in retaliation for the farmers' refusal to provide a sack of simsim (grain) to the militants.

On January 9, two labourers were abducted by suspected militants of the Zeliangrong United Front (ZUF) from the Noney Part V area (Noney, Manipur). They were engaged in construction along NH 37 (Imphal-Jiribam highway).
On Jan 9, in 10th of Ramadan, pro-government militias raided houses and abducted one person, taking him to an unknown location.

09 January. LRA forces abducted 11 civilians, including four children, 5 km west of Pangu, Bas Uele. The combatants also looted civilians traveling along the road in the same location. The adult abductees were later released, but the assailants did not release the children.
On Jan 8 (date unclear), pro-government militias raided appartments and physically assaulted and abudcted an unknown number of Al Azhar students in Nasr City. They were taken to an unknown location.

On Jan 8, Military Forces abducted 4 people, including 2 students, from Al Nasr village, close to Bir Al-Abd (geoprecision 2, coded as Bir Al-Abd). They also reportedly raided houses and destroyed and stole home furnitures.

On 8 or 9 Jan 2019, around four Al Shabaab militants moving in a technical kidnapped three civilians at Ceel Gub (Geel Gub) and caused panic within the population who fled towards Xaaji Cali. The reason behind the kidnapping was not known.

On January 8, suspected Maoists armed men abducted three workers at a brick kiln from Dharwasan village (Jamui, Bihar). The group of 25 armed men raided the site and abducted the three labourers, firing in the air and hurling bombs to deter others from challenging them.
HTS forces carried out a campaign of arrests in the town of Daret Azza in search of National Liberation Front fighters.
A child was abducted by unidentified gunmen in the Korin area.
On Jan 8, Military Forces raided Al Kifah village, abducting an unknown number, including displaced people from Sinai, taking them to an unknown location.

actor1: PSLF/TNLA: Palaung State Liberation Front/Ta'ang National Liberation Army
notes: On 8 January 2019, in Namkham Township, in Shan State, 18 villagers from Pan Maung and Tar Kon villages in Man Mai village tract were abducted by the Ta'ang National Liberation Army (TNLA). The relatives of the victims were asked to pay ransom to TNLA to release the abducted villagers. Only 7 villagers were release while 11 others remain in detention.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 01 - 31 January. During the month of January, 44 people from the Kiwanja area were kidnapped, including 11 children. The abductions are carried out by armed groups and criminals who seek ransoms. Most of the abductions target women. Coded as one VAC event each week of January.

On 7 Jan, six Al Shabaab fighters abducted a local NGO worker and confiscated his vehicle from his residence in Buurhabaka district (60 km south east of Baidoa). The motive behind the abduction was not clear.
A man from Dar'a province was abducted by unidentified gunmen in the As-Sweida countryside. A video was released by the kidnappers, demanding money for the man's release.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 07 January. Two armed men abducted a Ugandan man from Munyaga, while he was tending to his field located in the DRC (Location coded as Nyamilima with precision of 3 as it is the DRC town closest to Munyaga).
On January 7, presumed ISGS militants abducted a civilian in the village of Ziban.
On 06-January-2019, it was reported that Taliban militants abducted a Wolesi Jirga candidate in the Baghlani Jadid (Baghlan-i-Markazi) district of Baghlan province.
On Jan 06, IS militants abducted five villagers from their homes broke into the village of Tal-Gseiba near the city of Tikrit.
On January 6, unidentified men abducted 14 coal miners from a local market in Dara Adam Khel town (Kohat, KP), over a dispute between mine owners and the local jirga.

actor1: MNDAA: Myanmar National Democratic Alliance Army

QSD forces carried out raids and arrested several working to promote reconciliation deals with the regime. No injuries or fatalities were reported.
YPG fighters arrested 2 civilians in the city of Ras Al Ain as they attempted to cross into Turkey.

In the days preceding and including 6 January 2019, Islamist factions operating as part of Operation Olive Branch arrested more than 45 civilians in order to seize their property and farms during the olive picking season.

actor1: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
assoc_actor_2: UN: United Nations; Aid Workers (Central African Republic)

On January 5, off the coast of Benin, pirates took six Russian crewmen as hostages from a cargo ship.
04 January. Mayi Mayi Mwenyemali abducted two men near Bwesho (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security map). The perpetrators demanded a ransom.

actor1: PSLF/TNLA: Palaung State Liberation Front/Ta'ang National Liberation Army
notes: On 04-January-2019, near Kulong township, Shan state, the TNLA arrested 18 villagers.

Unidentified gunmen abducted a media activist in the town of Salqin.
02 January: Dembi Dolo University president, Dr. Delasa Bulcha was kidnapped by unidentified armed group near Addis Ababa.

Hayat Tahrir al Sham carried out sweeping and arrests campaigns in Daret Azza, Al-Habta, Makbas and parts of Sadiyah which it recently captured following clashes with Nour al Din al Zinki Movement, where HTS fighters arrested several residents of these areas.
Peoples Protection Units carried out raids and arrests in Hole camp in Al-Hasakeh in search of IS sleeper cells.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
notes: Around January 2, unknown gunmen in Sebha abducted the son of a member of the constitutional draft committee of Bayda.
Week of 02 January. A school principal in Bamenyam of Galim district is kidnapped by Ambazonian separatists. He was released hours later.
Peoples Protection Units carried out raids in Hole camp in Al-Hasakeh and arrested an unknown number of displaced civilians. Reasons for the arrests are not known.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 01 - 31 January. During the month of January, 44 people from the Kiwanja area were kidnapped, including 11 children. The abductions are carried out by armed groups and criminals who seek ransoms. Most of the abductions target women. Coded as one VAC event each week of January.
On December 30, Chadian gunmen abducted six Libyan citizens in the area of the Fuqaha intersection (coded as Al Fuqaha Gate 400 at geoprecision 2).
On December 30, unknown gunmen abducted two members of the Amamra tribe in the area of Dar Brak (coded as Brak at geoprecision 2), while they were travelling from Sebha toward Sirte.

HTS manning a checkpoint on the outskirts of Tal Tuqan in eastern Idleb countryside stopped a bus and detained 16 males on board, claiming their intent to flee to regime-held areas to carry out reconciliation with the regime and settle in its areas of control.
On 30 Dec, Al Shabaab fighters stole a vehicle near Buurhakaba district (south east of Baidoa) on the Mogadishu road and headed to Baidoa. The driver and passenger were abducted.

On Dec 29, four students were allegedly picked up by plain-clothed policemen in Farmgate area (Tejgaon, Dhaka city). The detainees have not been produced before a court and different law enforcement agencies denied the arrest.

assoc_actor_2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)

The two factions of the SSNMC (one of which has joined the current peace agreement, the other breakaway group which has not) accused one another of being behind the attack (for the time being, an UAG is coded).
29 December. Mayi Mayi Mwenyemali abducted three men near Bwesho (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security map). The perpetrators demanded a ransom.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

On 18 Dec, in Jaffna, at least 4 military officers helped two other Sinhalese men in the attempted abduction of a Tamil elderly. The elderly alleged owed them money.

On Dec. 18 2018, police arrested a 29-year-old man from Pakistan and are searching for his accomplices for kidnapping 22 migrants - possibly also from Pakistan - and forcing them to demand money from their families. The suspect had already received payment for transferring the migrants from Evros at the Greek border with Turkey to the village of Exochi in Thessaloniki, where he forced them in an abandoned building and asked for 3,000 euros from each migrant.
On December 17, presumed ISGS militants seized an ambulance together with driver in Tadabat, Oudalan Province, patient and nurse were forced out of the vehicle.

17 December. Raia Mutomboki-Ndarumanga attacked Bisangani (coordinates are approximate; based off of Kivu Security Tracker map). The perpetrators looted livestock and abducted locals (four people from Bisangani and Kibumba).
17 December. Raia Mutomboki-Ndarumanga attacked Kibumba. The group looted livestock and abducted a total of four people from Kibumba and Bisangani, which they also attacked.
Ahrar al Sharqiyah fighters arrested 3 civilians including 2 women near the Norwuz roundabout in Afrin city on charges of belonging to the YPG. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

17 December. Twelve members of Raia Mutomboki- Ndarumanga attacked Kibumba and Bisangani (coordinates are approximate for Bisangani based on Kivu Tracker map). They looted livestock and abducted four people.

17 December. Twelve members of Raia Mutomboki- Ndarumanga attacked Kibumba and Bisangani (coordinates are approximate for Bisangani based on Kivu Tracker map). They looted livestock and abducted four people.

On Dec 17, a German-Egyptian civilian is suspected to have been abducted by security forces in Luxor airport, allegedly accused to be willing to join IS militants in the Sinai. His whereabouts remained unknown as of three weeks later.

On December 15, a couple composed of an Italian and a Canadian citizen went missing in the area of Bobo-Dioulasso, they were supposed to make a detour to Ouagadougou before continuing their trip to Togo. The Canadian government does not exclude abduction since there is a high risk for foreigners in border areas.
On December 15, the Egyptian military abducted five women in Sheikh Zuweiyid, North Sinai, and took them to an unknown location.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

14 December. AS fighters reportedly abducted some male teenagers from Jalalaqsi district. Motive unknown.

08 December. Unidentified armed men abducted 12 University of Bamenda students. They later released a video of the students and urged others against attending schools. The Ambazonian Separatists are known for their opposition to the education system, which they view as an extension of the Francophone government. The students were later released. However, a statement issued by the Governor indicated that a criminal gang seeking a ransom was responsible.
