actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: 25 November. Three civilians were kidnapped by the head of the National Intelligence Service in Kigamba commune. One in Shinge colline, one in Saswe and the other at an unclear location in Kigamba. Coded as three events.

On November 25th, a former army lieutenant-colonel was allegedly abducted by an unknown group in Harare, before escaping in Rushinga. The events, as well as the individual question, are contested, with the military denying involvement in the incident; casting doubt on the credentials of the former senior officer; and dismissing claims that he was due to appear at the commission of inquiry into post-election violence.

One group of Al Sham Corp fighters arrested a woman in the village of Haj Khalil on charges of belonging to a Kurdish cell. The woman was later released by another group of Al Sham Corp fighters, which resulted in a clash.

An unidentified armed group that controls the Afrin area kidnapped a family of 9 from a bus station in Sheikh al-Hadid and took them to an unknown location. The group later demanded $25,000 for the release of the family.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: 25 November. Three civilians were kidnapped by the head of the National Intelligence Service in Kigamba commune. One in Shinge colline, one in Saswe and the other at an unclear location in Kigamba. Coded as three events.
24 November. Two aid workers were abducted by an armed group while traveling on the Bria-Irrabanda road. They were released on 03/12.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On November 23, presumed ISWAP militants abducted at least 15 girls in the villages of Blaharde and Bague near Toumour.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On November 23, presumed ISWAP militants abducted at least 15 girls in the villages of Blaharde and Bague near Toumour.
23 November. AS fighters attacked Unsi village and also hijacked passengers in four vehicles that were being transported to Dollow district.
An unidentified armed group abducted a civilian from the international highway east of Dar'a province.
On November 22, in Abraka town, unidentified actors kidnapped a lecturer with Delta State University.
HTS fighters raided the houses of several Idleb City Council members, arresting them.
On November 21, in Otokutu town, unidentified actors abducted a female APC political leader, but she was able to escape.
21 November. AS fighters ambushed two rickshaws that were carrying food commodities near Faraq village (c. 09 km east of Hudur). One of them was taken and the other escaped.
On November 20, in Kumba town (Ndian, Sud-Ouest), armed Ambazonian separatists abducted students and teachers from Lords Bilingual School.
HTS forces stormed a house in the town of Saraqab and arrested four individuals on unknown charges and took them to an undisclosed location.

actor1: ULFA-I: United Liberation Front of Assam-Independent
notes: On November 20, a trader was kidnapped at gunpoint by three men (suspected ULFA-I members) when he was returning home, at North Borbil village (Karbi Anglong district, Assam).

On November 20, four people, including a newly elected village chief, were abducted by unidentified men when they had gone to SDO Chandel office (Chandel district, Manipur) for an order concerning the election of village chief. They were released the next day, one of them with injuries was sent later for treatment at a local hospital.

actor1: PSLF/TNLA: Palaung State Liberation Front/Ta'ang National Liberation Army
notes: On 20 Nov 2018, in Pan Ku, Kutkai Township, Shan State, the TNLA detained a captain from Myanmar Army's IB 45 who was travelling to see his girlfriend. The Myanmar army had earlier detained villagers in the area, including the captain's girlfriend who is ethnic Palaung.

actor1: ULFA-I: United Liberation Front of Assam-Independent
assoc_actor_1: NSCN: National Socialist Council of Nagaland
notes: On November 20, suspected ULFA-I and NSCN members abducted the manager of Timon Habi tea estate from his bungalow in Sapekhati village under Borhat area (Charaideo district, Assam). He was released on January 12, 2019. There was no information whether the tea garden authorities had to pay the ransom as demanded by the outfits.
HTS detained a former IS commander in an unidentified location in Idleb province.
Gunmen believed to members of HTS detained an official in the humanitarian relief field in an unidentified location in Idleb countryside.

actor1: ULFA-I: United Liberation Front of Assam-Independent
notes: On November 19, ULFA (Independent) members abducted the caretaker of a stone-crushing plant, in Jagun city (Tinsukia district, Assam). As reported on November 27, the man was released by the ULFA-I at the India-Myanmar border town of Nampong in Arunachal Pradesh's Changlang district.
On 19 Nov, suspected militants abducted a youth from Butmaran village (Shopian, J&K).
19 November. The second chief of the Dorock Kingdom was abducted from his home in Shendam.
On 18 Nov, suspected militants abducted a youth from Memender village (Shopian, J&K). He was released later that day.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: On November 18th, RSF paramilitaries abducted 21 civilians east of Kalinga (coordinates for Kedilnye, Central Darfur, used). They offered to release the hostages on return of the camels, or cash compensation.
On November 17, unknown gunmen abducted a woman in the area of Gagal.
On 17 Nov, suspected militants abducted two civilians from Mimander village (Shopian, J&K). The militants released both men.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: 17 November. IS-aligned Boko Haram members abducted 50 people who were collecting wood in Bulakesa (no coordinates available; 25km from Gamboru). Most of the abductees were IDPs.

On November 16, unidentified militants abducted the head of a military-contracted construction company and four of its employees south of Bir Al-Abd, North Sinai. The employees were released after several hours, the company owner's fate remains unknown.
16 November. A staff member of Buea University was abducted by an unidentified group.

actor1: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-) Internal Security Organisation
notes: On November 16th, a controversial South Sudanese business elite - Lawrence Lual Malong - went missing in Kampala. It was later learnt that he was picked up by UPDF soldiers working on behalf of the Police Internal Security Organisation (ISO). He was released from ISO custody on the week beginning 31st Dec 2018. He was being investigated on numerous allegations, which mainly involved illicit financial activity and fraud. Malong does not appear to have been charged with any offence, though is still a person of interest.
15 November. The LRA attacked Pasi. The group looted the village and abducted four men, a woman and a baby. They later released the woman and child.
15 November. Boko Haram abducted 10 female IDPs in the outskirts of Maiduguri.

assoc_actor_2: Majeerteen Clan Group (Somalia); Government of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
notes: 15 November. Sa'ad clan militia kidnapped a man suspected to be from Majeerteen clan. Galmudug local authorities and elders attempted to secure the release of the victim.

assoc_actor_2: PPRD: Peoples Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
notes: During the week of Nov 12th, two PPRD candidates in the legislative elections in Dibaya were kidnapped by armed men led by the militia leader Tshiyoyo.

assoc_actor_2: Teachers (Philippines); RMP: Rural Missionaries of the Philippines
notes: Four teachers affiliated with RMP were allegedly abducted by the military at Barangay Durongan, Tagoloan 2, Lanao del Sur province sometime in the month of November 2018.
HTS forces arrested 2 individuals in the town of Saraqab on charges of belonging to the Islamic State.

On November 13, in Bururi city (Bururi, Bururi), unidentified men abducted a Magistrate named Nicaise Niyungeko from his office at the prosecutor's office of the Republic of Bururi. The Magistrate was working on an anti-corruption case.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On Nov 13, three men were kidnapped from the Mangina district of the Mangina rural commune by unknown armed men.

actor1: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
notes: On Nov 12, UPC militants held hostage 6 members of the Islamic committee for negotiation in Gbokolobo, located 60 km away from Bambari on the way toward Alindao. They were released two days later.
12 November. Al Shabaab fighters abducted a civilian woman in her own teashop in Makuda village.

13 November. Armed militia kidnapped several passengers travelling by road between Ceel-Geelow and Gololey settlement in Balcad district. The passengers were robbed of their belongings and assaulted by the armed militia.

actor1: ULFA-I: United Liberation Front of Assam-Independent
notes: As reported on November 12, suspected ULFA-Independent cadres abducted a tea estate employee from Piyong village (Namsai district, Arunachal Pradesh). The group of seven men had come to the tea garden demanding Rs 3 crores as extortion, following which the employee was abducted.

On Monday, November 12, 2018, unknown people in masks claiming to be law enforcers kidnapped Rustam Lyanov, a nephew of Ibragim Lyanov, the head of the European Ingush Association in Brussels who opposed the land-swap deal between Ingushetia and neighboring Chechnya. Rustam Lyanov was released about 1.5 hours later near the Ingush village of Troitskoe.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On Nov 11, a woman and a man were kidnapped by unidentified gunmen from the Mabanga neighborhood in Goma town. The kidnappers demanded a ransom of $20000 for the release of the hostages.

assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: 10 November. Two FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa members were abducted by unknown persons in Butaganzwa.
On November 10, in Buea town (Fako, Sud-Ouest), Ambazonia separatists abducted a professor and staff member of the University of Buea.
QSD forces carried out raids and arrests in the town of Tayyana. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On Nov 9, a man was kidnapped by unknown armed men from Mangoyo village (a few km north of Bingo - approx. coordinates used) in Beni territory.

actor1: NSCN-IM: National Socialist Council of Nagaland-Isak Muivah
notes: On November 9, a Naga sales girl was abducted from a pharmacy Near Zion Hospital, in Dimapur city (Dimapur district, Nagaland), by two Nationalist Socialist Council of Nagaland-Isak Muivah (NSCN-IM) cadres. The girl was subsequently released after the payment of INR 30,000 was made by the shop owner.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On Nov 8, a man from Bingo village in Beni territory was kidnapped by unidentified gunmen.
07 November. The state chairman of the ADC and three other party members were abducted on their way back to Akure.
07 November. Al Shabaab fighters abducted three international staff members of an INGO working from local health center in Balet hawa town and took them to Ceel cade village.
Syrian Democratic Forces carried out a series of raids and arrests in Al-Tahti area in the northern countryside of Deir-ez-Zor. An unknown number of civilians were arrested.

actor1: RCSS/SSA-S: Restoration Council of Shan State/Shan State Army-South
notes: Around 07-November-2018, near Hsipaw and Namhkam townships, Shan state, around 30 villagers were arrested by the SSA-S.
07 November. Armed men hijacked a vehicle owned by Puntland's MP as he was driving it in the centre of Garowe town. The motive is said to be clan related.

On Nov 7th, RSF paramilitaries abducted 35 people at an unspecified location in Central Darfur state (coordinates for the state capital, Zalingei, used). 16 of the abducted were reported to be IDPs. On 15th Feb 2019, all but three of the abductees were released.
06 November. Four priests were abducted by suspected Fulani while traveling through Abraka. They were later freed and suspected perpetrators were arrested.
An unidentified armed group abducted a civilian in the Basuta area in the countryside of Afrin. The civilian was returning from the harvest of olives in the farmlands surrounding the area.

Assumed on 6 Nov, in Kilinochchi area (Karachchi, Kilinochchi), a Tamil youth was abducted by a military officer and his other companions in Ponnagar. They demanded Rs 5 lakhs in ransom for his release. Police have arrested the perpetuators later on.

Members of an opposition brigade operating in Afrin city raided a civilian property in Afrin city and arrested a man and his son and daughter over allegations of being members of Peoples Protection Units sleeper cells.
06 November. Pirates attacked a ship 30 km south of Bonny and abducted eight crew members.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Puntland (2017-); Unidentified Clan Group (Somalia)
notes: 06 November. A group of 5 armed men abducted the Puntland MP Omar Akabe, elected from Buhoodle, in Ayn in his car. Inter clan issues are said to be motive of abduction.

05 November. Seventy-nine students and three school administrators were kidnapped from the Presbyterian Secondary School in Bamenda. Ambazonian separatists were believed to be responsible for the abduction but have released statements denying any involvement. They alleged the government orchestrated it to discredit the separatists movement. Disagreements over the language used in a video with the abductors also emerged. All except for two students and one administrator were released on 7/11.

On or around November 9th, and following a clash between two mining gangs in Esigodini (Matabeleland South), a group of miners took nurses hostage at a local hospital, and demanded their injuries be treated.

04 November. Two salesmen were arrested at the border in Kanyaru, while traveling to Uganda to purchase goods for their business. After being detained over night they were placed on a truck to an unknown location. Relatives received a call that the detainees were being released but have been unable to locate them or determine where the truck took them.
Members of the 9th Division Special Forces detained a family of 4 in Jarablus in eastern Aleppo countryside. The man and his 3 children were on their way back to northern Syria from Turkey.

Unidentified armed men who were part of a gang kidnapped a civilian and demanded ransom. Houthi forces later intervened, prompting clashes that ultimately freed the kidnapped man. Clashes coded in a separate event.

Between 31 October and 2 November 2018, more than 7 civilians were abducted by opposition factions once under Operation Olive Branch across Afrin district of Aleppo province, and a ransom was demanded from their families in exchange for their release. One ransom, which was demanded from an abducted doctor's family, was 1M USD. The arrsests continued through the 3 days.
On Nov 2, Isopo village in Mwenga territory was raided by the Raia Mutomboki Ndarumanga . They looted money, livestock and property. They also abducted three men to carry the looted goods.
On November 2, unknown gunmen abducted two civilians in the area of Wandori.
On November 1, presumed Dawsahak militiamen abducted the brother of an Arab notable in the area of Sagagou.

Between 31 October and 2 November 2018, more than 7 civilians were abducted by opposition factions once under Operation Olive Branch across Afrin district of Aleppo province, and a ransom was demanded from their families in exchange for their release. One ransom, which was demanded from an abducted doctor's family, was 1M USD. The arrsests continued through the 3 days.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On Nov 1, a 21-year-old man was abducted a by unidentified gunmen from the Nyakavogo neighbourhood of Bukavu town.
31 October. Armed men abducted the principal of GTHS Jakiri school.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On Oct 31, the youth president of the Salongo district of Bunia (Ituri), was kidnapped. He was found on November 2 in a state of unconsciousness.

Between 31 October and 2 November 2018, more than 7 civilians were abducted by opposition factions once under Operation Olive Branch across Afrin district of Aleppo province, and a ransom was demanded from their families in exchange for their release. One ransom, which was demanded from an abducted doctor's family, was 1M USD. The arrsests continued through the 3 days.

On 31 October, a young Sikh man was kidnapped and held for three days, from near Shahabad Markanda (Kurukshetra, Haryana). He says that someone cut his hair during the abduction, but received no other injuries.
Between late October-mid-November, Egyptian security services have reportedly detained at least 40 human rights activists at undisclosed locations.

assoc_actor_2: Refugees/IDPs (Democratic Republic of Congo); Teachers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On Oct 31, about 10 IDPs, including teachers, were abducted by Reformed Nduma Defence of the Congo militia combatants led by Guidon in Kilambo, Bafuni region, Masisi territory.
On October 30, unknown gunmen abducted a financial controller of the Sebha Medical Center in Sebha.

Islamist faction fighters operating as part of Operation Olive Branch broke into a home on the al-Nirouz roundabout in Afrin city and arrested a Kurdish man, his son and daughter on charges of belonging to a YPG cell.
On October 29, unknown gunmen abducted a member of the Dogon community in Petekobi, Mondoro (coded as Mondoro at geoprecision 2), the abductee was released two days later.
An unidentified armed group, alleged to be HTS, abducted a member of the Free Hama Governorate Council in Murak in Hama.
Suspected Hayat Tahrir al Sham fighters abducted two civilians, including a male nurse, on the road connecting Termanin and Harzah in Idleb.

source: Libya Observer; Amaq; Nashir News Agency; Al Marsad; Afrigate; Libya Alahrar
notes: On October 28, civilians were abducted as part of an Islamic State militant attack on the town of Fuqaha. Clashes with the police were repored and coded in a separate event.
On October 27, presumed Ansaroul Islam militants seized an ambulance while it was transporting a patient from the village of Silgadji to Djibo. The fate of the healthworkers and patient is unknown.
Syrian Democratic Forces arrested 3 young men in Tell Hallaf village in Al-Hasakeh for forced conscription.

assoc_actor_2: Palaung/Ta'ang Ethnic Group (Myanmar); Mone Wun Ethnic Group (Myanmar)
notes: Around 27-October-2018, in Shauk Haw village, Tarmoenye, Kutkai township, Shan state, 40 Palaung and Mone Wun villagers were forcibly recruited by an unidentified armed group operating in the area.
27 October. Boko Haram abducted a woman in Kassibe.
27 October. Pirates abducted 11 crew members on a ship near Bonny. The crew included eight Polish, two Filippino and one Ukrainian.
On 26-October-2018, 35 civilians from the Kajran district of Daykundi province were abducted by Taliban militants in Kandahar province. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

Sultan Murad Division fighters carried out several raids in Al-Keh village in the countryside of f Afrin where they arrested 8 people, including 2 women over allegations of being members of Peoples Protection Units sleeper cells
On October 25, Dozo militiamen abducted two Fulani men in the area of Wela (coded as Sokoura at geoprecision 2), the two were later released but the Dozos seized two carts, a camel and several rams.
YPG forces launched a campaign of arrests in the town of Shadadah targeting men for compulsory military service.
YPG forces arrested a number of men in the Ras al Ain area who were fleeing the fighting in Deir ez-Zor province.
Islamic State fighters raided homes in the city of al-Bukamal and arrested many civilians on charges of working with regime forces.

assoc_actor_2: AL: Bangladesh Awami League; Jubo League
notes: On Oct 24, three men from the Awami League and Jubo League were kidnapped by unknown assailants from Rupganj upazila in Narayanganj.

On or before October 24th, three civilians were abducted in the Ngovendeko area in Wau, whilst houses were looted and torched. The attack came amidst clashes between the government and SPLA-IO forces.

On 24 October 2018, student Roman Scherbinin disappeared after being arrested by the police in Yekaterinburg. The police told Scherbinin's relatives that the suspect was handed over to the Tyumen police. Scherbinin called a friend from the Tyumen police station, however, Tyumen policemen denied having received the young man.

actor1: MNDAA: Myanmar National Democratic Alliance Army
assoc_actor_1: PSLF/TNLA: Palaung State Liberation Front/Ta'ang National Liberation Army
notes: On 23 Oct 2018, Ying Maw village, Kutkai Township, Shan State, TNLA's 447 Battalion and MNDAA's 501st Battalion forcefully conscripted 15 villagers, among them one child aged 9.
Prior to Oct 22, police arrested a youth without any explanation and demanded a bribe for his release from Kandiaro village (Khairpur, Sindh).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On Oct 21, three schoolchildren were kidnapped while playing in front of their homes by unknown armed men.
On October 21st, armed raiders believed to have come from Panyijiar county attacked an unspecified location in Adior county (Lakes state). They abducted three children, and stole hundreds of cattle.
QSD conducted a search and arrest operation in Shadadah city in southern al-Hasakeh countryside for conscription purposes. Arrests were reported.

actor1: MNDAA: Myanmar National Democratic Alliance Army
notes: On 21 Oct 2018, in Kawng San village, Kutkai Township, Shan State, the MNDAA forcibly conscripted two villagers.
21 October. Boko Haram abducted eight women and a baby in Vourkaza.
Sultan Suleiman Shah fighters abducted a Kurdish resident from the village of Kakhira in Afrin district and demanded a ransom for his release.
Unidentified gunmen kidnapped a civilian in the town of Kafruma.
On October 20, unknown gunmen abducted a Tuareg shopkeeper in Acharane.
20 October. The principal of GBHS in Jakiri was kidnapped by suspected separatists. According to locals, he has been targeted in the past for not 'supporting the struggle.'
Unidentified gunmen abducted a male IDP from the town of Sarmin.
19 October. An armed group abducted six students from a high school in Bamenda. Local sources report that one of the hostages escaped, but this has not been confirmed.
Islamist faction fighters operating as part of Operation Olive Branch carried out a raid on the city of Afrin where they arrested several individuals.

assoc_actor_1: Operation Olive Branch; Free Syrian Police
notes: Turkish forces, Operation Olive Branch fighters, and Free Syria Police raided the Muhammadia Camp in the Deir Ballut area ostensibly to deal with illegal building in the camp. At least one resident of the camp was arrested.
YPG forces launched a campaign of arrests in the city of Shadadah.
Unidentified gunmen abducted two civilians from their farm on the outskirts of Idleb city.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: Houthi militiamen at a security checkpoint in Hajjah attacked a wedding procession for two girls who were set to marry two men living in Marib. The militants kidnapped the girls and forcibly shaved their heads before releasing them.
17 October. Ambazonian Separatists kidnapped the sister of SDF president and presidential candidate John Fru Ndi in retaliation for Ndi's participation in the election.
On October 16, AS fighters ambushed two donkey carts that were carrying food commodities near Walaq village and abducted two people owning the carts, near Wajid town, Bay region.
On October 16, six civilians were abducted from Qoryoley town in Lower Shabelle region. It was suspected that Al Shabaab militants were behind the kidnapping.

Suspected rebel and Islamist factions operating in Afrin abducted over 20 people in Afrin. The exact location and reason for the abduction are not known, but it could possibly be connected to the detention of 2 fighters of the group by Kurdish forces.

assoc_actor_2: Lisu Ethnic Group (Myanmar); Burman Ethnic Group (Myanmar)
notes: On 16 or 17 Oct 2018, Bhamo Township, Kachin State, soldiers from Myanmar army LIB 250 detained three ethnic Burman from Natkok village and allegedly forced them to serve as porters. The were released the following week. The government troops also detained two ethnic Lisu, one of them a child aged 10. Their whereabouts remain unknown.

On October 16, presumed ISGS or Ansaroul Islam militants abducted a municipal councilor in the village of Gountoure Nienie (Gountoure-Gnegne), the assailants seized his motorbike and subsequently released him.
On October 15, unknown gunmen abducted a butcher and his son in Diabaly and burned the vehicle of the victim, the abductors accuse the butcher of spupplying the Malian army with meat.

Opposition factions, once under Operation Olive Branch, detained an unknown number of civilians in villages across Afrin district of Aleppo province and led them to vacant houses of Afrin residents who had previously fled the district.
Unidentified gunmen abducted 1 male individual in Idleb city.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 13 October. Journalist Kasome Seba of Lemera community radio in Uvira territory was abducted by armed men in his home.

On October 13th, three children were abducted by an unknown group (alleged to be herders) at Chalara village (Central Equatoria, coordinates for Lokiliri used). Authorities have begun a search for the missing children.

On Oct 13, 2 engineers of an oil and gas exploration company were kidnapped by unidentified militants from the Abakhel Olam Lagad area of Spinwam or Shawal tehsils (N Waziristan, KP). Officials believed they were then smuggled to Afghanistan.

On Oct 13, a 58-year old man was kidnapped by members of Raia Mutomboki Ndusha in Karembu village in Walungu territory. He was accused of not having payed a debt. They demanded a ransom of $600 for his release.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: In the night between Oct 13 and 14 a Congolese journalist was kidnapped by unknown armed men in Uvira.
13 October 2018: Al-Shabaab militants abducted 4 elders from Aad and El Abdi villages, Mudug region, for not paying Zakat taxes.
13 October 2018: Al-Shabaab militants abducted 4 elders from Aad and El Abdi villages, Mudug region, for not paying Zakat taxes.

Opposition factions, once under Operation Olive Branch, continued to detain civilians across Afrin district of Aleppo province to later demand ransoms from their families, causing wide-spread resentment among the district's residents.

On October 12, presumed Katiba Macina or Ansaroul Islam militants took three individuals hostage and interrogated them while searching for the Koglweogo chief in the locality and a local official, the abductees were threatened and subsequently released.
10 October. The Mayor of Kumbo was kidnapped in Sabga by an unidentified armed group. The mayor was released the following day, without any injuries.
Unidentified armed gunmen abducted 2 men from the town of Jarjnaz. Their fate remains unknown.
On October 10, unknown gunmen abducted four Tebu tribesmen on the Qatrun-Murzuq road (coded as Qatrun at geoprecision 2).

Early October (source dated Oct 19th mentioning the event taking place at a recent time) a 14 year-old girl was abducted in Tit Agok (Lakes state, approximate coordinates used based on humanitarian source) by unknown attackers.

During the week beginning Monday 8th October, 12 people were abducted as part of inter-communal violence in Maruo Boma state (in the former Jonglei state). Approximate coordinates for Labarab (Jonglei) have been used based on humanitarian source.
On Oct 10, unidentified armed men kidnapped a tribal elder from the Killi Ibrahimzai area (Khuzdar, Balochistan). The motive is unclear.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: On October 9, Dozos abducted two Fulani men in Yebe.

actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 09 October (on or before). CNDD-FDD party officials, along with Imbonerakure and local police detained a Matongo teacher, who was an MSD supporter. The teacher has not been seen since. This disappearance coincides with a larger persecution of teachers who support opposition parties in Matongo.
Fighters of Islamist faction which were Operation in Euphrates Shield operation arrested a 19 family members of Islamic State fighters in northeastern Aleppo province.
09 October. A group of unidentified armed men abducted a woman from her house in Jos.

On October 9th, an armed group (described as bandits in the source) attacked the village of Nkiruni in Tharaka-North county (coordinates for county capital of Kathwana used). The group abducted a mother and her two daughters, and released two soon after. They also looted livestock from the area.
On October 8, a Chadian armed group abducted six Libyan civilians between Fuqaha and Sebha (coded as Al Fuqaha at geoprecision 2).

On October 8, unknown gunmen abducted a communal transport driver and his apprentice between Douentza and Dianveli (coded as Dianveli Kesel at geoprecision 2), the two were released the following day.
An unknown number of civilians were reportedly abducted by an unidentified armed group from several areas in As-Sweida province. Some of the abductees were released after the payment of ransoms.

On 7 October 2018, a Burundian soldier who was a former FLN member disappeared in the Musaga zone of Muha commune in Bujumbura town hall. He left his home that day saying that he would meet with a colleague.
Syrian Democratic Forces carried out a series of raids in Al-Hasakeh city during which an unknown number of young men were forcibly taken to be enlisted in the QSD forces.
Armed men from the Islah party abducted a leader in the Abu Al Abbas faction while he was in Taiz City.
6 October 2018: AS fighters abducted a civilian man in Ceel Abay (c. 09 km north west of Qansaxdheere) for allegedly having close relationship with South-west State police forces.
On October 5, Dozo militiamen abducted a member of the Fulani community in Koumaga.
On October 5, Dozos abducted three Fulani men in the village of Goumba.

QSD raided a civilian residence in al Tabqa in western Ar-Raqqa countryside and arrested several family members after physically assaulting them. This comes after a complaint made by one of the family members to the Asayish against a QSD commander accused of threatening to confiscate the civilian's property if royalties aren't paid.
04 October. The Chairman of the Suleja local government was kidnapped by unidentified armed men.
On 04-October-2018, in Way Lay Lan village, Tachileik township, Shan state, a Shan woman, Daw Ei Nan, was abducted by four unidentified gunmen while selling goods in front of her house.
QSD forcibly conscripted several teachers in Ras al Ain in western al-Hasakeh countryside.
Unidentified individuals abducted 1 male civilian from a mosque in Khan Shaykun in southern Idleb countryside.

actor1: PSLF/TNLA: Palaung State Liberation Front/Ta'ang National Liberation Army
notes: On 3 Oct 2018, Yung Ngaw village in Kutkai township, Shan State, the TNLA arrested a villager while he was looking for firewood. His whereabouts remain unknown.

On October 3, a class 12 student was abducted by Maoists while travelling from Bhejji to Konta (Sukma District, Chhattisgarh). The identity and reason for the abduction of the student is yet to be ascertained. The student was released by the militants on October 5 following protests from other students and villagers.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: On October 2, Suspected members of the Tariq Ibn Ziyad Brigade abducted the former mayor of Benghazi and intelligence chief, Brigadier General Ahmed Araibi in the Lamloum area (Al Fuwayhat) of Benghazi.
2 October 2018: Al-Shabaab militants abducted two people carrying khat near Ilbaq settlement under Balcad district.
Unidentified gunmen abducted 2 male siblings from in Ma'arrat al-Ikhwan in northern Idleb countryside.

On October 1st, unidentified gunmen attacked a family in Gemmaiza county (Central Equatoria), and abducted an eight-year old girl. The governor of Terekaka State stated that he believed the attackers came from Boma state.

actor1: PSLF/TNLA: Palaung State Liberation Front/Ta'ang National Liberation Army
notes: On 30 Sept, in Kutkai Township, Shan State, the TNLA forced 7 villagers from Nam Gut and Ying Ngaw village to serve as guides and porters.
29 September. An armed group kidnapped humanitarian staff between Kebe and Barya and looted their belongings. The aid workers were released later that day.
29 September 2018: AS fighters detained more than ten civilian residents of Bu'ale town including a former humanitarian personnel.
On Sept 29, a Burundian refugee was abducted in Nduta camp by unknown armed men. He was still missing as of six days later.

actor1: PSLF/TNLA: Palaung State Liberation Front/Ta'ang National Liberation Army
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Myanmar (2016-) People's Militia Force
notes: Around 29 Sept 2018, in Hseni Township, Shan State, TNLA troops detained four men from the Kawng Hka Pyithusit (People's Militia Force).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 29 September. Four unidentified gunmen kidnapped a 60-year-old man from Mununze village.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 29 September. Unidentified gunmen kidnapped a 57-year-old man from Katyaza village in Uvira territory (approx. Coordinates used based on location a few km west of Luberizi). The attackers demanded a ransom of $500 for the release of the hostage.
29 September. The Mai-Mai Mwenyemali kidnapped two men from the Narunanga village in Uvira territory (approx. Coordinates used based on location a few km west of Luberizi).

On September 29th, two police inspectors were abducted by unknown armed men at Entebbe Airport. The two had attempted to block military intelligence officers from arresting a constable with the counter-terrorism unit (see event dated 24th September, also in Entebbe). The two inspectors were then seized by the unknown men, who were driving in a civilian vehicle, and have not been seen since.

actor1: MNLC: National Movement for the Liberation of the Central African Republic
notes: 27 September. The MNLC abducted a humanitarian worker and 11 other civilians along the Boria - Bogila Kete road. The perpetrators took the abductees into the bush, where they robbed them. The abductees were released later that day.
QSD conducted a conscription campaign against individuals over the age 18 in multiple locations across Ain al Arab district of Aleppo province. Arrests were reported.
QSD conducted a conscription campaign against individuals over the age 18 in multiple locations across al-Hasakeh province. Arrests were reported.
QSD conducted a conscription campaign against individuals over the age 18 in multiple locations across Ar-Raqqa province. Arrests were reported.
QSD conducted a conscription campaign against individuals over the age 18 in multiple locations across Deir-ez-Zor province. Arrests were reported.

JTW carried out raids in Hbit in southern Idleb countryside in search for reconciliation advocates. During the raids in Termala, Hbit, Kafr Nabutha, and Tal Hawash, at least 10 individuals were detained.

JTW carried out raids in Kafr Nabutha in northern Hama countryside in search for reconciliation advocates. During the raids in Termala, Hbit, Kafr Nabutha, and Tal Hawash, at least 10 individuals were detained.

JTW carried out raids in Tal Hawash in northern Hama countryside in search for reconciliation advocates. During the raids in Termala, Hbit, Kafr Nabutha, and Tal Hawash, at least 10 individuals were detained.

Gunmen of an unnamed Turkish-backed group kidnapped a university professor in the Afrin area sometime early in the week of September 24-30, 2018.
On September 26, unknown gunmen abducted two members of the Tuareg Ifartatane faction in Kaygourou on the western river bank of the town Gossi (coded as Gossi at geoprecision 2).

26 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters abducted 4 civilians near Baadcade village (approx. 10km NW of Baidoa, approximate coordinates used). The civilians had allegedly broken an Al-Shabaab imposed ban on cell phones and tobacco in the area.

Around Sep 25, when his family began protesting, a man from Nazar Muhalla village was arrested by the police in Larkana town (Sindh) without justification and taken to an unknown place away from his family. He was missing for at least 2 weeks. (This event was one of two reported disappearances in the same area around the same time.)
YPG arrested several young men in al-Nashwah area in al-Rusafa neighborhood of al-Hasakeh city for conscription.

Around Sep 25, when his family began protesting, a Kalhoro community man and professor was arrested by the police without justification and taken to an unknown place away from his family. He was missing for at least 2 weeks. (This event was one of two reported disapperances in the same area around the same time.)

End September (likely), a counter-terrorism police constable alleged that he was abducted by suspected military intelligence officers after posting anti-government comments on social media, and tortured at a facility at an unspecified location. Location unclear. He escaped.

source: Jeune Afrique; WAT FM; Lefaso; Xinhua
notes: On September 23, unknown gunmen attacked a vehicle carrying staff of the Inata gold mine (including the son of Akoliya Patel, President of the Ghana-based Inata mining company Balaji, a South African and a Burkinabe) near Inata. The gunmen abducted the staff.
On September 23, unknown gunmen abducted the son of a municipal councilor in Kacham-Ouest.
Pro-regime militias have reportedly abducted 4 female civilians in Arbin in Rural Damascus.
23 September. An unidentified armed group attacked a Swiss shipping vessel traveling between Lagos and Port Harcourt. The attackers reportedly abducted 12 members of the shipping crew.
A public school teacher was kidnapped by Abu Sayyaf rebels at Jolo town, Sulu province on September 22, 2018.
22 September. After attacking an army position in Mabapula, east of Oicha, 35 km north of the city of Beni, ADF abducted 17 people, including children. Approx. Coordinates used.

On September 21, PKK militants took hostage of two people in a forestry area of Alucra district, Giresun. One hostage was sent to a nearby village with another militant to buy food and some supplies. After they returned, the hostages were released after being threatened to be discrete about the event.
The PKK was accused of abducting a civilian on September 20 in Semdinli district of Hakkari. The PKK denied the claims.

On 20 September, a group of at least 12 men allegedly kidnapped and beat a man in Uthian village near Rajasansi (Amritsar, Punjab), over an old enmity. One man was later arrested - no further details.
On 20 September 2018, a customs declarant was kidnapped by people in police uniforms when he was going to take his child to school in or near Kabondo.

Around 19-August-2018, near Muse, Shan state, four workers went missing as they made they made their way back home after working in China. Their family appealed to armed groups in the area to release them if they have been taken or to inform the family of their whereabouts.
YPG forces launched a large-scale campaign to arrest young men for forced conscription in the city of Ras al Ain.

On or around 19 September 2018, an (assumed off-duty) soldier and ex-FAB was abducted on his way to Ngagara camp; his motorcycle was also stolen. According to RPA, they are among those abducted by Burundian security forces.

On 19 September, 2018, a resident of town Prokhladny disappeared. The locals link his disappearance to the clashes occurred in Kabardino-Balkaria On 18 and 19 September, related to commemoration of the Kanjali battle.
YPG forces launched a large-scale campaign to arrest young men for forced conscription in the city of al-Hasakeh.
Unidentified gunmen kidnapped a media activist in northern Homs province.
18 September. The Mayor of Kumba's son and driver were kidnapped by unidentified armed men while driving on the Matoh road. They were released after several hours.
On September 18, Dogon militiamen abducted two Fulani herders in the area of Ewery, southeast of Douentza.

7 women and 16 children, all citizens of Kazakhstan and possibly family members of deceased IS fighters, are reportedly detained in a prison camp in Jarablus district of Aleppo province near the Syrian - Turkish border, likely by opposition factions once under Operation Euphrates Shield.
On September 17, presumed ISGS militants abducted an Italian priest who also works as an aid worker in the village of Bomanga, not far from the border with Burkina Faso.
17 September. Military officials detained three IDPS from the Tur camp in Nierteti. Family members have inquired at the local military garrisons, but they deny holding the detainees.
On September 17, presumed Ansaroul Islam militants abducted a cattle trader on the road between Petegoli and Djibo (coded as Petegoli at geoprecision 2).
On Sept 17, IS militants abducted two citizens due to allegations of cooperating with the security forces, from al Habt village of al-Rashad district south of Kirkuk.
17 September. Two armed LRA combatants abducted a young girl 30 km south of Bangadi.
16 September. The traditional ruler of Bojoke was kidnapped by an unidentified armed group. The coordinates for Bojoke are approximate, based on its location near Bonjongo.
QSD arrested and conscripted 100 individuals across al-Hasakeh province.

16 September. Armed herders abducted three IDPs from the Selo displacement camp in Mershing while they were collecting firewood. The perpetrators later released the IDPs but held their possessions for ransom.

Members of the opposition factions, once under Operation Olive Branch, detained several civilians in their command centers and later contacted their families demanding ransoms for their release. In some cases, the ransoms reached 10 million Syrian Pounds.

On September 15, two Trinamul women candidates who won in the North Dinajpur Panchayat Samiti (Uttar Dinajpur district, West Bengal) were kidnapped ahead of the board's formation. Their families claimed a party rebel is involved in the incident.
QSD raided a residential house in Basira in southern Deir-ez-Zor countryside and arrested 3 young men over accusations of trafficking and promoting the use of prohibited substances.
On September 14, unknown gunmen abducted a civilian on the Samnu-Jufra road (coded as Samnu at geoprecision 2).

14 September. Reverend Okafor was detained by suspected members of the anti-robbery squad who appeared to be wearing police uniforms in Nkanu west. Local police stations have denied involvement in the event. Okafor was due to testify on a panel regarding the murder of the Ogbozinne village's traditional leader. He blamed the police for not protecting the leader.
Around 13 Sept 2018, near Pangsang, Wa SAD, Shan State, the United Wa State Army (UWSA) announced the demolition of unauthorized Christian churches and arrested some clergy members for questioning.

actor1: MNLC: National Movement for the Liberation of the Central African Republic
notes: 13 September. MNLC and 3R ambushed a telecommunications convoy in Kounpala, Paoua. They detained five people and robbed them before releasing them later that day in Ndim.

Arrests: National Liberation Front fighters carried out a series of raids and arrests in Urum al-Kubra in Aleppo. An unknown number of civilians were reportedly arrested on charges of cooperating and seeking reconciliation with the regime.
12 September. The traditional leader of Wututu was kidnapped by armed men. The military freed him on 14 September, however, he sustained a bullet injury during the military's attack on his captors.

On 11 September 2018, two Indonesian fishermen were kidnapped by the Abu Sayyaf group off the coast of Semporna town (Tawau, Sabah) and brought to Sulu. One of those captured was later released on 5 December 2018.

Between September 9 and 11, a 11-year-old albino children was kidnaped from his house in the district of Lichinga by un unknown armed group. Though the source lists the perpetrator as unknown, Ahlu Sunna has been active in the area.

Between September 9 and 11, a 4-year-old albino children was kidnaped from his house in the district of Cuamba by un unknown armed group. Though the source lists the perpetrator as unknown, Ahlu Sunna has been active in the area.
A local elections observer, student Aisa Khulaeva who made a video of ballot-stuffing in Kalmykia, disappeared. She was last seen in investigator's office on 10 September.
Former Operation Olive Branch faction forces arrested over 45 residents of Sihriyanli township and took them to an undisclosed location.

On September 8, the IOM announced via its Twitter feed that one of its national staff members had been abducted by unknown gunmen in the capital city of Sanaa. The organisation expressed deep concerns about the safety of its employee.
On 7 Sept 2018, soldiers from the Myanmar army detained one villager and forced him to serve as a guide while marching towards Ang Bum village in Hpakant township, Kachin State.
QSD and Asayish security forces carried out raids from ar-Raqqa to al-Tabqa in Raqaa province in search of Islamic State sleeper cells. Several individuals were arrested as part of the raids.
QSD forces arrested individuals who were planning on standing for local council elections under the regime in the town of Quamishli.

On 5 September 2018, around 100 Myanmar army soldiers from LID 33 inspected houses in Loi Seng and Kahtan Yang villages (Hpakant Township, Kachin State). One villager was taken and forced to serve as a guide and another one was arrested. There has been no information about their whereabouts since.

actor1: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
notes: 05 September. A man was kidnapped by FPRC members in Bria, UN forces in the town later negotiated his release. According to local sources, the FPRC searched IDP camps in the area to find members of the Anti-Balaka.
5 September 2018: Al-Shabaab-linked militants reportedly detained 60 Elders from the Galguduud region after a dispute over blood money arose.
Unidentified individuals kidnapped 1 young man in Taqsis in southern Hama countryside.
04 September. The Fon of the Bafut kingdom was kidnapped by separatists who alleged he was supporting military efforts against the group. He was released by the assailants a few hours later.
On 3 Sept 2018, at Bum Ra in Hpakant township, Kachin State, soldiers from the Myanmar army detained two villagers and forced them serve as guides and lead them to Kyauk Pya village.

An unknown number of civilians were displaced from Afrin to Syrian Democratic Forces controlled areas in the east of the Euphrates in Deir-ez-Zor following the escalation in violence and arrests against civilians by rebel and Islamist factions who detained civilians under false accusations and force their families to pay ransoms in return for their release.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On September 3, presumed ISWAP militants abducted the mother and sister of an official, as well as a merchant, in Gueskerou, the latter was released for ransom.

assoc_actor_2: Cattle Traders (India); Police Forces of India (2014-)
notes: On 3 September, a group of Gau Rakshak Dal kidnapped a youth they accused of cow smuggling, in Sonipat district (Haryana). They along with local villagers beat him and shaved half of his head. Police eventually intervened and pacified the villagers.

It was reported on September 4, that the resident of Chechnya Azamat Baiduev, who arrived in Chechnya after being deported from Belgium and was taken by armed men on 1 September following his arrival to Chechnya, was indeed detained by police for alleged ties with militants. Earlier, when news about his disappearance were spread, Amnesty International called on Russia to disclose his whereabouts. A criminal proceeding was launched against Baiduev.

actor1: SSPP/SSA-N: Shan State Progress Party/Shan State Army-North
notes: On 31 Aug 2018, the SSA-N arrested three displaced villagers from Mongmai village, Namtu Township, Shan State when they went back to check their cattle.
Hayat Tahrir al Sham fighters carried out a series of raids and arrests in Kelly in Idleb. 4 civilians were reportedly arrested on charges of cooperating with the regime.
31 August. 18 people kidnapped as LRA attacked Sili village in Ango territory (Bas-Uele).

On 31 Aug, militants abducted the son of a paramilitary trooper in the Bijbehara area (Anantnag, J&K). The abduction was reportedly in response to the earlier arrest of the father of an HM commander. He was released following the release of the commander's father by police, as well as the release of other captives held by militants.

Opposition factions, once under Operation Olive Branch, carried out an arrest campaign in Burj Haydar and surrounding areas in northern Aleppo countryside, following the YPG attack against opposition factions on 29 August, 2018. 25 individuals were arrested.
On August 30, unknown gunmen abducted the chief nurse in Sona, he was found later stripped of his cellphone and motorbike.
30 August. Judge Ekambi Alexander of the Ndop High Court was kidnapped from his home in Buea. Ambazonian Separatists are believed to be responsible for the kidnapping.
On 30 Aug, suspected militants abducted the relative of a policeman in Shopian district (J&K). The abduction was reportedly in response to the earlier arrest of the father of an HM commander.
On 30 Aug, suspected militants abducted four relatives of policemen in Pulwama district (J&K). The abductions were reportedly in response to the earlier arrest of the father of an HM commander.
On 30 Aug, suspected militants abducted five relatives of policemen in Kulgam district (J&K). The abductions were reportedly in response to the earlier arrest of the father of an HM commander.

JTW carried out raids in Basra in southern Idleb countryside against individuals either accused of collaborating with the regime to reach reconciliation or accused of belonging to IS cells. JTW arrested more than 35 individuals in all of Barsa, Tall al-Sheih, Halbe, Deir Sharqi, Tall al-Shaykh, and Maasaran.

JTW carried out raids in Deir Sharqi in southern Idleb countryside against individuals either accused of collaborating with the regime to reach reconciliation or accused of belonging to IS cells amid firing shots. While 1 school director was arrested in Deir Sharqi over accusations of collaborating with the regime, JTW arrested more than 35 individuals in all of Barsa, Tall al-Sheih, Halbe, Deir Sharqi, Tall al-Shaykh, and Maasaran.
HTS arrested 2 civilians, the relatives of a wanted individual, in Ghadqa in southern Idleb countryside.

JTW carried out raids in Halbeh in southern Idleb countryside against individuals either accused of collaborating with the regime to reach reconciliation or accused of belonging to IS cells. JTW arrested more than 35 individuals in all of Barsa, Tall al-Sheih, Halbe, Deir Sharqi, Tall al-Shaykh, and Maasaran.

JTW carried out raids in Tall al-Sheih in Ma'arrat An Nu'man area of southern Idleb countryside against individuals either accused of collaborating with the regime to reach reconciliation or accused of belonging to IS cells. JTW arrested more than 35 individuals in all of Barsa, Halbe, Deir Sharqi, Tall al-Shaykh, and Maasaran.

JTW carried out raids in Maasaran in southern Idleb countryside against individuals either accused of collaborating with the regime to reach reconciliation or accused of belonging to IS cells. JTW arrested more than 35 individuals in all of Barsa, Tall al-Sheih, Halbe, Deir Sharqi, Tall al-Shaykh, and Maasaran.

YPG arrested 4 civilians from their residences in Ras al Ain in western al-Hasakeh countryside, including the head of the Ras al Ain local council and 3 others who are candidates in the elections for the regime initiative of the self administration.

JTW carried out raids in Tall al-Shaykh in southern Idleb countryside against individuals either accused of collaborating with the regime to reach reconciliation or accused of belonging to IS cells. JTW arrested more than 35 individuals in all of Barsa, Tall al-Sheih, Halbe, Deir Sharqi, Tall al-Shaykh, and Maasaran.

Around 29 Aug 2018, in Narbon and Kawnghong villages, Namtu Township, Shan State, soldiers from the Northern Alliance arrested the village headmen for 24 hours because he did not report the movements of the Myanmar army to them.
On 29 Aug, suspected militants abducted the son of a policeman in Tral (Pulwama, J&K). The abduction was reportedly in response to the earlier arrest of the father of an HM commander.
On 28 Aug 2018, at Nawng Heng village and Man Mau village, Kutkai Township, Shan State, Myanmar army soldiers forced six villagers to guide them. The whereabouts of the villagers remain unknown.
28 August. Seven civilians (two women and five men) were kidnapped by the Siriri in Gamboula. Three have been released while four remain captive.

An unidentified gunman reportedly kidnapped a 12 year old IDP child from Hudaydah governorate in Dar Sad of Aden port city, southwestern Yemen, but left the child on a bus after he started being chased by relatives of the latter.
27 August. 21 people kidnapped as LRA attacked Sili village in Ango territory (Bas-Uele).
27 August. The chief of Bera was kidnapped. The attackers are believed to belong to the Siriri Coalition.

HTS fighters continued to carry out raids across Idleb province in the towns of Kafr Hind, Tal Ammar, Darkosh, and Azmarin where they arrested over 23 individuals accused of being Islamic State sleeper cell members.

HTS fighters continued to carry out raids across Idleb province in the towns of Kafr Hind, Tal Ammar, Darkosh, and Azmarin where they arrested over 23 individuals accused of being Islamic State sleeper cell members.

assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
notes: A MSD member from Bugendana Displaced Persons Camp in Gitega province was abducted in a vehicle of the provincial police from Mukoro on 26 August 2018.
26 August. LRA elements killed two policemen in the town of Banda in Bas-Uele before taking 30 people hostage. Coded as two separate events.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On August 25, presumed ISWAP militants abducted the village chief of Baroua, he was released the following day.

On August 25th, five children were abducted by an unknown armed group in three events on the road between Jebel Mulak and Korangeref (coordinates for Torit, Eastern Equatoria, used). The gunmen stopped vehicles to adbuct the children, though returned a young child to its mother in one incident, taking the total number of abductees to four. Torit police reported that three of the children were of the Lotuku ethnic group.

A group of unidentified gunmen reportedly kidnapped a 16 year old girl in Kud Bihan area of Umar al Mukhtar neighbourhood in Aden port city, southwestern Yemen. No casualties were reported and the reasons behind the kidnapping are unknown.
YPG forces arrested several civilians in the suburbs of Abu Hamam following Islamic State attacks in the area.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 23 August. An unidentified armed group abducted two civilians from Kitchanga, Rutshuru.
On 21 August, the President of the Court of First Instance in Wum was kidnapped on the Bamenda-Wum highway by suspected separatists.
20 August. LRA members abducted five men and looted food goods from the Yangou Issi mine. The coordinates are approximate.
20 August. LRA qbducted an unknown number of men and looted clothing and food from the Kotto 2 mining area.

Peoples Protection Units fighters carried out a series of raids and arrests in the countryside of Ras Al Ain in Al-Hasakeh. 40 civilians running in the regime's local councils elections were arrested in the raids.
20 August. LRA members kidnapped 15 men and looted the Yangou Brindi mines in Sam Ouandja.
On 20-August-2018 civilians on 3 buses were abducted by Taliban militants on the Kunduz-Takhar highway in the Naekpai region of Khan Abad district, Kunduz province.

assoc_actor_2: Chandio Communal Group (Pakistan); Voice for Missing Persons of Sindh
notes: On Aug 20, men in plainclothes arrived in 12 vehicles to a home in Hyderabad town (Sindh) and forcibly kidnapped 3 men of the Chandio community who were also related to a known Voice for Missing Persons of Sindh activists. Some groups accused law enforcement of the kidnappings.
In the week prior to 22 August 2018, Operation Olive Branch fighters arrested a number of civilians in the Afrin area in order to extract bribes from family members. No fatalities were reported.
Syrian Democratic Forces carried out a series of raids and arrests in Ar-Raqqa city. 20 young men were arrested in the raids.

Hayat Tahrir al Sham fighters carried out a series of raids and arrests in Azmarin in Idleb. An unknown number of civilians were reportedly arrested on allegations of cooperating and seeking reconciliation with the regime.

Hayat Tahrir al Sham fighters carried out a series of raids and arrests in the villages of Jabal Shashabo in Idleb. An unknown number of civilians were reportedly arrested on allegations of cooperating and seeking reconciliation with the regime.

Peoples Protection Units fighters carried out a series of raids and arrests in the countryside of Quamishli in Al-Hasakeh. Unknown number of civilians running in the regime's local councils elections were arrested in the raids.

Hayat Tahrir al Sham fighters carried out a series of raids and arrests in Salqin in Idleb. An unknown number of civilians were reportedly arrested on allegations of cooperating and seeking reconciliation with the regime.

assoc_actor_2: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
notes: On August 19, four employees of the Red Cross have been kidnapped by a group of Hapa Na Pale Mayi Mayi militants in Tanganyika province. The incident occurred in Mponda Luganza, within Kongolo territory.
YPG forces arrested a number of individuals who were standing in local elections for positions within the regime's administration of the city of Quamishli.

actor1: KIO/KIA: Kachin Independence Organization/Kachin Independence Army
assoc_actor_2: Shan Ethnic Group (Myanmar); Kachin Ethnic Group (Myanmar)
notes: On 17-August-2018, in Talawgyi, Myitkyina township, Kachin state, the KIA detained four villagers for the alleged purposes of forcing them to join the KIA. Three of the people were Shan and therefore later released. The Kachin individual is still detained.

actor1: PSLF/TNLA: Palaung State Liberation Front/Ta'ang National Liberation Army
notes: On 17-August-2018, in Namhkan township, Shan state, the TNLA arrested a woman at gunpoint at her home. She is still being detained and is accused of being an informant for the military, an accusation her family denies.

source: The Philippine Star; Thai News Service
notes: A police officer assumed to be off-duty and two civilians were kidnapped by alleged NPA fighters at Iligan City, Lanao del Norte province sometime around August 16.
On 16 August, the first assistant mayor of the Ndop council, Nkoketunjia Division of the North West region was reportedly abducted by unidentified armed men.
On August 15, Dozos abducted two civilians in the area of Kalala, one was released against ransom while the other remains missing.

Hayat Tahrir al Sham fighters carried out a series of raids and arrests in Maaret Harma in Idleb. 18 civilians were reportedly arrested on charges of cooperating and seeking reconciliation with the regime.
On August 15, Angolan military were accused of kidnapping more than 50 DRC civilians in Veve village, Kakongo sector, Lukula territory.

Islamic State fighters carried out a series of raids and arrests in As-Sweida in search for civilians wanted by the regime, following the arrest of an number of people by the regime on suspicion of collaborating with Islamic State. An unknown number of civilians were reportedly arrested in the raids.
On 14 August, a greek tanker carrying 17 Georgian sailors was possibly attacked and the sailors kidnapped by pirates in Gabonese waters.
HTS and JTW detained 10 individuals accused of being members of IS sleeper cells in the western Aleppo countryside in Jebel Saman district.
YPG arrested a leader in the regime's Ba'th party at the al-Sabbagh roundabout at the northern entrance of al-Hasakeh city.
2 individuals, 1 man and 1 woman, were arrested in Jarablus in eastern Aleppo countryside by an unidentified armed group over accusations of planning bombing attack.
HTS and JTW detained several individuals in areas in Idleb countryside including in Ma'rrat An Nu'man accused of cooperating with the regime and seeking reconciliation agreements.
13 August. Unknown gunmen kidnapped a doctor in Imuahia, Abia state capital. Protests erupted three days later by members of the Nigeria Medical Association to protest his abduction.
On Aug 12, a Union Parishad member was kidnapped by unidentified armed men from his house in Chittagong's Lohagara upazila. Suspected to be politically motivated.
On 11 August, the chief of the Naga health center, Darak, was kidnapped by Boko Haram men.
On 11 August, BH men kidnapped a woman in Gore Djidda, 26km from Makary, close to the Lake Chad.
Islamist factions operating as part of Operation Olive Branch continued to carry out security measures in the Afrin area which included arresting residents.
HTS forces carried out a campaign of arrests in the village of Dadikh.
HTS forces carried out a campaign of arrests in the village of Jabal Shashabo.
10 August. Al Shabaab kidnapped 18 Gaaljecel clan civilians in Ceel Cali.
On Aug 10, unidentified assailants kidnapped a woman belonging to a unspecified religious minorities held a protest in Mehar town (Dadu District, Sindh).

HTS carried out raids in Ferwan in southern Idleb countryside as part of a larger arrest campaign in search for IS cells as well as individuals advocating reconciliation agreements with the regime. Several people were arrested.

HTS carried out raids in Hazano in southern Idleb countryside as part of a larger arrest campaign in search for IS cells as well as individuals advocating reconciliation agreements with the regime. Several people were arrested.

HTS carried out raids in Maar Dibsi in southern Idleb countryside as part of a larger arrest campaign in search for IS cells as well as individuals advocating reconciliation agreements with the regime. Several people were arrested.

HTS carried out raids in Maasaran in southern Idleb countryside as part of a larger arrest campaign in search for IS cells as well as individuals advocating reconciliation agreements with the regime. Several people were arrested.
Armed factions, once under Operation Olive Branch, detained numerous civilians in order to collect ransom from their families for them to be released.

HTS carried out raids in Tal Tuqan and Samakah in southern Idleb countryside as part of a larger arrest campaign in search for IS cells as well as individuals advocating reconciliation agreements with the regime. Several people were arrested.
Police forces reportedly raided civilian homes and abducted three civilian men in the Kutcha area of Larkana District on the evening of Aug 9. The police denied the claims.
On August 9, unknown gunmen abducted a civilian on the Jufra-Bawanis road (coded as Bawanis at geoprecision 2)
On August 9, two fishermen on their way to fishing were kidnapped by the Mai-Mai Charles, near Magiso village, Rutshuru territory.
9 August 2018, 5 members of the Somali Red Crescent Society were reportedly kidnapped by suspected Al-Shabaab militiamen in Busle village located on the outskirts of Baidoa.

actor1: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
notes: On August 9, FDLR-RUD militants attacked a vehicle from the Norwegian NGO NRC near Ngwenda village, Rutshuru territory. The attackers abducted six of the Ngo workers and released them on the same day.
On 8 Aug, a youth was kidnapped from his home in Hawoora (Kulgam, J&K) by suspected militants, having been accused of informing. He was assaulted and later released.
During the week of 6 August, a man went missing and unknown armed men carried out six arbitrary arrests.

On August 8th, Bashir Ahmed - a human rights activist - was taken by an unidentified armed group in Yambio (Western Equatoria). His family believe the gunmen were part of the government security forces, although they were not wearing uniforms.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 07 August. An unidentified armed group abducted 15 people from the Mwalika/Ngerere area of Oicha.

Syria Liberation Front fighters carried out a series of raids and arrests in the north-western countryside of Hama. 50 civilians, mostly government employees, were reportedly arrested on charges of seeking reconciliation with the regime and the deployment of Russian police in the area.
Peoples Protection Units fighters arrested an unknown number of men in Quamishli to force them to take part in the building of a tunnel in the town.

On 5 Aug, a resident of Goniana Khurd, Bathinda, Punjab was beaten and held hostage by employees of SAD MLA Deep Malhotra. There had been several tense exchanges between villagers of Goniana Khurd and the MLAs employees, but the reason for tension is unclear.

On 5 August, unidentified attackers raided a house in Kuwadzana, searching for MDC activists. They did not find the MDC activists, but they abducted some of the residents and drove them around Kuwadzana beating them.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
assoc_actor_2: Government of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

On 4 August, the Divisional Officer of the Menchum valley was kidnapped by armed men on the Bamenda - Wum road. He was freed two days later.
03 August. NDC-R arrested 150 civilians in Kasugho over non-payment of taxes to the group.

On 3 August, according to a report issued by the Swedish-based Somali website, Somaliweyn, Al-Shabaab militants forcefully abducted a 6 year old girl with albinoism from her home in Harbole town, Gedo region. No further info.

On 1 August, a child was reportedly abducted by unidentified gunmen in the Arafat village, Yaqhshid district. According to the source, the 12 year old girl was abducted by unidentified gunmen who then demanded ransom from her parents. No further info.
Since 31-July-2018, near Namtu township, five villagers have been missing and are presumed to have been detained by one of the armed groups in the area.
On 31-July-2018 16 civilians were kidnapped by unidentified militants on the Kabul-Paktia highway, Kabul province.

The Taliban abducted a money-changer and held him for ransom sometime on or before July 31 in the Zarghoonshah village, Mohammad Agha District, Logar Province. He was rescued by ANA forces, as reported on July 31. Another source reported he was killed by unidentified gunmen.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

The Taliban kidnapped 9 civilian passengers of a car in the Lali Tangi area of Shekh Ali District, Parwan Province on the evening of July 29. They released 2 the next day.

On July 25, MSA militiamen abducted a marabout and his student in the area of Tin Techori.
On July 25, unidentified assailants kidnapped the presiding officer of a polling station in Chaman area of Balochistan's Killa Abdullah district.

Unidentified gunmen kidnapped 6 civilians (a doctor, his driver, and 4 university students; 3 women are among the 6) in Ghor Province, as reported on July 24.
On 24th July, gunmen abducted two farmers from Dobo Umda (North Darfur). The whereabouts of the victims is unknown.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

As reported on July 23, 8 PML-N activists were arrested after reports that they assaulted a family, kidnapped them, and tore the clothing of three women, for allegedly supporting the PTI. Multiple members of the family were injured.

23 July. Gaaljecel militias abducted a civilian from Jajeele clan as part of a dispute over 4 missing camels which is under discussion between the 2 sides. Influential clan elders from Galjecel clan attempted to free the abducted man.
On 23 July, a LRA group attacked the village of Ligoua, Haut-Mbomou, abducting 6 people.
On 22-July-2018, near Hka Hkye Tang Jang hill, Mansi township, Kachin state, the Myanmar military abducted two male civilians to use as guides.
The Taliban kidnapped at least 6 civilians in Dawlat Yar District, Ghor Province, a few days prior to July 25. They were released on that day via tribal elders' mediation.
On 22 July, in Tsaratanana, Dahalo militants kidnapped 6 government employees.
On 22 July 11 civilians were kidnapped by Boko Haram militants in Greya, Extreme-Nord. The victims were later released by the army. No fatalities were reported.

22 July. An 18-year-old boy was abducted by al Shabaab militants near Camaara village in south Mudug. It was believed that the motive behind the incident was recruitment to al Shabaab militants. Many families fled with their children from the area for fear of al Shabaab conscription.

22 July. Al Shabaab fighters abducted about 26 civilians from Abaqsole village (c. 20 km east of Garasweyne village). The arrest was in relation to the armed confrontation between SNA and al Shabaab fighters earlier that day near Warshiidle Village. Al Shabaab accused the civilian of collaborating and providing information to SNA soldiers. Al Shabaab fighters took the detained civilians to Garasweyne village (c. 48 km north west of Xudur).
On 22 July, BH men attacked the Souargue village, Hile Alifa, one man kidnapped.
On 20th July, the SPLA abducted 6 civilians at Jaguar (Unity state, approximate coordinates used), according to the SPLM-IO.
Syrian Democratic Forces carried out a series of raids and arrests in Zir in Deir-ez-Zor province. 30 civilians were reportedly arrested and their weapons confiscated during the raids.
20 July. NDC-R arrested 45 civilians in Kasugho over non-payment of taxes to the group. Civilians were released later
On July 20, unknown attackers kidnapped eight men and three women who were accused of collaborating with the FARDC to identify their position.

HTS detained 900 displaced civilians from Foah and Kafraya at Al-Eis crossing in Aleppo after regime forces failed to send to Idleb detainees they released as part of the Foah and Kafraya agreement. The detainees reportedly refused to be displaced to rebel-controlled areas in the north and chose to stay and settle their situation in regime-controlled areas.

HTS arrested 20 young men who had recently arrived from Dar'a to Idleb city as part of the Russian-Turkish agreement. The young men were arrested after they told Idleb residents that they were recently arrested by regime forces, which angered residents whose family members were not included in the released detainees list, despite spending years in regime prisons.
19 July. Mayi Mayi Raia Mutomboki (Kazimoto factions) kidnapped 15 civilians in Nyambembe
Taliban militants abducted 12 de-miners from a company in Dara I Pech District, Kunar Province, as reported on July 19.

They did not demand anything and it was unclear from the report why they kidnapped him.
18 July. Al Shabaab fighters kidnapped three village chiefs from Shatilow, Cadaley (coordinates approx) and Barkale villages (coordinates approx) (c. 15 km north west of Luuq District).

notes: On 09 June 2018, The wife of Leonid Makhinya, leader of the Volgograd branch of the party The Other Russia, reported the activist's disappearance. Supporters suspect that security forces abducted Leonid Makhinya in Volgograd for his activism.
On June 8, unknown gunmen abducted a civilian in Arlit, the victim is believed to have informed authorities about the presence of an arms cache previously discovered near Tahoua.
On 7 June a pro-Kadaga NRM youth disappeared. It is believed that he was abducted by security agents. He is feared to be dead.
On 7 June, a group of LRA combatants ambushed, looted, and abducted 2 cyclists in Koumboli, Zemio. They were later released.

On 6 June, a man was abducted by armed men at the small center of the Gasenyi area in Buganda commune of Cibitoke province. The inhabitants suspect Imbonerakure with the complicity of the head of the Gasenyi area.
On 6 June, a young man of the IX district in the Ngagara zone in Ntahangwa commune of the Bujumbura Town Hall, was kidnapped by men in a Jeep. The reasons for this abduction are still unknown.
Taliban militants took 18 tribal elders hostage in Laja Mangal District, Paktia Province, in an attempt to keep them from participating in upcoming elections.
Suspected Taliban militants abducted a female candidate for district council election and her brother in Darqad District, Takhar Province, on June 5.
Raqqa Internal Security Forces kidnapped an unknown number of young men from Ar-Raqqa and its countrysides to conscript them into security services.
On June 3, presumed Ansaroul Islam militants abducted a pastor, his son and daughter-in-law in Belehoro (Arbinda), Soum Province. The three were later released on Malian territory.
On 3 June, an ex-FAB member was abducted in Rukeco, Busiga commune, Ngozi province. His family fears he was kidnapped by the Burundian secret service but this was not confirmed.

Unidentified gunmen kidnapped a soldier of the 22nd Brigade Kamal Al Musanaf in 26 September street in Taiz city and took him to an unknown destination during the night. It seems like he was off duty.
Syrian Democratic Forces carried out a series of raids and arrests among civilians in Sweidan Jazira in Al-Hasakeh. A refugee from Iraq was arrested during the raids. No fatalities reported.

Hayat Tahrir al Sham raided civilian homes and areas in northern countryside of Idlib. An unknown number of people were arrested in the raids on charges of being members of the Islamic State, but no casualties reported.
On 1 June, the village chief of Wakassao, Touboro, was reportedly kidnapped by a Cameroonian soldier, as he refused to pay the traditional tax to the traditional chief.
On June 1, the Mayi Mayi Mwenyemali abducted a 40 year old woman from Mugerero village, Uvira. The FARDC intervened after being alerted by the population but did not manage to stop them.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

HTS carried out search and arrest operations in Sarmada and several other areas in the western Idleb countryside following an attack by unknown gunmen against Sarmada Court. The security operation aimed at eliminating IS sleeper cells and resulted in the arrest of several individuals, some from eastern Syria, on charges of IS-affiliation.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

PKK militants stopped a truck carrying materials to a Turkish gendarmerie outpost, set it on fire, and kidnapped the driver in Tocular village of Diyarbakir province's Hani district on Tuesday, 29 May 2018.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

Greek police rescued them on May 29. Three foreign nationals, aged 19, 20 and 25, were arrested on suspicion of kidnapping and blackmail, among other charges.

QSD forces launched a campaign of arrests in al-Hasakeh province against individuals who had documented QSD human rights violations agaisnts. No casualties reported.
On 25 May, the principal of Bolifamba High School (Buea, South-West) was kidnapped by Ambazonian separatists.
On 25 May, the principal of the Baptist Academy of Muyuka (South-West) was kidnapped by Ambazonian separatists. He was freed on 29 May.

Upon his release from his abductors, the victim said that he had been held and beaten up by the security forces. It should be noted that the perpetrators wore uniform and masks without identification marks.

22 May. An Egyptian national working with fisheries for the past three months was abducted by unknown armed perpetrators in the proximity of Botaan hotel in Bossaso. The motive was unknown. Police were reported to be investigating.

On 22 May, nine people were abducted by an unidentified armed group in Tambura, Western Equatoria, and they were freed on 24 May. One of the victims was Acholi Cultural Institution premier Ambrose Olaa who had been consulting World Vision International on peacebuilding in South Sudan.
22 May. Wife of a commissioner in Zamfara and six children have been abducted by gunmen in the early hours of Tuesday at Gurbin Bore village, Zurmi LGA.
22 May. 47 travellers are kidnapped in the Birnin Gwari area in several incidents between the evening of 22 May and the morning of 23 May.
HTS fighters raided several areas in Idleb city and arrested 2 people on accusations of being IS sleeper-cell fighters involved in the assassinations in Idleb. No casualties reported.
On 21 May, two people were kidnapped in Batangafo by two armed men.

On May 21st 2018, in Mogilev, a journalist Alina Skarbunova has been abducted by plainclothes people who later were confirmed as police. The abduction and further detention was caused by alleged cooperation of the freelance journalist with BelSAT independent media service.

On May 20, presumed Ansaroul Islam militants abducted catechist Mathieu Sawadogo and his wife in the area of Basnere, Soum Province, Sawadogo is a religious leader within the Catholic community of Arbinda (Diocese of Dori).
On May 19, presumed Ansaroul Islam militants abducted a relative of the first deputy mayor in Baraboule on suspicion of cooperation with security forces.
On 19 May, Mayi Mayi militia from the DRC kidnapped 6 Ugandan fishermen who were fishing on Lake Edward, near Rweshama village.
On 19 May, the Bangem mayor and two of his staff members were kidnapped by some armed men, while distributing some pro-government gadgets for the 20 May celebration.
