On May 11, Jonathan Suleimane, member of Renamo, was kidnapped in Quelimane by unidentified people who spoke Shangana, a language of the region of southern Mozambique. He reappeared on May 19, after being released by his kidnappers in Nicoadala, who demanded a ransom.

On May 11, unknown gunmen aboard motorbikes abducted the mayor of Inadjatafane, the former mayor of Boni and a councillor of the education academy of Douentza between Douentza and Bore, the vehicle they were travelling in was also seized by the assailants.
On 11 May, a man not respecting the "dead city" day imposed by separatists was kidnapped by unidentified men in Widikum, North-Ouest.

On 8 May 2018, the head of the Kremenets city branch of the far-right Right Sector movement, Vitaliy Konyk, has disappeared without trace in Ternopil region. According to Right Sector, Kremenets mayor could be involved in the disappearance since Konyk regularly received threats from the people linked to the mayor as he investigated a case regarding corruption in the Kremenets city council.

On the same day, in Kise, Rutshuru, unidentifed gunmen abducted two people. One of the hostages managed to escape but the other one did not. The ransom increased from $500 per person to $1.500.

source: Anadolu Agency; Afghan Islamic Press news agency
notes: On May 6th, 7 employees of an Indian power transmitter company, 6 of them Indian nationals and 1 Afghan citizen, were kidnapped by Taliban militants while they were working in the Khwaja Alwan area near Pul-e Khumri city.

Members of Hamza Brigade in Al Bab city in Aleppo entered Al Hekma and Al Salam hospitals, abducting a nurse from Al Salam, assaulted other hospital staff, and causing the closure of Al Salam hospital. No fatalities reported.
On 4 May (date remains unclear), unidentified armed group abducted a farmer in Saga, Nertiti, Central Darfur.

On May 3, presumed Ansaroul Islam militants abducted Red Cross (Burkina Faso) employee Bayala Bernard and seized the vehicle he was travelling in near Belehede, between Djibo and Arbinda. He was freed five days later in Nassoumbou area.

On May 3, Mayi-Mayi Mwenyemali abucted two people from Kibanga, Uvira.

As reported on May 09 2018, 50 migrants were kidnapped and had been held hostage in abandoned buildings east of Thessaloniki six days earlier, although some were more recent arrivals. They were forced to demand money from their families. There were 38 Pakistanis, 10 Bangladeshis and two Sri Lankans, who were in bad physical condition, having been given minimal food and water. One man required hospitalisation for pneumonia and dehydration. Two Pakistani men were arrested for kidnapping and blackmail among other charges. Greek police rescued them on May 9.
On May 2, presumed Ansaroul Islam militants attempted to abduct a civilian near Nassoumbou.
02 May. Unidentified actors abducted a German Red Cross nurse in Mogadishu. Another Red Cross worker was assassinated on 28/04.
Around 1 May, the village chief of Kalama, Makary was kidnapped by Boko Haram. He was freed on 6 May after a ransom was paid.

On 30 April, armed separatists attacked the Ashing school, Belo (North-West), abducting the principal and the chaplain. The chaplain was later released but the principal has not been found.

Late April, 2018: Seven refugees, crossing the Evros River were kidnapped by masked men upon their arrival on the Greek side. They were put in a van from which they could not see the road, returned to the river, robbed, and shipped back to Turkey with a rubber boat.
On 27 April, a Metallubia Company employee was abudcted by three men - two in police uniform and one in civilian clothing from Ntahangwa commune, Bujumbura Mairie.

On 25 April, ten South Sudanese humanitarian aid workers disappeared, when their convoy was driving from Yei to Tore in Central Equatoria. The staff worked for UNOCHA, UNICEF, South Sudanese Development Organization, ACROSS, Plan International and Action Africa Help. They were released unharmed on 30 April 2018. Neither the government nor a rebel group has claimed the responsibility for the disappearance.

On April 25; the subprefect of Hombori was abducted by unknown gunmen on the road towards Douentza while en route to Mopti and the vehicle he was travelling seized, he was later found abandoned, safe and sound.

On 24 August 2018, the opposition-affiliated Al Bab City Penalty Court trialed the man and subsequently sentenced him to 6 months in prison and a 5,000 TRY fine.
On Apr 24, three journalists were kidnapped in Zakho district, in Duhok, after they criticised the Turkish airstrikes in Iraqi Kurdistan.

On April 22, an Islamist militia attacked again Diaca Velha, Cabo Delgado. Three people are believed to have been kidnapped. 30 accomplices were later arrested by police.

On April 6, 10 unidentified armed men broke into the house of Kavingu's cell chief in Beni and abducted him.
On April 5, presumed Ansaroul Islam militants on motorbikes abducted the municipal councillor of Gomde-Fulbe who also is the village chief of Basnere in his home village in Djibo.

Turkish forces and their Operation Olive Branch allies carried out a campaign of arrests in the captured areas of Afrin district. Young men were arrested on charges of belonging to armed Kurdish sleeper cells.

assoc_actor_2: Christian Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); ADECO: Alliance of Congolese Democrats
notes: On April 5, Mayi Mayi Wemba stopped a convoy with ADECO Christians, who were leaving for a pilgrimage. 37 people were abducted.
On 04-April-2018, in Ting Rat Hka, Myitkyina, the Myanmar army 298th LIB forced two village elders to serve as guides.

For the second time in a week, militants broke into a residential home in the Hajan area of Sonawari tehsil, Bandipora District on the night of Apr 4. One man was injured while his son was abducted. Police suspected LeT, but the group released a statement denying involvement.
On April 3, Dozos abducted 7 Fulani herdsmen in Boky-Were, demanding ransom for their release.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

assoc_actor_2: Kurdish Reform Movement; KNC: Kurdish National Council
notes: Kurdish Asayish forces in Quamishli city arrested Faisal Yousef, the general coordinator of the Kurdish Reform Movement and a member of the Presidential Committee of the Kurdish National Council. Asayish forces reportedly took Yousef to an Asayish center in the area, causing much tension with members and supporters of the Movement in the area. The arrest took place in teh context of previous arrests by Asayish of leaders and other members of Kurdish political parties active in the area.

assoc_actor_1: Operation Olive Branch; Opposition Rebels (Syria); Islamist Militia (Syria)

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

02 April. Two civilian men were abducted at the centre of Garowe city by Issa Mohamoud militia. The abducted men hailed from Isaaq clan. The kidnapping was related to revenge.
On 2 April, BJP activists were driven out of their office at gun point by an unidentified group in Sainthia town, West Bengal. The incident occurred in the build up to the panchayat elections.
02 April. A PDP Senator's constituents, protesting "negligent and abandonment" abduct the politician in Baianga. Military forces rescued the Senator without violence.
On 2 April, unidentified gunmen kidnapped one person in Zalingei. No injuries.
On 1 April, a group of presumed LRA kidnapped 18 civilians in Bozongui in Obo and looted radios, food and tools.

31 March. Ambazonian Separatists abducted three chiefs from Widikum. The chiefs were accused of supporting government efforts against the separatists. The chiefs were released on 04/04.
On 31 March, an alleged LRA group abducted 4 hunters in Obo surroundings.

Unidentified armed men stormed the office of Al-Shomou - a foundation close to the muslim brotherhood, and forcibly kidnapped 7 journalists. The same office was torched on 1 March 2018.

The SPLA/M also suspected two of the detained being government security agents, but released all aid workers on 15 April 2018. No fatalities or injuries.
On March 25, the Mayi-Mayi Mazimano broke into a house in Simba village, close to Lemera, in Uvira, and kidnapped a man, for whom they demanded a $1,500 ransom.
Salafi Imam Salih Mansur was injured in an attempted assassination outside a mosque in Shibam district of Hadramawt.

On March 9, a group of gunmen aboard motorbikes, presumably Ansaroul Islam militants abducted a villager in Douhoure (Koutougou).

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition

YPG forces arrested two men in al-Hasakeh with the intent of forcing them into recruitment for the group.

18 employees of a gorilla sanctuary were kidnapped on March 5 from the Kahuzi-Biega National Park. The responsible actor is the Mayi Mayi Raia Mutomboki and the kidnapped people include 9 administrative employees and 9 guards. The kidnappers are demanding a large ransom, which is being negotiated.

On 5 March, an alleged LRA group comprised of men, women and children abducted a young man and looted granaries in Yangou Baindji, CAR. Later, they robbed a motorcyclist of his belongings on the Sam-Ouandja road.

Unknown gunmen ambushed a construction company vehicle between Bari and Madeu areas of Amadi state, burning down the vehicle and abducting seven passengers on 20/02. Local authorities accused armed opposition forces in the area.

A youth leader is kidnapped by "Iceland" gunmen in Udianga Enem community, Etim Ekpo Local Government Area. It was gathered the Iceland members, popularly called The Red, had been attempting to avenge the murder of their leader, Akaniyene Jumbo (Iso Akpafid), who was ambushed and killed by security agents.
Boko Haram attacks a girl's school in Dapchi, abducts 110 students.

One day after shooting in Kizlar on 18th, two local male residents disappeared. Their relatives were informed that they were arrested four days later. One of the relatives of one of the detainees, a witness of his detention, claimed that police found guns and a grenade in their house, but nobody did see them finding it.

Unknown gunmen set up a fake checkpoint and abducted eight civilians on the road between Jalu and Kufra.

On February 16, the LRA attacked the localities of Mobili and Wepa, pillaging houses and kidnapping 7 civilians (2 others are disappeared).

An LRA group composed of men, women, and children ambushed 7 people on 3 motorcycles. The assaillants looted the motorcyclists of their goods, including clothes and money. The LRA group released 4 of the 7 travelers, but abducted the 3 others, all men.
12 adults were abducted from the communities of Ngui 1 and Ngui 2, CAR. They were later released , but the child, a 12-year-old boy, remains in captivity.

Rebel factions, possibly belonging to HTS, in Idleb city arrested opposition delegates for their participation in Russian Sochi peace talks.

The New People's Army harassed residents (used them as human shields) of Barangay Langgawisan, Maragusan town, Compostela Valley on 6 February. There were no reported casualties. Thousands of residents of Barangay Langgawisan fled their village due to the harrassment.

Two journalists, Hassan al-Bana Mubarak and Mostafa al-Aasar, disappeared as they were heading to their work place in Dokki. The families believe that there sons disappeared forcibly. One of the two is reportedly held in National Security HQs in Giza province.

On Feb 2, Rasul Tatamgadijev disappeared. His family claimed that he was kidnapped and authorities bear responsibility. His advocate said that he was stopped by several individuals, who presented themselves as law enforcers, forced into a car and taken away. No more information about him has emerged yet.

Unidentified gunmen on 1/02 kidnapped a resident of East Darfur State capital, Ed-Daein from his home and took him to an unknown destination. He was released a week later, while the abductors were arrested in West Darfur.

On Feb 1, Ali Umarov, a resident of Makhachkala, Dagestan, disappeared. His family claimed that he was kidnapped and authorities bear responsibility. On Feb 5. he re-appeared on a local police station and confessed to illegal possession of a pistol; his lawyer thinks that he was forced to do so.
The sub-prefect and his staff were kidnapped. They were subsequently freed by the security forces.
Islamic State militants abducted two shepherds and seized 500 sheep in the area of Albu Hassan, not far from the provincial border of Salahuddin and Diyala.

Al Shabaab fighters burnt food carried by locals on a rickshaw at Weley (c. 40 km west of Wajid district). The food was transported from Ceel Boon to Wajid town. Al Shabaab fighters arrested three people. Al Shabaab fighters banned the transportation of commodities to towns under the control of ENDF AMISOM forces in the region.

3 people kidnapped in Toukoumaya, Waza.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

Al Shabaab fighters abducted two civilians hailing from Rahwayn Geeledle clan in Bulla Gumar (c. 08 km south west of Qansaxdheere) at midnight. The motive behind the abduction was not clear. They were transferred to an unknown location.

Boko Haram abducts 31 logging workers as they travelled outside of Gambaru.

actor1: Police Forces of Afghanistan (2004-) Afghan Local Police
notes: It was reported on January 4, 2018, that 2 ALP members were detained on charges of kidnapping a shopkeeper in Muqur District, Ghazni Province (unknown when the kidnapping happened - coded as over the previous week).

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: SPLA-IO rebels allegedly kidnapped a retired chief from Bieh state on his way from Yuai to Pieri. The chief is a brother of the government appointed governor of Bieh state, Moses Majok Gatluak.
A university student from Benghazi university was kidnapped by unidentified gunmen.
On December 30th, the Raia Mutomboki-Kabazimiya kidnapped three men from the village of Ndese, in Shabunda.
Unknown gunmen kidnapped a member of the Taraba state House of Assembly representing Takum. The politician was abducted on Saturday at about 8 45pm in his house in Takum.
BIFF rebels kidnapped 6 Teduray Lumad in Datu Hoffer, Maguindanao on 29 December. 4 of them escaped.
On 28 Dec 2017, suspected New People's Army (NPA) members abducted a high ranking police officer (assumed off duty) at a restaurant in the poblacion area of President Roxas, North Cotabato.

The Taliban kidnapped the police chief of Arghanj Khwah District while he was on his way home in Yaftali Sufla District, Badakshan Province, on December 28, 2017. He was released 3 days later on December 30, 2017, for 300,000 afghanis ransom.
IS militants kidnapped an imam from Shirin Tagab District, Faryab Province, some time before January 1, 2018 (coded as the previous week). He was taken to Darzab District and held in IS custody.
On 27 December, Boko Haram elements kidnapped a 10-years-old child in Bia, Mayo Sava.
Unknown gunmen abducted a member of the armed forces of the former regime in Alexandria.
The ruler of Mgbuolua in Rundele community in Emohua Local Government Area of Rivers State is kidnapped by unidentified gunmen the morning of 26/12.
The Raia Mutomboki-Kizamoto attacked the village of Niabembe, in Sabunda, on December 25th. Apart from looting several goods such as phones and gold, they also abducted 2 men.

Asayish forces carried out a raid in Ghwyran neighborhood of Al-Hasakeh city, arresting several young men and taking them to an unknown destination for forced recruitment. Asayish have reportedly been increasing arrests of young men in the city and Al-Hasakeh countryside in order to enroll them in "compulsory military service."

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
notes: The youth leader of the MSD was kidnapped by the SNR in Muzinda. He had recently returned from Kenya, where he had been exiled.
On 20 Dec, Maoists set fire to railway station property and kidnapped 3 officials in Masudan (Lakhisarai, Bihar).

HTS fighters stormed the offices of the Syrian Interim Government in Ma'rrat An Nu'man and arrested Mohamed Firas al-Jundi (Health Minister in the National Coalition's government) and seized the Education Ministry office.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: JNIM/AQMI kidnapped two marabouts.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: A young FNL Rwasa supporter in Rutambiro was abducted by SNR officials. His family has not seen him since the abduction.
QSD arrested three civilians at least for conscription in Tabqa city of Ar-Raqqa.
Unknown gunmen abducted three individuals in Sebha, one of the abductees managed to escape from the car as can be seen on photos.
An LRA group, comprised of men, women, and children, attacked a small hamlet 7 km southeast of Mbangana, CAR. The assailants looted several households and abducted 8 civilians after killing a man.
Gunmen, suspected to be kidnappers, have abducted wife of Paramount ruler in Ayakoro Community in Ogbia Local Government Area of Bayelsa.
A farmer was kidnapped by suspected Boko Haram members as he went to his field in Tolkomari village in Mayo-Sava, Far North.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Iraq (2014-2018) Popular Mobilization Forces
notes: Unknown gunmen abducted an assistant of the Popular mobilization's Martyrs directorate and two of his associates (seem to have been unarmed) on the road between Tuz Khurmato and Kirkuk, the abductees were taken to an unknown destination.
The Shura Council of Darna Mujahedeen kidnapped a sports journalist.
A civilian was abducted at his home by gunmen aboard four vehicles and dressed as security forces in the village of Sada.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: The school secretary in Buganda was abducted by the head of the National Intelligence Services.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: According to a UN Panel, Houthi militants kidnapped the children of prominent families tied to Saleh. On December 9, the militants raided the house of Rukia al-Hajri, a relative of Saleh, and kidnapped her sons.

actor1: Military Forces of Iraq (2014-2018) Popular Mobilization Forces
notes: The Popular mobilization abducted four civilians in Ana.
Unidentified perpetrators abduct a PDP chieftain outside of Jos.
Two brothers were abducted by unknown gunmen on the outskrits of Khanaqin.

source: The Philippine Star; Philippines News Agency
notes: On 5 Dec 2017, 3 civilians were allegedly abducted by the Maute and later killed around 6 Dec 2017. Local reports said civilians were abducted near their workplace, which is possibly in Marawi area or in other areas of Lanao del Sur province.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 2 MSF agents were kidnapped on the morning of December 5th by unidentified armed men in Bambu, Nord Kivu. The agents were in mission in the area.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: The mayor of the Sougoulbe commune was kidnapped by jihadists due to a pending debt. It is unclear if the event occurred in Sougoulbe's main village, Kora.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2012-) Security Belt Forces
notes: Two brothers were abducted in al-Burayqeh district of Aden governorate and remain under enforced disappearance today. The family learned from former detaineees that the two brothers were held in Bir Ahmed prison which is run by the Security Belt Forces.
22 people were kidapped in the periphery of Dimbi. They were freed by a MINUSCA patrol.
3 doctors were kidnapped in Lemera, on Friday 2nd, while doing a provincial health inspection. The kidnappers demanded a ransom, which was paid. The doctors were released Saturday 2nd.
Suspected al Shabaab militants kidnap six people and their vehicle. Motives unknown.

Several exactions in Kahele territory, Sud Kivu, by the Mayi Mayi Raia around 30 November: kidnappings were reported in Bunyakiri and in Ebisha. Lootings were also reported in Kambale, Kamananga and Bitale.

Several exactions in Kahele territory, Sud Kivu, by the Mayi Mayi Raia around 30 November: kidnappings were reported in Bunyakiri and in Ebisha. Lootings were also reported in Kambale, Kamananga and Bitale.
Unknown gunmen abducted at least three young girls at Bilinyang area in Mangala County, Jubek state.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: UNADEF: National Union of Democrats and Federalists
notes: In Lubumbashi, the federal secretary of the opposition Unadef party was kidnapped and taken to an unknown destination.
On 28 November, a BUCECO employee was kidnapped in Bujumbura.

A large group of suspected LRA forces ambushed 5 motorcyclists near Pambayamba in Yalanga area of Haute Kotto. They held the victims captive for a few hours, looted them of all their belongings, and released them.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: Houthi forces stormed Al Aaraf Village in Milhan and abducted residents, including children.
An unidentified armed group kidnapped the director of the National Development Company Holding in Benghazi.

assoc_actor_1: Hutu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: During the flee of the Nyatura Mayi Mayi from Numbi, one civilian was kidnapped and a ransom was demanded in order to free him.
Around 100 people have been kidnapped by armed men in the periphery of Kembe between 13 November - 4 December.
Unknown gunmen aboard pick-up trucks abducted a local cadre and his four sons in the area Jabara, Diyala Province.
24 November. Burundian police reported that military forces of Rwanda kidnapped fishermen on Lake Rweru in Muyinga province. They were later released. The reason for the abduction is not known.
LRA men kidnapped some civilians for a week.
A trader kidnapped in Atara, 25 km from Niafunke, by armed men.

The Military Intelligence of the Kurdish Forces raided Kherbet Elsawda village west of Tal Tamr town in Al-Hasakeh northern countryside looking for a young man who had fled from a camp on the road of Quamishli -Tal Tamr, after he was taken to serve in 'self-defense duty', residents confirmed that the patrol arrested his 13-year-old brother, and the residents accused the Military Intelligence of the Kurdish Forces of arresting the child as a hostage and detaining him until his brother hands himself over.

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: SPLA-IO took Rubkuai in Leer, southern Liech state on 20 November from government forces after a warning to humanitarian actors in the area the day before. They held the area Deputy Commissionner at an unclear date after capturing the area. He remained in custody as of January 2018. SPLA-IO maintained roadblocks and checkpoints throughout the area as of January 2018, hindering the free movement of people and goods.
The President of the Niono District Court was abducted by unknown gunmen in Niono.
Six locals were abducted by armed men believed to be members of the Abu Sayyaf at Brgy. Latih, Patikul town, Sulu on November 14 evening.
In November, 14 men from central Sinai were kidnapped and interrogated by Daesh over accusations that they had been agents for Egyptian security.
Unknown gunmen kidnapped a man in Sirte named Usama Ahnish al-Baqar al-Warfalli.
On 11 November, Boko Haram elements raided the residence of a man in Waramide, Sandawadjiri: his two wives were kidnapped.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: On Friday morning, Houthi militiants abducted a teacher from near his home in Kusmah District in Raymah, taking him to an unknown place.

A Saudi national, Ali al-Bishrawi, was kidnapped late on 9 November from his house near the Keserwan locality of Adma. A million US dollar ransom had been demanded for Al-Bishrawi's release. He was released on November 15.

HTS in Salqin arrested a member of "Trustees committee" which is a founding committee made by civilians of Salqin for new local council. HTS threatened the committee and forced them to write a statement to stop their work. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.
17 people were kidnapped on November 8 about 5km south of Dimbi.

A police commander from Bayda, Ayman al-Hassi, was wounded and seized from his home by unknown gunmen. Hassi, in his role as head of the town's police investigation unit, has earnt a reputation for toughness against militias. He was released after 1 day in captivity.

Following increasing tension over Syrian Democratic Forces' forced conscription policies, QSD military police arrested and later released on the same day a large number of youths who had been taken into conscription in Menbij area of Aleppo and Al-Tabaqa area of Ar-Raqqa which have also witnessed the spread of checkpoints which stop vehicles and arrest those of recruitment age for forced conscription.

Following increasing tension over Syrian Democratic Forces' forced conscription policies, QSD military police arrested and later released on the same day a large number of youths who had been taken into conscription in Menbij area of Aleppo and Al-Tabaqa area of Ar-Raqqa which have also witnessed the spread of checkpoints which stop vehicles and arrest those of recruitment age for forced conscription.

Four people hailing from Marehan clan were abducted by Suleiman clan militias in Cadado town. The motive of the abduction was connected to previous carjacking and abductions. The victims were later released.
Suspected Murle tribesmen attacked Pero village close to Pochalla town, abducting four children. This is the second incident in less than a week.

On 7 November 2017, a Papuan worker was reported disappeared on his way home in Tembagapura district, Mimika Regency, Papua province. He'd been rerouted by a police and military barricade. When on the phone with his family, gunshots were heard in the background and he hasn't been seen since. Police reported that he died on 9 November and had been buried by his family, which the family has refuted.
A suspected Islamic State eight-member cell abducted a man in the village of Islah and took him to an unknown destination.
Islamic State militants abducted a farmer after raiding his house in the village of Islah, near Jalawla.
QSD\YPG arrested many locals in Manbej of Aleppo following protests against compulsory conscription. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.
60 people were kidnapped between 4 and 9 November in Kembe by armed gunmen.
A student was kidnapped by men dressed in security force uniforms from a graduation party in Kamenge. His family fear for his life.
RRR men kidnapped a civilian and asked for ransom.
5 November, IVO Qandala, Bari - Islamic State fighters kidnaped nine civilians in retaliation for the 3 November US drone strikes.
Forces loyal to Barzani abducted three civilian activists in Halabja.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: According to local sources, Houthi forces kidnapped an academic teacher in Al-Khabt District of Al-Mahwit Governorate.
Armed herders abducted two villagers from their farms near Timo village, 10km west of Khazan Tunjur in North Darfur's Tawila locality.

Joy News' camera technician who was covering the election of the DCE for the Ada East District Assembly in the Greater Accra Region Friday was locked up after a scuffle broke out. The cameraman was arrested by some heavily built men, numbering more than five and was bundled into a room outside the auditorium. Joy News' Maxwell Agbagba who was also at the venue reported some police officers prevented him from filming the process.
Forces of the YPG raided a village southeast of Tal Brak and arrested relatives of the Hayat Tahrir al-Sham activist Taher al-Daoud.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
notes: A Libyan lawmaker and a number of his escorts were released on Friday after they were kidnapped in Tripoli by a militia allied with the GNA.
Armed militants abducted at least two Turkish technicians and a German engineer who were on their way from Obari airport to the local power station.

actor1: Military Forces of Iraq (2014-) Popular Mobilization Forces
notes: After controlling the villages of Sweiyeh and Hurriyeh in Deir-ez-Zor countryside by the Iraqi Popular Mobilization Forces at the beginning of November 2017, Iraqi forces arrested 200 civilians from these 2 villages, and their fate is still unknown.
Unidentified gunmen kidnapped the manager of the Directorate of Education of Free Aleppo in the western countryside of Aleppo. No casualties reported.

Gunmen dressed in military uniforms seized an Australian student at an Islamic school on charges of belonging to a Salafi-jihadi group inTarimcity, central Hadramawt governorate, eastern Yemen on November 1. The school sent an official letter to the governor of Hadramawt stating gunmen beat and abducted al Baghdadi. Some local sources report that the gunmen were Hadi government First Military Region troops from Camp al Suwayri, south of Tarim city

In Koothupatamba, a Dalit man was abducted by a group of CPI(M) workers in an auto rickshaw and assaulted at Koothuparamba. Communist Party of India (Marxist) workers allegedly targeted him for his association with the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS).
A vaccination agent was kidnapped by armed men and freed on November, 7th following the MINUSCA intervention. An international organisation agent was assaulted by armed men on the same day.
The YPG launched a campaign of arrests against young people in Al-Hasakah city.
Al Shabaab militants hijacked a car and abducted a driver between Fino and Sheikh Barrow. He is alive, but being held in Somalia.

A businessman hailing from Galjecel clan was abducted by Agoon sub-clan of Hawadle clan at Qabno (c. 38 km North of Beletweyne town). The incident was related to clan retaliation. Caafi sub-clan of Galjecel clan abducted four civilians from Agoon sub-clan of Hawadle clan in response to the abduction of the businessman. Efforts from influential clan elders were reported to be ongoing to defuse tension and secure the release of the abducted.

A businessman hailing from Galjecel clan was abducted by Agoon sub-clan of Hawadle clan at Qabno (c. 38 km North of Beletweyne town). The incident was related to clan retaliation. Caafi sub-clan of Galjecel clan abducted four civilians from Agoon sub-clan of Hawadle clan in response to the abduction of the businessman. Efforts from influential clan elders were reported to be ongoing to defuse tension and secure the release of the abducted.
Al Shabaab militants abducted a religious sufi-cleric man at Caad village (c. 30 km North of Harardheere).

LRA forces looted the mining community of Yangou Waka, CAR. They reportedly fired their weapons upon arriving in the community and looted rice, sugar, soap, and cassava flour. They abducted 8 men and forced them to porter the looted goods.
A group of Chadian soldiers abducted a student of the Holy Koran Institute in West Darfur's Sirba locality. Reasons unclear. They also raided the premises.
Unknown militants abducted two people from a coal mine near Dubet Neira, 7km south of Dubo El Omda in North Darfur. The motives are unclear.
A group of five unidentified gunmen abduct a monarch from his home in Ikot Nya.

LRA forces ambushed and temporarily abducted 5 travelers on the Mbangana-Sam Ouandja axis, CAR. They looted the victims of all their belongings. The victims were forced to porter the looted goods before being released several hours later.

LRA forces attacked a Peuhl camp west of Mboki, CAR. The assailants were armed with AK-47s and wore a mix of civilian and military clothing. They abducted a woman and a girl. They also looted peanuts and bushmeat
6 fishermen were kidnapped by an unidentified armed group in Lake Edward. Mayi Mayi Charles have been reported to be involved in harassment towards fishermen in this region.

Al Shabaab abducted two farmers from outside of Afgoye district. Al Shabaab burnt the generator before the two men were taken to an unknown location. The motive behind the abduction remains unknown. A second source claims four abducted.

Masked men kidnapped leading businessman and military contractor Ayman Sahmoud from his car in front of his house in southern Arish. Sahmoud, who is from one of Arish's biggest tribes, Al-Fawakhreya, was taken to an unknown location.
3 Egyptian workers were abducted in Tripoli by unknown militants.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
notes: The head of the SNR in Gasenyi abducted a man and took him to an unknown destination.

assoc_actor_2: FNL: National Forces of Liberation; Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: A police officer who is a former FNL fighter went missing on 19 October from Muramvya police station.
Two armed herdsmen intercepted two boys on their way to collect firewood near Fallujah in East Jebel Marra, and kidnapped one of them as the other escaped.
Al Shabaab kidnaps 200 children in various locations in Bardaale.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
notes: Unidentified gunmen kidnapped a military colonel east of Sirte. The colonel was released the following day.

Islamic State militants attacked the village of Albu Najm and several other nearby villages, two civilians were also abducted. The Popular mobilization said that its forces moved to deal with the militants without providing any further details.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Toussaint Alonga's brother was attacked and briefly kidnapped from his house in Kinshasa (Alonga is an MP who initiated a petition against the Speaker of the National Assembly; this is expectably why he thinks his relative was targetted).
Unknown gunmen kidnapped a technical team belonging to the General Electricity company while carrying out maintenance operations in the area of __Qasr Ben Ghashir in the suburbs of Tripoli.
SDF forces arrested over 130 civilians who had fled Raqqa on suspicion of being fighters for IS.
Militiamen abducted a displaced man in Tawila locality in North Darfur and took him to Damrat El Gubba.

actor1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
assoc_actor_2: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
notes: ZANU PF supporters attacked an MDC-T ward official and his wife in Chitungwiza. They beat them at the house and then abducted the official. At the councillor's house he was beaten further. The police then detained him for assaulting the councillor.
Two brothers from the Al-Abadlah tribe were kidnapped near Tripoli on their way to the capital. Kidnapeprs demand a ransom payment.
Two children were reportedly abducted by militia groups at Tagalei in Abyei. They were found unharmed two days later.

Armed men attacked a local trawler and abducted five crew members off Sulu while sailing near Pangutaran town area late on Saturday (Oct 14). No individual or group claimed responsibility for the attack, but Abu Sayyaf Group which is actively operating in Sulu and in nearby Tawi-Tawi province is suspected behind the attack.
Unknown gunmen abducted between 2-7 engineers at the Korek telecommunications company in central Hilla and also detonated a number of IEDs without causing any casualties.

Four Britons are kidnapped by unidentified militants at Enukoroma community. The victims were said to have been kidnapped in the community to "protest the heavy presence of soldiers drafted from 222 Battalion for the Operation Crocodile Smiles II."
On 9 October, armed men raided Tikre, Mora, and kidnapped one person.
Unknown gunmen reportedly attacked a group of persons who had gone to fetch firewood outside the UN PoC site in Jebel, outside Juba. Four women went missing. Date unclear - report dated 9 October.
Two civilians were arrested for conscription in Tal Abyad city in Ar-Raqqa. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.
Several civilians were abducted by unidentified gunmen in Sabha.
Unknown gunmen abducted a Swiss humanitarian worker from her home in downtown El-Fasher, North Darfur. She was released on 14 November.
Al Shabaab kidnapped five clan elders near Mahaday, Middle Shabelle region. The identity of the clan and the reason for the abduction is not known.
Gunmen kidnap a magistrate near Salem University on the evening of 05/10.

A group of nine militiamen abducted a merchant from the market in Kabkabiya, North Darfur. It is unclear if this incident happened before or after a clash reported on the same day at the market between police and militiamen attempting to loot a shop.
A girl was kidnapped in Ain El Turk, Oran by unidentified individuals. Police managed to free te girl 3 days later.

A worker of a not-for-profit organization, hailing from Hawadle clan, was abducted by clan militias (not identified) hailing from Mohamud Gacal area (c. 37 km North of Beletweyne town) and was taken to an unknown location. The motive of the abduction was related to the dismissal on one of the militiamen hailing from Mohamud Gacal by the worker. Influential clan elders from Hawadle clan attempted to negotiate for the release of the abducted worker. The situation was reported to be tense.

Government forces ambushed a group of armed youth from the Kuac community, arresting five, in Apuk South County, Gogrial State. Following the incident, the gunmen that had escaped attacked civilians at a nearby village, injuring two. The gunmen returne to the village the following day, abducting two people.
Islamic state militants abducted the Sayf Saad village chief and his son near Qara Tapa.
A family in the city of As-Sweida kidnapped the head of al-Bustan Charity Society close to the president of the Syrian regime Bashar al-Assad.

Al Shabaab fighters detained two businessmen hailing from Hawadle clan at Booco Village (c. 45 km South of Beletweyne town) after al Shabaab fighters summoned businessmen to Booco village for discussions. Businessmen who honoured the call arrived at Booco village and were detained by al Shabaab fighters. The motive behind the detention was not clear.
Civilians were attacked and kidnapped (to be later imprisoned) by Thomas in order to demand ransoms.

Government forces ambushed a group of armed youth from the Kuac community, arresting five, in Apuk South County, Gogrial State. Following the incident, the gunmen that had escaped attacked civilians at a nearby village, injuring two. The gunmen returne to the village the following day, abducting two people.

A man, hailing from Warsan Geli sub clan Ugas labe, was abducted by men hailing from Isse Mohamoud Sub clan Reer Samakaab in Garowe town. The motive was believed to be clan revenge. Clan elders were reported to be in negotiations to diffuse tensions. The matter was reported to the police and investigations were reported to be ongoing.

actor1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
notes: Suspected members of the security services abducted a civilian from his shop at Libya market in western Omdurman over unclear reasons.
20 civilians were arrested by the YPG in Afrin of Aleppo and taken to unknown destination. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported. Suspected Actor 1 YPG.

Abu Sayyaf militants abducted a municipal councillor at the boundary of Barangays Tagbak area and Timbangan, Indanan, Sulu on Wednesday night (Sept 27). He was again released on Nov 1 near the village of Buru in Talipao town.
Gunmen abducted a top Zamfara State police officer and three members of his family on a remote area of Birnin-Gwari-Funtua road on 27/09. The officer was likely not on duty at the time of attack.
16 armed men suspected to be LRA looted several households northeast of Ouanda Djalle, CAR. The assailants abducted 3 men as porters after looting peanuts, corn, cassava, and sugar.
Unknown gunmen kidnapped the head of the media unit in Ajdbiya. He was released some days later.
Unidentified gunmen kidnapped a worker from the Ras-Lanuf oil terminal. He reportedly fought among the Petroleum Facilities Guard of Ibrahim Jadhran some months ago.
Head of the Radiology Department at the Sabha Medical Center, Mohammed Senoussi Hamza, was kidnapped. He was released three days after his abduction.
President of communal health organization abducted by presumed jihadists in Dioura
Mayi Mayi militia occupied Nyakokoma town and kidnapped 16 fishermen.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: Unknown gunmen abducted three individuals and burned down the gendarmerie post in Mourdiah, Cercle of Nara, Koulikoro Region. JNIM claimed the attack on October, 17th.
An LRA group attacked the community of Kpabou, CAR. They looted the community of food and non-food items and abducted 23 community members.
A woman was abducted by unkown gunmen in Al-Rahba, Benghazi. She was released several hours later.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: A U.S. citizen was kidnapped in the capital Sanaa on Saturday by Houthi gunmen. The reasons for his detention were not clear, and he was released in January in Oman. The man was seized after taking his children to school and had been working in Yemen since the late 1980s, currently with the oil company Safer.

The commander of the local public uprising forces in Qaysar District, Faryab Province, beat up an 50-year-old man for unknown reasons and also beat and kidnapped his 13-year-old sister-in-law, as reported on September 23, 2017.
On 23 September, armed men raided Igawa, Mayo Sava.3 women kidnapped, and other goods seized.
Islamist militants abducted village chief of Sare-Kina.

A civilian businessman hailing from Majeerteen clan was abducted by Derasame militiamen of Gaaljecel clan at Nur Xawaad area in Xawa Taako neighbourhood located east of Beletweyne town. The militiamen took the man to an unknown location. Reports indicated that the abduction was related to the arrest of a civilian man from Beletweyne who was detained in Garowe by the administration of Puntland state eight months ago.
Several people were kidnapped in the last few days in Obari. The most well known victim is the head of the regional offices of the Commercial Bank.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: Suspected New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas abducted a government militiaman of the Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit while he was having dinner in his house at Sitio Landing, Pinagturilan in Sta. Cruz town, Occidental Mindoro province on Monday (Sept 18).
HTS detained four activists in Saraqab city of Idleb for several hours because they criticized a jihadi group on Facebook. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.
On 16 September, 3 Boko Haram men attempted to kidnap a villager in Makary, Logone et Chari.
The Democratic Union for two days have arrested more than 50 journalist and political activist in different areas of Al Hasakeh city and Quamishli. No fatalities reported.
The Democratic Union for two days have arrested more than 50 journalist and political activist in different areas of Al Hasakeh city and Quamishli. No fatalities reported.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: Suspected New People's Army rebels abducted a tribe leader and a CAFGU (Citizen Armed Forces Geographical Unit) member in Surigao del Sur province in the month of September. No injuries reported.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Unidentified militia abducted a priest from Ntamugenga.
PYD linked-forces arrested 25 political opponents and activists in Al-Hasakeh governorate. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported. Suspected Actor 1 YPG.
The Kurdish Democratic Union Party kidnapped member of the Kurdish National Council. No fatalities reported.
Abs taken as hostage the NGO Cordaid basis in Bocaranga, asking for a ransom. After a pacific negotiation, the Abs left the city.
The spouse of Meinta, farmer in Bia village, has been kidnapped last night by Boko Haram armed elements

The security guard of the General Authority for Culture reportdely kidnapped the Administrative and Financial Affairs Officer of the General authority for Culture of the Government of National Accord, Kassem Badi, on Wednesday morning, in the capital Tripoli. He was later released, being in good health.

assoc_actor_2: UPD-Z: Union for Peace and Development (Zigamibanga Faction)
notes: The treasurer of UPD-Z was abducted by police officers as he walked down the street in Mutanga.

assoc_actor_2: UPD-Z: Union for Peace and Development (Zigamibanga Faction)
notes: A UPD Zigamibanga official was abducted by men in police uniforms driving a car with tinted windows. Neither his family nor the UPD has any information about his whereabouts.

A civilian truck driver hailing from Majeerten clan was abducted by Farah Cagaweyne militiamen of Hawadle clan in Kooshin neighbourhood, East of Beletweyne town. The militiamen took the man to an unknown location.
An ophthalmologist was kidnapped in Tripoli. The victim was seized in front of his house by unidentified gunmen, bundled into a vehicle and driven away.

Forces from Nalut kidnapped 15 Tunisians as a bargaining chip to demand the release of one Libyan citizen who was arrested by Tunisian security forces some weeks ago in the border near Dhehiba. 12 of the 15 Tunisians were released, though 3 Tunisians and the Libyan citizen remain in detention.
Suspected al Shabaab militants kidnapped several local NGO employees west of Baidoa near Aawdiinle.
Asayish stormed a number of Arab schools in Ghuwayran neighborhood of Al-Hasakeh city, they closed them and arrested the teachers. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.

Family members of Ibrahim Jadhran were kidnapped from their residence in Tripoli by the "Special Deterrent Forces" belong to the Ministry of Interior. Former militia-leader Jadhran said that his family members had been subjected to "intimidation and espionage, forcibly taking them to an unknown place and hiding them there.
The mayor's office in Diguel, Soum attacked by presumed Ansaroul Islam members, material damages & the accountant abducted.
Unidentified gunmen abducted 20 bus travellers in Isiokpo.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
notes: An ex-FAB officer was abducted by SNR officials.
The son of a town mayor was abducted by six unidentified gunmen assumed in Labason town, Zamboanga del Norte on September 6.

Gunmen supposedly loyal to the Hezbi Islami party abducted 2 teachers on the afternoon of September 6, 2017, in the Chah Ab District of Takhar Province because of their participation in demonstrations against the head of the party, Hekmatyar.

Reports that up to 35 civilians have been taken hostage recently (coded as the previous week) in Qush Tepa and Darzab Districts of Jowzjan Province, where both the Taliban and IS have set up checkpoints.

Reports that up to 35 civilians have been taken hostage recently (coded as the previous week) in Qush Tepa and Darzab Districts of Jowzjan Province, where both the Taliban and IS have set up checkpoints.
At least 15 fishermen were kidnapped on Lake Edward by Mayi Mayi Kakule

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: A child was kidnapped by Boko Haram men.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: Presumed Islamists kidnapped 30 people in Mamba as revenge for the beat up of two Islamists after a quarrel about veil wearing.
2 individuals abducted by unknown gunmen this morning in Kourfadji (Nassoumbou).

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: ISIS reportedly abducted three civilian Salafists, described as Madkhalis, which are normally known to be allied with Haftar forces.
Boko Haram asking ransom & foodstuffs to villagers in exchange for woman abducted in Igawa.
Four unidentified militiamen kidnap a tuktuk driver in Nierteti, Central Darfur. The victim was taken to an unknown location. The reason for the abduction is not known.
Gunmen kidnapped 3 persons in Bougoue, at around 20km from Touboro-Sorombeo road, in North Region

LRA forces abducted a man and a woman who were working in their field near Djemah, CAR. The assailants looted 2 bags of peanuts and 3 boxes of cassava. A neighbor who was also working in a field witnessed the abduction and reported it to the authorities
One resident of Shehata was taken hostage by unidentified gunmen. The man was beaten and taken to an unknown location.
One resident of Zliten was taken hostage by unidentified gunmen.

Unknown gunmen have abducted eleven passengers in a bus on Ndele-Elele axis of East-West road, Emohua Local Government Area of Rivers State on the night of 28/08. The motives of the kidnapping arte not yet clear.
On 27 August, two teenagers were kidnapped in Bourha, Mayo Tsanaga by 4 armed men.
Al-Sarhani, a civil society activist, was kidnapped on August 27. His family believes the reason for kidnapping to be his belonging to Sufism. More than 1 month later he was still not released.
Unknown gunmen in military uniform abducted two women and three children in the Wuntiem area of Apuk South County, Gogrial State.
The brother of Muhammad Issa al-Falah, Salim al-Falah, was kidnapped by unknown men.
LRA kidnapped three people fleeing Nzako.
21 LRA forces ambushed civilians in Bambangana. They looted the civilians and abducted 13 people.
A large LRA group looted households in Zigbi and abducted 3 community members.
On 21-August-2017, near Loi Seng [geocode for Hpakant], Kachin state, the Myanmar army forced two men to serve as guides on the way to Jan Mai Pa.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Myanmar (2016-) People's Militia Force
notes: On 21-August-2017, near Kamaing, Hpakant, Kachin state, the Myanmar army (and PMF) forced two women to serve as guides.
Militiamen ambushed and abducted two displaced men on their way from Barda to the Sortony IDP camp in North Darfur.
One of the deans of Senussi university in al-Bayda disappared. It is assumed that he was kidnapped.
A former FAB was abducted from his house.
HTS arrested the media activist and athlete Ahmad al Hunayni in Kafr Nabl city in Idlib.
Suspected Boko Haram kidnapped six children in Biu LGA.
A 25-year-old man named as Isra Ghaith Al-Warfali was seized by a four-man gang near the Tajoura heart hospital.
4 female students were abducted at Tripoli university on Thursday. Among them there is one professor.

source: The Philippine Star; Philippines Daily Inquirer
notes: Suspected New People's Army (NPA) rebels kidnapped a policeman while bringing his children to school on 16 Aug in Brgy. Katipunan area, Makilala, Cotabato. He was later freed on 4-5 Dec in Brgy. Bagumbayan, Magpet, Cotabato, after being found innocent in the NPA's "kangaroo court."
Suspected Islamic State militants abducted two workers and burned down a factory in the village of Islah, area of Jalawla.
Kurdish Self-management forces (mainly Democratic Union Party -PKK branch) raided Tal Abyad city in Raqqa governorate northern suburbs, arrested 13 civilians.
ISIS raided Sbeikhan town in Deir Ez-Zour governorate, arrested 20 civilians and took them to unknown destination. No fatalities reported.

assoc_actor_2: UPND: United Party for National Development
notes: A UPND candidate who had gone to file his papers to stand in a By Election was abducted by PF militants in Luanshya.

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
source: OCHA; Gurtong; Radio Voice of Hope
notes: SPLA-IO rebels arrested and detained three aid workers from the Unity Cultural Development Centre while conducting assessments in the Baggari area of Wau in August. They were released on the week of 8 January 2018 as part of a cessation of hostilities agreement signed between the two main conflict factions.
Suspected assaillants from Kuac North County in Boma, Jonglei, abducted three women working on their farms at Agwar area of Apuk South in Gogrial, Warrap.
Armed groups in Minyori, Yei County, detained four humanitarian workers for a week in August.

Gunmen abducted an Eritrean refugee in Kassala during the week of 14 August and later demanded a ransom. The incident came amid reports of rising cases of attacks targeting refugees and asylum seekers in Red Sea state.

Suspected Taliban militants are reported to have abducted passengers of 2 vehicles on the Herat - Badghis main road. At least some of the abductees are believed to be government employees. At least 3 bodies, suspected to be part (or all) of those abducted, were reported found on Sept.18. They were reported to have been killed by the Taliban.

LRA forces set up an ambush in Kana, where they robbed passers-by and took people hostage. At least 40 people were taken hostage, including 2 CENI officials, who were carrying USB drives with data from voter registration centres.
Former prime minister Ali Zeidan is reported to have been seized by gunmen from the Tripoli Revolutionaries brigade in Victoria Hotel.
YPG authorities arrested SDF fighters who fled the battlefield in Raqqa after being forcibly conscripted. Fighters were imprisoned in Qamishli.

actor1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
notes: Security agents arrested five more members of the Maaliya tribe from Adilla in East Darfur, as they are suspected of involvement in recent tribal conflicts. They were taken to Ed Daein and later, to Khartoum. They have reportedly been beaten in detention.
ODM Kisii Central ward candidate was kidnapped by an unidentified group on Wednesday and reportedly beaten up and his posssions stolen by the unidentified group. He was released soon after.

Armed men carjacked a vehicle belonging to the deputy of Dhamar governorate Fadl Al-Harbi and abducted his driver near the Oil Company station near Aden airport and took him to an unknown area; August 8.
A young boy was kidnapped by Dalaho milita in Ambalamiadana in Iarintsena.
Unidentified attackers ambushed a commercial bus in Elibrada in Emohua LGA and abducted 15 passengers. It is noted by the source the area is an oil hub.
2 women were taken hostage by 80 Dahalo militia.
Taliban militants captured 8 power utility workers in Sangin district of Helmand province while the workers were repairing power cables.
Islamic State reportedly abducted 27 farmers in Sayad District of Sar-e Pol Province.

Herders kidnapped two farmers at Dubbo El Omda in north-west Tawila. They accused them of stealing their camels. The families of the abductees gathered in front of the Dubbo El Omda army garrison, demanding the troops to hunt down the kidnappers.

An LRA group attacked Ndenguilo (Denguiro, Mbomou community). They looted sugar, cassava, rice, and other non-food items. A man who escaped reported that 32 men and children (including him) had been abducted by the assailants prior to the attack.
The secretary general of the Arab Youth Union, Mustafa Gadara, was abducted in Tripoli.

Unidentified gunmen forcefully abducted a man from his home in the town of Maar Shurin. The victim is a former aid worker who used to mediate issues between armed actors. The reason for his abduction is unknown, as is his fate.
On 31 July and 1 August, gunmen abducted three IDPs from Bria's PK3 camp.
HTS police/security arrested four men for murder in Maarat al-Numan area. No fatalities reported.

30 July, c. 1130 hrs. Al Shabaab fighters abducted five young children in the outskirts of Qoryoley district. The abducted children were said to be in same family. Al Shabaab elements took the victims into AS controlled areas. The motive behind the incident remains unknown.
An LRA group attacked camps in fields north of Bakouma. The group of assailants was comprised of men, women, and children. They reportedly abducted a number of children between the ages of 12 and 15.

Al Shabaab intercepted and opened fire towards 4 local RAS NGO workers transporting child nutrition packages on 4 donkeys. One NGO worker & cargo kidnapped. $1.500 demanded to family relatives. Authorities believe al Shabaab kidnappings are an indication of the group's financial problems.

assoc_actor_2: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
notes: On 29-July-2017, in Vientiane, Laos, an exiled Thai activist, associated with the anti-military red shirt movement, was abducted from his residence.
Al Shabaab militants hijacked a car painted in Jubilee campaign colours in Falana, near Mandera. The driver and a passenger were kidnapped.

actor1: MPLA: Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola
assoc_actor_2: UNITA: National Union for the Total Independence of Angola
notes: A Unita official was abducted by MPLA militants and beaten.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 7 gold miners were kidnapped by the FRPI near the Talolo River.
Taliban abducted 2 senior health officials from Sheberghan-Mazar-i-Sharif highway on their way to Sheberghan city. Taliban denied claims.

A vehicle reportedly carrying local businessmen (khat dealers) was taken by al Shabaab fighters in the outskirts of War-Ciise neighbourhood, Jowhar District. Al Shabaab elements took the victims to an unknown location, in their controlled areas. The motive behind the abduction remains unknown.
The imam of the Jebel Al-Rahma mosque in Beida is abducted by unknown gunmen
The government armed opponents (suspected Taliban militants) abducted 4 employees of an organization in southern Urozgan Province.
Abdi Bilal, Kurdish politician from KDP, arrested in Hasakah on July 25.
Kurdish Self Management (PYD) forces arrested 17-year-old teen Dar Qarno in Amuda in Hasakah on July 25.
Peoples Protection Units in Nashwa neighborhood in Al-Hasakeh city made mass arrests as part of their forced recruitment.
Peoples Protection Units in the villages and towns in Ras Al Ain's countryside made mass arrests as part of their forced recruitment.
7 LRA militants looted a village and abducted 7 civilians south of Napopo.
Boma youth recently abducted children and stole cattle in Bor North county in Jonglei. Date unclear. Report dated 25 July.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: A member of the CNDD-FDD was kidnapped by unidentified attackers in Maramvya.
Abu Sayyaf militants stormed a sawmill in Jolo Province and took two men as hostages on July 21.

actor1: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
notes: FPRC elements reportedly kidnapped around 30 people, including two Caritas humanitarian workers and their families, after anti-Balaka kidnapped a Muslim girl in Bangassou. They were later freed through MINUSCA.

Several NGO workers are kidnaped on 21 July in Farlibaax, north of Beledweyne. The abduction may be related to the counterfeiting of Somali currency. The abduction comes after al Shabaab gained control of the city following a firefight with Ethiopian forces. The perpetrators were believed to be al Shabaab.
A muslim woman was kidnapped by presumed ABs.

New People's Army (NPA) rebels from the Front 53 allegedly abducted a civilian agent of the Criminal Investigation and Detection Group at Barangay Katipunan, Arakan town area, North Cotabato while retreating following a clash with government soldiers on July 19. The attack was allegedly a protest move against the imminent extension of martial law in Mindanao until the end of the year.

actor1: PSLF/TNLA: Palaung State Liberation Front/Ta'ang National Liberation Army
notes: TNLA soldiers were accused of abducting a man from the village of Kham Tain, releasing him only after a local abbot paid a ransom to the ethnic armed group.
A Kourfadji inhabitant was kidnapped by presumed terrorists.
Unknown gunmen abducted a doctor at al-Shuala Hospital (Kadhimiyah district) in northwestern Baghad.
On 17 July 2017, presumed Ansaroul Islam militants abducted a prominent goldminer in Kerboule, he was released nine months later.
on 16 July, a number of foreign workers that work for the Tripoli Public Services Company were kidnapped from Hani Office of Services in Tripoli.
Myanmar Army Forces abducted and assaulted a villager in Dum Bung, Kachin, on 16 July. The villager was later released.
8 LRA forces ambushed travellers on their way to the Ngilima market. 2 civilians were abducted.

assoc_actor_1: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Nande Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 2 Catholic priests were kidnapped from the Bunyuka Mission in Beni. The priests are ethnic Nande, so it is believed that they were kidnapped by Hutus.
Al Shabaab kidnapped a NGO worker in Badhaadhe.

An abductor came to the headquarters of the Tripoli Public Services Company and kidnapped a number of foreign workers. The perpetrator asks for a ransom of eight thousand Dinars in exchange for their release.
A teacher and a farmer were abducted by unknown gunmen
Suspected Abu Sayyaf gunmen took five construction workers hostage and demanded P1 million for each in ransom at Barangay Martirez in Jolo town, Sulu in the early hours of July 15.

About 20 suspected Abu Sayyaf gunmen abducted four workers in a school in a southern Philippine province in Sulu province's Patikul town shortly after midnight on July 15 and seized six painters and carpenters, one of whom managed to escape and alerted the police. Army troops later rescued another worker.
Suspected insurgents (not named) abducted a Nigerian refugee in July. She was later released for ransom in Elhadji Mainari in Diffa.

actor1: MPC: Patriotic Movement for Central African Republic
notes: MPC reportedly abducted four herders in Moyen Sido around July. As of 31 July, two had been released, while two remained detained.
Afternoon, Baidoa, Bay: unverified social media reports indicated al Shabaab may have kidnapped seven non-governmental organisation (NGO) local workers in Baidoa.
Report of continuous abductions of children by unidentified armed men in the western part of Imatong state, including in Lowoi. Precise dates and numbers unclear. Report dated 27 July.
Director of the agriculture department of Darzab District/Jowzjan was abducted by the Taliban in the province's Qoshtapa District.

An LRA group looted 4 households and abducted 4 boys in Lika, DRC. There were already 13 boys in the LRA group. The assailants also told a hunter they encountered in the bush that they are seeking young boys between the ages of 15 and 17.
An LRA group looted 4 households and abducted 4 boys near Ngilima.
Members of Hayyaat Tahrir Al-Sham raided houses and HQs probably of Jund al Aqsa, after which tens of persons were arrested and taken by members of Hayyaat Tahrir Al-Sham to an unknown destination.
Suspected Murle gunmen ambushed and abducted five people between Duk Payuel and Poktap in Duk Payuel County in Jonglei State.
On 9 July, a trader was kidnapped by unidentified men in Telek-Djiffi, Mayo Tsanaga.
Unknown gunmen abducted three UNICEF South Sudanese subcontractors in Pagak, the headquarters of the SPLA-IO, as they fled Mathiang amid clashes. As of January 2018, they had not yet been released.
Boko Haram men kidnapped a businessman and some members of his family in Karena.
Militiamen stole cattle and abducted two displaced farmers from the Abyei camp while threatening others as they were farming in Rahad Zarroug, 15km west of Gireida.

Three unidentified gunmen abducted 18 Eritrean refugees from the Refugee Commission office in Kassala town, and took them to an unknown destination. The refugees were waiting for the completion of their papers for their transfer to the El Shajarab camp.
Hayat Tahrir al-Sham arrested 100 people in Idleb accused of fighting for Operation Euphrates Shield. No deaths reported.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The Kamandi police commander was off-duty visiting family in Kipese, where Mayi Mayi militia surrounded the house and abducted him.
Al Shabaab kidnapped 90 clan elders for preventing recruitment of child soldiers.
01 July, afternoon, Harardheere, Mudug: al Shabaab kidnapped 90 local clan elders. Conflicting sources claim the incident occurred on 30/06.

Salamat tribesmen abducted two Misseriya scouts who were observing their movements in Sure near Umm Dukhun in Central Darfur. As the Salamat refused to respond to demands to release them, fears of renewed clashes between the two tribes heightened.

Pro-regime militias s in the towns of Nabul and Zahraa in the Aleppo countryside detained around 50 young men after stopping busses transporting civilians from northern Aleppo to Idleb. The men were detained as the groups demand that factions operating in the Azaz area release a man they are holding.

Unknown gunmen abducted eight foreign and local workers of a private company contracted to an aid NGO while drilling water outside a UN camp in Juba. The workers were released two days later, on 2 July.
A group of gunmen stormed the village of Kulu, 12km west of Tawila town in North Darfur, and kidnapped two villagers. The reasons are unclear.

Following the University of Zimbabwe Medical students' demonstration, a student was abducted from Chitungwiza by undientified men, who are suspected to be state agents. He was detained and beaten for 6 days.
9 LRA forces attacked Masumbu and abducted 12 people. The abductees were forced to carry looted goods from the village and released later in the day.

actor1: AQAP: Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Yemen (2012-) Presidential Guard
notes: An officer belonging to Aden's presidential guard was kidnapped at night in the southern province of Abyan by gunmen suspected of belonging to Al Qaeda, a security source said.

A member of Muammar Qaddafi's Qaddadfa tribe is thought to have been kidnapped by militants of the so-called Islamic State (IS). Tribal elders said that Mohammed Abubakr Abusadra Qaddafi, who they described as a former soldier, had disappeared near Qasr Abu Hadi, some 70 kilometres south of Sirte, near Gardabaya airport.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Border Guards
notes: Members of the paramilitary Border Guards abducted a cafe owner in North Darfur's Saraf Omra. He was released early September.
Detonations were heard this morning: reportedly a taxi-moto driver was kidnapped. He was later freed thanks to the intervention of Zambian blue helmets.
Armed herders abducted two farmers at gunpoint in the Gallab area in North Darfur's Tawila locality.
A girl was kidnapped by an unidentified group in Mungwa, Gitega.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: The deputy head of the CNDD-FDD was abducted by unidentified agents from Butavuka in Muzinda.
19 LRA forces attacked Nakorda. They abducted 4 civilians, who they forced to porter the goods they had looted. They then abducted a cyclist.
On 23 June, Boko Haram elements attacked Gakara, Mayo Sava; one person kidnapped and some food seized.

Camel herder militiamen ambushed a vehicle and kidnapped 16 passengers at Kator area in the locality of East Jebel Marra, South Darfur state. The militia demanded to retrieve 85 heads of camel stolen by SLM-AW elements before releasing the hostages.

Unknown gunmen stopped two commercial vehicles traveling from Juba to Mundri area during the week of 19 June, asking all passengers to get out of the two vehicles and taking the vehicles along with the drivers.
Recruitment: Peoples Protection Units arrested 30 young men in the western countryside of Ras Al Ain to be forced to fight for them as part of their compulsory recruitment.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Border Guards
notes: Members of the paramilitary Border Guards abducted a civilian in North Darfur's Saraf Omra. He was released 40 days later, on 27 July.

Gunmen suspected to be members of the South Sudan Liberation Army (SPLA) raided Bari Village in Metu sub-county, Moyo district,also abducted 13 South Sudanese refugees and drove them back to South Sudan.

8 LRA fighters attacked the community of Diabaka. They looted the village and abducted 7 community members. The villagers later organised themselves into a militia, pursued the LRA fighters, and freed the abductees.
Gunmen kidnapped an American citizen in Kabul city who worked for the Afghan ministry of culture. No group has claimed responsibility for the kidnapping
10 LRA fighters attacked a mining camp near Gangala. They looted gold, diamonds and money, and abducted 8 artisanal miners.
12 LRA fighters ambushed fishermen near Makpangi, looting meat, fish, clothes, and money. 5 of the civilians were abducted.
PYD forces raided Tal Deiq in Hasakeh, arresting 14 civilians. No deaths were reported.
Syrian Democratic Forces detained 8,000 civilians in a refugee camp in Ain Issa. No deaths were reported.
Syrian Democratic Forces arrested tens of civilians in Tal Abyad. No losses were reported.
A man was kidnapped by Fulani armed men: he was freed some hours later.
A Syrian agricultural worker in eastLebanonwas kidnapped Friday by an unknown group of armed men in Fakiha, in the Bekaa region, where he worked on land owned by the Khoury family.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Hema Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 4 Hema youths were abducted on the Kasenyi-Kaliabungo road. Local residents believe that they have been killed by the FRPI.
On 14 June, 6 Boko Haram fighters attacked a herders' campement in Dega, Fotokol: 2 herds seized and 2 herders kidnapped.

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Five women were abducted by suspected members of the opposition while working on their farms in the Sopiri area of Yei county in the week of 12 June. They were released three months later, at the end of September.
Militiamen attacked Jurof village, east of Mershing in South Darfur, in retaliation for the killing of one of their relatives the week before. They abducted nine villagers.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: An 8 year old was kidnapped on his way to school. The kidnappers demanded $4,000 to free him.
Islamic State militants abducted 60 civilians in the al-Shifa (Al-Rabee district) area of Mosul and brought them to the Old City district.

assoc_actor_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 11 June, evening, Mogadishu: two Somalis working for AMISOM were kidnapped by suspected al Shabaab in Hawl Wadaag.
Turkish-backed rebels, suspected to be from Euphrates Shield rebels, kidnapped 16 Kurdish civilians in northern Aleppo province around Al Bab city. In total 55 were kidnapped.
Islamic State arrested civilians who were trying to escape from IS held areas near Bay'a graveyard in Ar-Raqqa city, and burned their IDs and passports. No fatalities reported.
A tunisian businessman was kidnapped in Libya. His family travelled to Tripoli to negotiate his release. His kidnappers demand 320.000 dinars.
Gunmen abducted Ikwiriri Kati Village chairman Mr Athuman Pazi (CUF).
The ruling PYD, Kurdish Democratic Union Party, arrested the political opponent "Berzan Sulieman" in Al-Hasakeh city.
Unidentified militiamen abducted two people from the Kila district north of Mershing because of a missing camel.
LRA forces armed with automatic weapons raided 2 communities near Gangala, abducting 10 civilians. They then looted food, gold, and diamonds from the mine near Gangala.
HTS attacked media activists at one of their checkpoints located in the countryside of Al-Quneitra and then confiscated the photography equipment and took them to an unknown destination.
7 people were kidnapped by Raia Mutomboki Butachibera militia from Mubugu village, in Kalehe. They were released two days later.
3 CENI employees were abducted from the CENI centre at Bena Tshiswaka by Kamwina Nsapu militia.
Syrian Democratic Forces arrested dozens of escaped families at Jurneyyeh town west of Ar-Raqqa city to investigate them.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A youth leader from Bagira was kidnapped by an unidentifed group.
Local Idnane tribal chief abducted by unknown gunmen yesterday near Tabankort
Report that unknown armed group abducted two teenagers from Bangasu in Yambio county early June. Populations fled the area in fear.

assoc_actor_2: PDP: Peoples Democratic Party; Government of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Unidentified gunmen kidnap a PDP lawmaker around Abuja-Jere axis of the Abuja-Kaduna highway.
LRA forces attacked 4 hunters and abducted 3 near Rafai, CAR. The fourth hunter managed to escape and reported that the group of assailants was comprised men, women, and children.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A girl from Bagira was kidnapped by an unidentified group.
LRA militants abducted a man and his wife.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A student at the Catholic University of Bukavu was kidnapped and held for 5 days by an unidentified group.
23 civilians were kidnapped by unknown gunmen. The assaillants requested a ransom of 500000 XAF per head.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: At least 17 people have been kidnapped by the Ugandan ADF-NALU and taken to an unknown destination. They were kidnapped from Mayangose, near Beni.
At least six children were abducted by suspected Murle tribesmen in a road ambush in Torit West County, while travelling with their families to Kenya's Kakuma refugee camp.
Abdul Baset Al-Sarout was just arrested by HTS in Idlib

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A student at the Institute of Pedagogical Education in Bukavu was kidnapped by an unidentified group.
YPG arrested an anti-Nusra activist in the Azazz area, accusing him of being a Nusra member.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: FRPI raided Bei II village in Irumu, where they stole 157 cattle, looted houses, and abducted 3 teenagers. All of the inhabitants have fled into the forest. The day before, FRPI raided the villages of Ruzinga Mukubwa and Kazana, where they extorted the inhabitants.
Gunmen ambushed a vehicle in Tundobaya in Tawila locality, beating, robbing and kidnapping six people inside the vehicle.

assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
notes: An MSD supporter who had participated in demonstrations against Nkurunziza's 3rd term disappeared. His family believes that he was abducted.

Islamic State militants abducted nearly 3,000 villagers in western Nineveh (Afri', Nawfali, Qibat Wahbi, and Kharab Bazar villages) and took them to the border between Iraq and Syria to use them as human shields.

Some gunmen, suspected to be "militants", have reportedly launched an attack on Igbo-Nla Model College, Epe, in Lagos State. Six pupils of the school were allegedly kidnapped in the process. Other injuries not known.

PYD arrested Nafea Abdullah who is a political official of the Kurdish KDP-S, as well as Suliman Oso who is a political member of Yekity Party in Al-Hasakeh. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.
YPG forces launched arrest campaigns in Alqahtanyeh arresting several civilians from Alraqqah in Raas Alain.
YPG forces launched arrest campaigns in Qahtanyeh arresting several civilians from Al-Raqqah in Ras Al Ain.
Four people kidnapped, three young girls and one woman in Gakara and one women in near-by Dougdje.
Al-Rahman corps harassed a pharmacist and arrested another civilian in Modira in Eastern Ghouta.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: A member of FNL Rwasa who has refused to join the CNDD-FDD was abducted by the SNR. His family has been unable to find him.
Al Shabaab kidnapped Koranic teacher and students, all hailing from Biyomaal clan.
Al Shabaab kidnapped five Biyomaal clan elders in Janalle. The motive for the attack is believed to be an attempt to stop the clan from joining the Lower Shabelle People's Guard.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A 17 year old was kidnapped by an unidentified group.

assoc_actor_2: Bor Clan Dinka Ethnic Group (South Sudan)
notes: Suspected Murle men abducted a child from the Bor Dinka community in Athooc County of Jonglei state.

actor1: Military Forces of Iraq (2014-2018) Popular Mobilization Forces
notes: A number of armed men suspected to be associated with the PMF abducted the mayor of Nimrud along with other officials.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: The head of CENI wass kidnapped for 3 days. CENI was accused of failing to pay the debt that they owe to local businesses which lent them fuel and resources to use in the voter registration process.
The imam of Sabare was abducted by jihadists. He was released safe and sound on May 21.

assoc_actor_2: Arab Salah Clan Group (Somalia); Majeerteen-Omar Mahmud Sub-Clan Group (Somalia); Majeerteen-Bicidyahan Sub-Clan Group (Somalia)
notes: Habargidir/Sacad abducted five kids from Arab/Salah (2), Majerten/Omar Mohamud (2), Majerten/Bicidyahan (1). The five were later released.
Militants belonging to the Islamic State group on Thursday kidnapped a Lebanese man from the eastern border town of Arsal. The man is thought to be an arms dealer with links to Daesh.
About 40 Kamwina Nsapu militia attacked Nguej village at around 1900. They abducted the local chief and torched 25 houses.
Unidentified men kidnapped a Buddhist monk from the Walpola Bodhirukkarama Vihara. He was severely assaulted and left on the roadside in Colombo.

LRA forces attacked the community of Banangui, CAR. The assailants wore military clothing and were armed with AK-47s. They spoke Acholi. 2 civilians were injured (a man and a woman) and 16 were abducted.

In Tank, leader of a polio vaccination team, Sanaullah Marwat, was kidnapped by unknown persons from Pang Dewana Baba. He was recovered two days later after local police saught the aid of Bittani tribesmen.
a young woman accused of having a relationship out of wedlock was kidnapped by armed men on 16 May
Rahman Corps arrested 8 people working with the Medical Emergency Organisation in Eastern Ghouta.

The last two remaining Abu Sayyaf militants from the April 11 attack in Bohol, took a civilian hostage at Barangay Cahayag on Panggangan Island (Calape town area), Bohol on May 15. They later released the hostage to escape the army.
On 15 May, 4 people were kidnapped by Boko Haram in Goudza Vreket, Mozogo.
30 people were taken hostage by the ADF from villages around Beni.
A group of the Red Cross Mali was kidnapped in the Tenenkou cercle while on assessment mission. They were released the following day.
4 women were kidnapped in Vreket by Boko Haram while looking for fresh water.

actor1: Bor Clan Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan)
