notes: Dinka Bor youth attacked Murle areas in Kotchar in Jonglei's Boma state, abducting children and stealing thousands of cattle. This came in the context of increasing clashes and attempts to implement a ceasefire between the two tribes.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1995-2018) Liyu Police
notes: 14 May, evening, Tuulo-Caano, Galgaduud: elements of the Ethiopian paramilitary group 'Liyu Police' kidnapped two young girls from Tuulo- Caano, near the Ethiopian border.
The daughter of an owner of a large company was kidnapped by bandits (Dahalo) in Ilafy.
PYD security forces arrested the Kurdish journalist Barzan Hussein in Rmelan city of Al-Hasakak governorate. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.

source: The Philippine Star; Philippines Daily Inquirer
notes: Rebels belonging to the Front Committee 14 of the New People's Army (NPA) kidnapped the son of a former Agusan del Sur town mayor and a well-known miner, on May 13 morning in Sitio Anoling, Barangay Bayugan 3 in Rosario town, Agusan del Sur. NPA rebels were demanding ransom money from the family in exchange for the release of the victim. The guerrillas also seized 21 firearms when they raided the mine site owned by the family.
Elderly man abducted for having organized a small marriage celebration presumably by jihadists in Ali-Samba. He was released on May 19th, safe and sound.
Armed men abducted two displaced men at a local market of Murnei in West Darfur at gunpoint. The men were from Murnei IDP camp.

Aspiring Woman Representative Esther Passaris (ODM) was held hostage for several hours by "goons" at University of Nairobi. The attackers were known to be led by a student who was a member of the local County Assembly (political affiliation not known) and demanded a large amount of money for release. The attackers were said to have attacked the candidate, her bodyguards and threatened to burn cars. The leader of the attackers was later arrested and the candidate was freed.
23 LRA militants abducted 16 civilians near Parka. They were forced to carry looted goods. 8 were released later in the day. 8 were held for 2 days.
A burkinabe vet was kidnapped by unidentified men in Forage Christine. He was later found the following day.
Iran Militias in Iraq and Syria (IMIS) kidnapped activist Omar Farouk Samarri in Samari city and took him to an unknown destination.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A taxi driver and his passenger were taken hostage by an armed group at a roadblock. The group is demanding USD2000 per hostage to release them.
YPG arrested several political opponents from the Kurdish National Council in Al-Hasakeh city. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.
20 LRA militants abducted 7 civilians as they travelled from Banda to Kpasi. They were forced to carry looted goods and then released.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: The supervisor of a cocoa purchasing company was kidnapped in Mambasa.

Seven anti-corruption activists were taken from their homes by armed men in the Al-Sa'adoon neighborhood (Rusafa district) of central Baghdad. The victims have been named as Abdullah Latif Faraj, Hamza Younis, Ahmed Na'im Ruwayi, Haidar Nashi Hassan, Samer Amer Musa, Zaid Yahya and Ali Hussein Shnaoua. The source notes that powerful Shia militias have been accused of being behind the kidnappings.
Two farmers were abducted by unknown gunmen in Tawila locality. The gunmen accused them of cultivating on their "liberated lands".
Murle youth attacked a boat on its way from Bor to Juba, at the islands in Maar. Six people went missing.
Militiamen abducted five people in Korma in North Darfur at gunpoint and took them to Amo area, west of Kutum.
The New People's Army (NPA) abducted a Technical Sergeant in Valencia City in Bukidnon on May 5, while he was reportedly off-duty. He was released on May 23.
Maounde Decladore, spokesman of "Ca doit changer" movement disappeared. The Chadian ANS (Agence national de securite) is suspected by his fellow activists.
A group of four militiamen abducted a Muslim man after the Friday prayers in Dunkolat, south of Kutum.
Taliban militants abducted 13 family members of a local Afghan commander in Ghowr province.

actor1: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Hema Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Walendu Bindi militia occupied the village, looting cattle, torching huts, and kidnapping Hema civilians.

actor1: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Hema Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Walendu Bindi militia occupied the village, looting cattle, torching huts, and kidnapping Hema civilians.
The Central Bank of Libya's operations manager was kidnapped. No further details were given.

Human Rights Watch was given a list of 17 men from the villages of Mougnoukana, Douna, Kobou, Yangassadio, and Guedouware who have been 'disappeared' since their arrest in early May. Several witnesses told Human Rights Watch that they had been arrested on May 2 with seven of the missing men
2 NGO workers abducted & vehicle seized
An unknown Iraqi militia abducted about 100 youths in Hamam Ali district.
YPG arrested through its checkpoints in Raas Alain, 7 IDPs from Raqqa. Neither injuries nor fatalities reported.
Kamuina Nsapu militants hold teachers hostage. The teachers are released after a ransom is paid.
Teaching inspectors are abducted by Kamuina Nsapu militiamen and forced to pay a ransom. One inspector is injured by a machete.
Militiamen abducted a merchant while he was on his way from Fanga in East Jebel Marra back to Tawila, at Tarni, in Tawila locality.
QSD arrested many in multiple raids on Manbij districts under allegations of being undercover IS members. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.
7 civilians have been taken hostage by the Taliban on the Farah-Herat highway in Farah province.
Two Burkinabe state officers were kidnapped and released in the night.
Unknown assaillants abducted a child in Ait Zmenzer commune, Tizi Ouzou wilaya. He was freed four days later.
Fifty fishermen living south of Lake Edward in Rutshuru territory have been held hostage for a week by a Mai-Mai group (Charles) for refusing to pay a 'fishing tax' to the militia.
2 Water Department workers were abducted by unidentified assailants in the Tin-Akoff area. They were later released.
On Apr. 24, the Iraqi Hezbollah kidnapped 27 farmers from the Amiriyah Fallujah city in Al Anbar province; no reported casualties. They were released the next day visibly unharmed.
A worker of the National Institute for Social Welfare (INPS) was abducted by suspected Islamist militants in Youwarou.

LRA forces attacked the community of Bangassou Nzakara, CAR. The assailants spoke Acholi and Zande. They were armed with AK-type weapons. They looted food and communications equipment and abducted 6 civilians (2 women and 4 men).
100 people were kidnapped by NDC-R militiamen from the villages of Baswagha and Bapere in Lubero. The people had allegedly refused to pay the militiamen's taxes on their communities.
100 people were kidnapped by NDC-R militiamen from the villages of Baswagha and Bapere in Lubero. The people had allegedly refused to pay the militiamen's taxes on their communities.
Unknown gunmen ambushed a vehicle along the Juba-Lobonok road, abducting at least three children.
YPG forces detained several men in Raas Alein countryside and Alerjah south of Alqahtanyeh in Alhassakeh.
YPG forces detained several men in Raas Alein countryside and Alerjah south of Alqahtanyeh in Alhassakeh.

A former CNDD-FDD Senator, Oscar Ntasano, who had quarrelled with senior officials was abducted. The car that took him has been discovered in a ditch in the north of the country. His family fears that he is dead.
A senior member of the Fawakhreya tribe whose garage had previously been set on fire by IS militants was kidnapped on 20 April.
Armed herders abducted two farmers from Katur in North Darfur.
Militiamen abducted a lawyer from Kabkabiya in North Darfur, while on his way to his house in El Amiriya district.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Four Ugandan fishermen have been abducted by suspected Congolese soldiers on Lake Albert in western Uganda. The fishermen were abducted near Kaiso Landing Site after being accused of fishing in DRC waters.

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
assoc_actor_2: UN: United Nations; MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
source: Xinhua News Agency - French; AFP -- English; Radio Okapi
notes: 16 civilian UN staff of MONUSCO were taken hostage for several hours by about 530 former South Sudanese rebels at the Munigi camp outside Goma. The rebels were demanding the creation of a third country for South Sudanese opposition forces to inhabit. The staff were later released without any injuries reported.
Swedish volunteer, Tony Ekman, kidnapped by PKK in Sinjar for weeks: They threatened to imprison me in Syria.
Sham Legion arrested 3 people at a checkpoint in rural areas of Jarablus, claiming they were IS fighters.
AM, Mogadishu: a nine-year old girl was kidnapped by unidentified gunmen in Mogadishu, location within the city not known.
The traditional ruler for Akoko South West is kidnapped by unknown persons on 15/04.
Militants kidnapped a civilian in Rafah.

assoc_actor_2: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
notes: A humanitarian worker and their driver were abducted in Diafarabe in Tenenkou cercle. They were later released.

The acting head of the Tripoli Civil Registry Authority, was kidnapped by militias in Tripoli on 11 April. He was later released. Another colleague was also reported to have been taken away by an armed group. The CRA named the Bab Tajura brigade as their kidnappers. They accused them of haggling with him for a price in exchange for handing over access to the country's civil registry database.
A 24 year-old Algerian nurse working in Misrata was kidnapped on 11 April. Her family fear that she has been abducted by Islamic State militants though no verification of this has been given.
A young man was kidnapped by unknown in Sayda area.

assoc_actor_2: Government of the Philippines (2016-); Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Barangay Peace and Security Officer
notes: The New People's Army (NPA) ambushed civilians in Barangay Mahungcog (Mahongkog), Magpet, North Cotabato on 9 Apr 2017, allegedly abducting barangay chief and disarming 11 of his barangay watchmen. The chief later denied allegation of abduction, stating that the NPA released him soon after.
Unidentified gunmen abducted the Cross Rivers Commissioner for Water Resources at Effionawan Street in Mayne Avenue area of Calabar South.
Islamic State militants stored the Hamam al-Aaleil camp, south of Mosul, kidnapping tens of civilians from the camp.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A journalist was abducted by men in civilian clothes in Lubumbashi.

An internal guard of a UN compound who hailed from Omar Mohamud clan was kidnapped by armed men from Sa'ad clan at the borderline between South and North Galkayo. The abductors demanded to free a man, who was a brother of one of the kidnappers. Elders from both clans intervened and resolved the issue by exchanging the detained.

Gunmen abducted a girl from Ngerjebe Boma in Lokiliri county as she went to collect firewood. She was later found in an army garrison in Billinyang village of Mangalla county. On the same day, gunmen ambushed a vehicle at Khor-gaana, between Liria and Lokiliri counties, abducting two children.
A Ugandan journalist who had spoken out about the arrest of Ugandan activist Stella Nyanzi, was abducted, driven around, and dumped on the road.
Gunmen abducted a displaced man from Kassab camp in Kutum as je was returning to the camp with straw he had collected.
Boko Haram attackers abducted 13 women at Hambagda, near the Cameroon border.
Recruitment: YPG forces forced recruited 15 young men to the military service in Raas Alein in Hassakeh. Neither injuries nor fatalities reported.
Around 05-April-2017, near Mung Hkawng, Mansi township, Kachin state, the Myanmar army forced two villagers to be guides.

Gunmen abudcted two Omdas of Kassab IDP camp in Kutum to ransom after two of their members died in an attempted robbery two days prior. The Omdas had already agreed to pay a sum to the group but the assaillants subsequently asked for more and threatened to kidnap Omdas and Sheiks as well as burn and pillage the camp if the money was not paid.
Suspected al Shabaab kidnapped five Somali veterinarians in Belet Weyne.
A humanitarian worker and two health workers were abducted and had their vehicle seized by unidentified gunmen in Kadial, between Tenenkou and Mopti.
Five gunmen from South Sudan on Wednesday abducted two South Sudanese nationals in Moyo district. Both of them were South Sudanese who had been living in Moyo Town.

After a dispute between the children of two ethnic groups, unknown persons of the Kolhi community abducted a Soomro boy, Ali Akbar Solangi, from his home in Nawab Abdul Aziz village. Soomro locals allege that the Kohli community was being supported by PPP Senator Hari Ram Kishori Lal, and the police.

Unidentified bike-borne assailants kidnapped a class IV student at Thakurganj locality of luck now city on Monday. The kidnappers released him later with a warning that if his father contested the municipal elections, the boy will be shot dead.
Four WHO humanitarian workers are abducted in two separate instances by al Shabaab in Luuq. The groups were Somali nationals. Two of the four were later released with a fine.
The sheikh of the Fawakhiriya tribe in El Arish disappeared after leaving his home. Later it was reported IS militants had kidnapped the Fawakhreya tribe chief.
YPG arrested tens of young men from Al-Hasakeh city for obligatory conscription.
YPG arrested tens of young men from Al-Malikeyyeh city in Al-Hasakeh for obligatory conscription.
YPG arrested tens of young men from Quamishli city in Al-Hasakeh for obligatory conscription.
YPG arrested tens of young men from Ras Al Ain city in Al-Hasakeh for obligatory conscription.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: Yemeni Houthi rebels and their allies loyal to former President Saleh have abducted nine members of an International Medical Corps team in the rebel-held central province of Ibb. Reports suggest that they have been charged with spying for foreign intelligence and taken to Sana'a.
2 transporters were abducted from Nyakabere by local militiamen. A ransom was demanded for their release.
Gunmen held 56 refugees from neighbouring countries in an abandoned house on the border between Kassala and El Gedaref states for more than a month, demanding a ransom for their release.
3 Renamo officials were kidnapped by the Defense and Security Forces. 1 was released after paying a 10,000 meticais ransom. The other 2 are still missing.
Boko Haram attack Pulka village on 30/03. The attackers abducted 18 girls.
16 people, mostly farmers, were abducted and later released by suspected Burundian rebels in the Kiliba area.

9 suspected LRA forces ambushed 6 civilians who were fishing north of Mboki, CAR. They looted a bag of fish, a jerry can, clothes, and a hunting rifle from the victims. They then allowed 5 of the victims to go, but abducted the sixth victim, a 14-year-old boy.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: FRPI militiamen raided an INEC camp in the Kagaba area and kidnapped a data entry operator.

Suspected Boko Haram members attacked communities of Kalari, Mittiri, Akalli and Arribbari in Konduga Local Government Area of Borno State kidnapping 10 people. The source reports all 10 were abducted from Kalari.
An ex FAB soldier who had travelled to Bujumbura to collect his allowance was abducted by an unknown group.
Islamic State militants took nearly 200 children hostage to use them as human shields to resist Iraqi forces' advances near the al-Nouri Grand Mosque (Old City district) in west Mosul.

Suspected militants barged into the house of a jail employee in Chadoora, Badgam, abducted his son and nephew and took away the car of a family relative. They later released the hostages and set the vehicle ablaze.
Suspected Abu Sayyaf militants kidnapped two Filipino men from a cargo boat off Sibago Island in Basilan province on March 23.
A French national working for a French company was kidnapped by unidentified assailants in Abeche.
Unidentified gunmen abducted a merchant from his home in downtown El-Fasher over unclear circumstances and took him to an unknown destination. He was released four days later.
Masked men abducted an Iman in Sulaymaniya city.
25 people were reportedly kidnapped by LRA fighters in the Djema sub-prefecture.
An Obari bank manager was kidnapped on 20 March by unidentified gunmen.
7 suspected LRA forces looted the community of Louete, CAR. They stole food and abducted a 15-year-old girl. They spoke Acholi and Sango and were armed with rifles and AK-type weapons.

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
source: Reuters; Sudan Tribune; Radio Tamazuj; Agence France Presse -- English; Eye Radio
notes: SPLA-IO abducted four oil DAR Petroleum employees in Khor Adar area of northern Upper Nile after government-rebel clashes, including a Pakistani national, whom they suspected to work for the government, calling for the Chinese and Malaysian consortium to leave the country. The Pakistani worker was released on 30 March after a deal brokered by Sudan and Ethiopia.
Three reporters from 218 TV Channel were abducted on 17 March but were released a day later.
On 17 March, a girl was kidnapped by unidentified men in Mbichere, Mayo Sava. She was wounded by gunshots while attempting to escape.

Two persons from the Makane (Somali Bantu) clan were abducted by al Shabaab fighters from their house in Guracley (c. 10 km South of Beletweyne). The main reason behind the abduction was related to the persons formerly being members of SNA two years ago and defected to become farmers. Their whereabouts was unknown.

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: In Western Equatoria, between 14 and 19 March, five men reportedly affiliated with SPLM/A in Opposition kidnapped a local chief and three NGO staff, accusing them of being government spies. The victims were released after paying a ransom or following the intervention of a religious leader.
A male national NGO staff member was kidnapped from a bar in Juba in March by unidentified assaillants. He was later released through mediation.

actor1: SSPPF: South Sudan Peoples Patriotic Front
notes: In March, suspected members of the South Sudan People's Patriotic Front allegedly abducted civilians in different locations in Yambio County.
Three gold merchants were abducted in Tripoli "because of their identity, because they are from Misrata".
In Unity, teachers were reportedly forcibly recruited by armed actors in Guit in March. This caused the closure of at least one school and impacted the education of over 500 children.

YPG attacked the HQ of the Kurdish National Council in Amuda city of Al-Hasakeh, and they arrested the head of the council Abdul Wahab Haj Mohammad Karmi. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Iraq (2014-2018) Popular Mobilization Forces
notes: Militants from the Badr Organization and Ali al-Akbar militia affiliated with the PMF seized many civilians in the Badush district of west Mosul and took them to an unidentified location.
The Khalid ibn al Walid Army raided homes in Sahm Al-Golan, thereafter arresting a number of people. No deaths were reported.

actor1: PSLF/TNLA: Palaung State Liberation Front/Ta'ang National Liberation Army
notes: TNLA troops arrived in Mongtat village, Shan State, and abducted 91 locals at the village monastery. The villagers appear to be detained indefinitely.
On March 12, in Bengaluru, several people abducted and attempted to murder a local Dalit leader.
5 people were abducted by LRA fighters, including a village chief, during a raid on Kpiyamou village, 40km from Rafai. They also looted and ransacked the village. The chief was later released.
Abu Sayyaf militants abducted a teacher of the Jolo National High School on his way home towards Maimbung town area on March 10.
3 hunters were kidnapped by LRA fighters near Zemio. One of the hunters later escaped.

Fighting in Mayendit town on 10 March. In the context of the fighting, non-state armed actors abducted eight staff from a US Christian NGO (Samaritan's purse) from a village near Mayendit. They were all released four days later. Military officials initially accused SPLA-IO rebels, but the rebels denied the claim, saying they were controlling the area.
A number of "Sinai Province" militants established a checkpoint in central Al-Arish, where they stopped many pedestrians and checked their IDs. Moreover, they kidnapped two citizens from the city.

actor1: Bangubangu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 7 employees of a mining company were kidnapped by a group composed of members of the Bangu Bangu ethnic group in the Salambila area of Kabambare territory. Foreign nationals were among those kidnapped.
Five clan elders are kidnapped in Jowhar, perpetrators not known.
Amidst reports of peaceful elections in Churachandpur constituency two persons from Lamjang village were abducted from their homes and beaten.
Unidentified men beat and kidnapped two members of the rebel movement Renamo when they tried to re-open a Renamo office at Honde, in Barue district.

assoc_actor_2: PCDKS: Kurdish Democratic Left Party; PYD: Kurdish Democratic Union Party; National Kurdish Council
notes: PYD Kurdish party arrested tens of people from the ranks of within its own party, the Yekiti Party, and other parties in the National Kurdish Council in Al-Hasakeh city. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.

assoc_actor_2: PCDKS: Kurdish Democratic Left Party; PYD: Kurdish Democratic Union Party; National Kurdish Council
notes: PYD Kurdish party arrested tens of people from the ranks of Kurdistan Democratic Party, Yekiti Party, and other parties in the National Kurdish Council in Quamishli city of Al-Hasakeh. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.

assoc_actor_2: PCDKS: Kurdish Democratic Left Party; PYD: Kurdish Democratic Union Party; National Kurdish Council
notes: PYD Kurdish party arrested tens of people from the ranks of Kurdistan Democratic Party, Yekiti Party, and other parties in the National Kurdish Council in Tal Tamer town of Al-Hasakeh. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.

assoc_actor_2: PCDKS: Kurdish Democratic Left Party; PYD: Kurdish Democratic Union Party; National Kurdish Council
notes: PYD Kurdish party arrested tens of people from the ranks of Kurdistan Democratic Party, Yekiti Party, and other parties in the National Kurdish Council in Darbasiyah town of Al-Hasakeh. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.
Kurdish security forces 'Asayish' arrested at least 31 members of Kurdish parties in the areas of Al Jazeera, Adrin, and Ayn al-Arab.
Unidentified gunmen kidnapped three teachers from Dadaab camp. Al Shabaab have carried out abductions in the past, though it is not clear who the perpetrators were in this instance.
Islamic State militants abducted 25 civilians fleeing Hawija district southwest of Kirkuk.

5 LRA forces ambushed 7 civilians, one after the other, 11km west of Banda, DRC. One of the victims was able to escape while the other 6 (2 women and 4 men) were forced to shell nuts all night. LRA forces also abducted a woman 13 km west of Banda, DRC, while she was on her way to her field with her husband.

A suspected LRA group attacked pastoralists northwest of Rafai, CAR. The group of assailants was comprised of men, women and children. They killed 2 cows and reportedly held the pastoralists captive for a few hours.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 7 employees of a Canadian mining company (Banro), including four Congolese, two Tanzanians, and one French national, were kidnapped by unidentified assailants in the Namoya area of Maniema.
IS arrested 15 people in its controlled areas, after the death of a Moroccan militant in IS under unknown circumstances.

A Lebanese citizen who was abducted on Monday afternoon in the Bekaa region was released withinjuriesto his head. The reporter added that the kidnappers robbed $15,000 from al Maadrani, his cell phone and his car.

A journalist was abducted by unidentified assailants in N'Djamena after leaving church. The arrest came shortly after he released an article critical of the president and security/intelligence services.
6 artisanal miners were kidnapped by Raia Mutomboki militiamen in the Kabare area.
A group of 50, identified only as "political thugs" attack and kidnapped an election worker in suburban Owerri, at Ulakwo. Many of the group was later arrested. The victims sustained injuries.

5 LRA forces abducted 11 civilians in Gambara, CAR. The assailants wore a mix of civilian and military clothing, boots, and they spoke Acholi and Zande. They looted the community of cassava, peanuts, rice, clothes, shoes, and handheld FM radios.

A large group of suspected LRA forces ambushed and abducted at least 7 civilians south of Ngouyo, CAR. The assailants looted salt, bags of clothes, money, an MP3 player, phones, and shoes from the victims whom they forced to porter the looted goods.

A 218 TV channel photographer was seized on 25 February and released a day later. It is reported that his capture was a 'misunderstanding'. His freedom said to have been secured by Hashem Bishr after he was allegedly taken by men loyal to Abu Sleem commander Abdul Ghani Ghneiwa.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: Colonel Idris Al-Jali, the commander of the 102 Infantry Brigade was abducted on 25 February by seven gunmen who blocked in his vehicle at Ras Al-Teen on the road from the airbase at Maturba, which is 27 kilometres south of Derna.
A popular Tripoli footballer was released on 26 February after being abducted in Tripoli on 25 February.
5 road construction workers have been abducted by the Taliban on 24-Feb-2017 in the Dawlatabad area of the Mohammad Agha district of Logar.

Al Shabaab fighters abducted a civilian man in Shanta Mundule village (c. 8 km South West of Qansaxdheere). AS fighters accused the victim of having a relationship with the South West State Police Force. The whereabouts of the victim was unknown.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 5 people were kidnapped from their farms in Kibende. The culprits were suspected to be members of armed groups operating in the area.
Al Shabaab abducted two health aid workers and a driver in Xujub. The victims were taken to Buq Aqable (c. 90 km West of Beletweyne).

3 suspected LRA forces ambushed a cyclist near Ngouyo, CAR. The assailants spoke Acholi, Sango, and Zande. They wore military clothing and were armed with AK-type weapons. The assailants looted him of clothes, shoes, and 22,000 CFA, and held him captive overnight.

Al Shabaab fighters abducted a civilian man from his house in Tiyeeglow. Reports indicated that the victim was a former farmer. The motive behind the abduction was not clear. It was reported that he was taken to Bulo Fulay which was an AS stronghold.
7 LRA forces abducted 5 men and 4 boys near Dikuma, DRC. They looted items and forced the abductees to porter the looted goods.
An ex-FAB disappeared from his home.
2 people were abducted in Dialloube by suspected Islamist militants.
A man was kidnapped by unidentified assailants. He was discovered 2 days later.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
notes: A young man was abducted by Imbonerakure. He was held by the SNR, but has subsequently disappeared.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: There are unconfirmed reports that the nephew of armed forces commander-in-chief Khalifa Hafter has been kidnapped in Benghazi. It is claimed that he was taken by members of the Barasa tribe in revenge for the abduction of members of the family of Colonel Faraj Al-Barasi, the former head of the Omar Mukhtar Operations Room, apparently seized when gunmen tried but failed to seize the colonel in two separate attempts last week. He has since quite the LNA
The Islamic State militants have abducted women and girls and forced them to marry their fighters in the district Dih Bala of Nangarhar on 16-Feb-2017.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 3 people were kidnapped by FRPI militiamen in the Lakpa area of Ituri. They were later released after negotiations between the group's leader and the authorities.
The Taliban abducted about 52 farmers in the Darzab district of Jowzjan on 15-Feb-2017. They have been released on 16-Feb-2017.

Unknown gunmen abducted three women who went out to collect firewood at Hillat Bashar in the Kutum vicinity in North Darfur. They released them soon after as one attempted to escape, injuring herself in the process.

A group of 30 New People's Army (NPA) belonging to Guerrilla Front 18 allegedly blocked and held 80 civilian commuters temporarily hostage in a chapel at Purok Upper Waywayan, Barangay Don Mariano Marcos, Lupon, Davao Oriental on February 14.
Unknown gunmen abducted a group of five people on their way to collect firewood in the area of Hashaba, south of Tabit. They later demand a ransom for their release.

2 women were abducted and homes/businesses were burned in Derbissaka village (Rafia) by LRA rebels.
LRA forces abducted at least 2 cyclists, one after the other, near Doruma in the Gangala area, DRC.
Al Shabaab kidnapped several civilians and their cattle at Xeyle Martiile.
On Feb 09, IS militants abducted 385 civilians fleeing Hawija district, Kirkuk,

12 suspected LRA fighters attacked a small community southwest of Doruma, DRC, and abducted 14 civilians. The assailants looted food and non-food items from the community. They wore a mix of civilian and military clothing, spoke Acholi, Zande, and poor Lingala.

Three militiamen ambushed a vehicle on the road between Kunjara and Tabit in Tawila locality, North Darfur, abducting the driver and his family. A rescue team later managed to recover the family and the vehicle.
A Colombian nun was kidnapped by suspected FLM gunmen near Koutiala in the Sikasso region. The Colombian government claimed the FLM was responsible in April 2017.

Asayish forces launched a detention campaign against civilians in Ghowiaran neighbourhood of Al-Hasakeh for accusing them with collaboration with the Syrian regime. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.
YPG units raided Al-Kharnoubi and Al-Kdaimiyat villages in Al-Hasakeh governorate looking for young men for compulsory recruitment, with suspected arrests taking place.
YPG units raided Tal Ahmad village in Al-Hasakeh governorate looking for young men for compulsory recruitment, with suspected arrests taking place.
A suspected LRA group abducted 13 civilians in Ngoulia, CAR, to porter looted goods from the community.

A television journalist was kidnapped in front of his Tripoli home on 5 February. The abductors told his wife that they wanted him for 'investigations'.

14 fishermen were assaulted by gunmen on a Libyan boat off the coast of Medenine. One was kidnapped.

Unknown gunmen beat and abducted two men in Kutum, taking them to an unknown destination west of the town.

2 public health department employees have been kidnapped by the Taliban on 02-Feb-2017 in Qadis district, Badghis province.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord

Suspected LRA forces held 3 women captive overnight near the community of Bahr, CAR.

YPG arrested young men in the countryside of Ras Al-Ain in Al-Hasakeh for compulsory recruitment purposes. Neither fatalities nor injuries were reported.
YPG stormed Tal Tahin village in Al-Hasakeh governorate and arrested many civilians including women. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.

IS kidnapped around 400 people who are civilians and families of the gunmen loyal to the regime from the Al-Bogeleyyah.

The warden of Ngagara was abducted and detained by 2 men driving a landcruiser vehicle. It is believed that he is considered to be disrespectful of the authorities.

The perpetrators sought to pressure the government to release the convicted clansmen. Traditional elders intervened and managed to secure the release of the hostages and the vehicle.
Pirates abducted a crew of 18 Russian and Ukrainian sailors when they attacked their boat off the coast of Benin. They were released soon after and returned to Cotonou.

A group of six suspected Sudanese militiamen led by Yousif Ahmed Ali Guttiya (nicknamed Kabro) abducted three UNHCR staff members (two foreign employees and their driver) in El Geneina, west Darfur, as they were returning from a mission.

A member of the El-Fawkharia tribe, who is a teacher in Emad El-Din school in Al-Arish city, was taken by State of Sinai militants when a number of masked men broke into his residence.

Janjaweed militiamen attacked Seraf Jidad area in Sirba locality, West Darfur, in retaliation for clashes with the police the previous day, abducting four people, destroying farms and stealing hundreds of heads of livestock.

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
source: Daily Nation; Voice of America; Sudan Tribune
notes: SPLM-IO forces abducted and detained 72 Kenyan aid workers in Akobo state in retaliation for Nairobis handing over of their spokesman James Gatded Dak to the Juba government. They were released on 7 October, after a call by Machar to his forces to release them.
ISIL militants have reportedly forcibly transferred civilians from Hammam al-Alil to Tal Afar city. Numbers are estimated as to be 1600 civilians and IDP's transferred in trucks after being abducted.
On Nov 2nd, 2016, a group of unknown armed men kidnapped a civilian while leaving his house in Al-Rashidiyeh, Baghdad.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Border Guards
notes: Six Border Guards abducted a merchant from Dirige market in Nyala, South Darfur and took him to an unknown destination. Residents threatened to demonstrate after authorities inaction.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 3 young Imbonerakure went missing. Investigations are underway to find them.
On Nov 1st, 2016, IS members detained around 200 young and old men in Karama, Quds, and Adan neighbourhoods in Mosul city after accusing them of collaborating with the Iraqi government forces.
The mayor of the oasis town of Traghen, 125 kilometres south of Sebha, was kidnapped.

source: Radio Publique Africa; Local Source Project Project
notes: 2 church leaders were kidnapped by an unidentified group, which claims to be fighting the power of Nkurunziza. They are reportedly being held in the Rukoko nature reserve.

AS fighters abducted a Biimaal clansman from his farm at Busleey Da'uud village (13km NE of Marka) in the morning of 30/10. This abduction is part of a series of repressive actions lately committed by AS fighters against Biimaal civilians in Marka and Afgooye.
The mother of activist Rosa Kussa Conde was abducted by an unidentified group which demanded that she force her daughter to leave politics.
Al Shabaab abducts an elder in Afmadow.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: In Busendo in Rutshuru, three bikers were abducted around 30 km from Kiwanja by armed bandits.
On 28 October, Boko Haram fighters attacked Gakara, Mayo Sava: 2 people kidnapped and goods seized.
On Oct 26, Abu Sayyaf kidnapped fishermen on board a fishing vessel off the coast of Pangutaran Island in Jolo, Sulu. The two victims were later rescued on 19 Jan 2017 by government troops.
On 25 October, several armed men kidnapped a man in Gakara, Mayo Sava, and brought him to Nigeria.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Colonel Baudouin Yalanda Yagbo, an officer of the Armed Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo, was removed from Tuesday, October 25 by armed men who broke into his home in the neighborhood Museyi, Ngaliema in Kinshasa, and brought to an unknown destination.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A CNDD-FDD militant and teacher went missing on 25 October when he returned fromm Tanzania.

On Oct 22, IS militants forcibly captured more than 500 families from the villages to the south of Mosul, in order to use them as human shields in the face of Iraqi security forces advancing on Mosul. No exact locations were provided.

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition-Weluba: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition (Weluba Faction)
notes: Heavy clashes between SPLA and suspected SPLA-IO militiamen from the Weluba faction around Kediba town in Mundri East. No mentioned fatality. The militiamen gained control of the town before being driven out again by government forces two days later. They reportedly abducted around 500 schoolchildren and 99 government soldiers before fleeing to the bush, but denied the child abduction claims.
On Oct 21, IS militants took 550 families from villages around Mosul and held them close to IS locations in the Iraqi city, probably as human shields.
Suspected Abu Sayyaf abducted a South Korean skipper and a Filipino crewman on the sea off Bongao, Tawi-Tawi on 20 Oct 2016.

actor1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
notes: AQIM abducted the chief of Kel Ansar Tuareg militia end October 2016 on suspicion of collaboration with Malian security forces. He was released by JNIM - a newly formed Al Qaida entity - early May 2017.
A former Libyan Airlines' chairman and CEO is reported to have been seized by armed men in Tripoli. He was later released on 7 December with little detail of the attackers or the motive.
Al Shabaab kidnapped a pastoralist after he was forced to pay zakat for his camels. The man was taken to an unknown place.

AS fighters in Jabad Cade village (21km SW of Marka) carjacked a minibus with its 12 passengers on-board, mainly hailing from Biyamaal clan, and took them to Daydoog village in the afternoon of 19/10.
A trader from Mpotsa hill was abducted by men in police uniforms driving a civilian vehicle. He is accused of supporting rebel movements.
A housewife was forcibly disappeared by police forces in Menoufiya governorate after allegedly calling for protests on 11 November.
Al Shabaab abducted two civilians from Dudumale village. Whereabouts and fate unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of Iraq (2014-2018) Popular Mobilization Forces
notes: On October 17, PMF members kidnapped seven civilians and raided civilian houses in al-Garma district in eastern Falluja, and looted properties of the residents.
A student was abducted by 2 men in military uniform.
Abbala herdsmen in search of nine missing camels kidnapped five farmers working their fields near Faluja in South Darfur. They later demanded a ransom for the release of the five.

A resident from Al-Arish was kidnapped, along with his wife from their house by anonymous militants. The married couple were taken under duress to an unknown place. The militants suspected them to be "army operators".

The managing director of the Bank of North Africa in Fezzan was kidnapped on 11 October. He disappeared while on his way home from Sebha to Al-Buwanis, close to the Tamenhint airbase. His car was apparently found riddled with bullet holes.

actor1: RCSS/SSA-S: Restoration Council of Shan State/Shan State Army-South
notes: On Oct. 10, 2016, the SSA-S was accused of arresting and detaining 25 villagers near Donglao, Mong Kung (Mongkaing) township, Shan state.

Four men were kidnapped from a cafe in Al-Massaeid suburb of Al-Arish city when anonymous militants drove up in a vehicle and took them hostage. The militants released the four men after nearly 10 hours; they had been violently assaulted during that time.

actor1: MNDAA: Myanmar National Democratic Alliance Army
notes: The MNDAA abducted five workers from a hydropower plant.

actor1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: An 18 year old girl was abducted by ZANU PF supporters looking for her mother, who is campaigning for Temba Mliswa
An APC chieftains wife is abducted in Omuo-Oke.
A man was abducted in the Ouli area by unidentified "rebels" from the CAR. He was released on Oct.12.
Five government militiamen reportedly adbucted Sheikh Ahmed Ismail Abdullah from his home near Kabkabiya, taking him at gunpoint to an unknown destination.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
assoc_actor_2: Government of Libya (2014-) House of Representatives
notes: Armed forces said to be loyal to Field Marshal Khalifa Hafter are reported to have attacked the Ben Jawad home of House of Representatives member Amer Omran and seized his brother.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 7 people have been kidnapped in the Ishasha area of Rutshuru since the beginning of October (reported on Oct.9).

actor1: Military Forces of Zimbabwe (1987-2017) Central Intelligence Organization
assoc_actor_2: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
notes: An MDC-T supporter was abducted by 5 CIO agents and assaulted while being driven around, before being dumped

Al Shabaab fighters carjacked a public transportation vehicle and abducted the 13 people on-board. The incident happened in the afternoon of 05/10 in Abdow Dibille village (5km SW of Afgooye), on the road to Marka. The vehicle and passengers were probably taken to Sabiid and Caanoole village. The vehicle came from Mogadishu and was heading to KM50 village. This is the fourth vehicle carjacked by AS in this area.
Unidentified gunmen adbucted a shopkeeper in Fassi in Zalingei locality, Central Darfur after he refused to pay compensation for a militiaman's broken finger.
Unidentified militiamen abducted two of four women on their way from Sina village in Darfurs Jebel Marra.
On October 3rd, unidentified militants used civilian hostages to steal 5 rifles and ammunition from a minority police picket in Samnoo village, Kulgam district. No injuries were reported.

Four Copts, among them a child, were kidnapped on 3 October in the town of Manfalout in Assiut, some 350km south of Cairo. The kidnappers demanded a ransom of EGP500,000 or else they would kill the Copts.
Members of the Islamic Movement (Shiites) accuse members of the military of abducting a member in Dustin-Ma.
Abdul Dandas militia took a man hostage in the KM5 area. It is not clear what the reason behind his kidnapping was, but he was released two weeks later after the new cardinal of Bangui intervened.
On 1 October, 3 men were kidnapped in Krong, Kaele (Mayo-Kani) by 6 armed men.

Suspected IS militants on 1 October kidnapped four clerics belonging to the Sufi sect of Islam from their homes in the village of Nagaa Shabanah on the Egyptian-Israeli border south of Rafah. The four, according to officials, had repeatedly spoken out in public against the killing by IS militants of local civilians suspected of links to security forces.
On 30 September, 4 people were abducted by Boko Haram men in Mouria, Mayo Sava.

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Suspected SPLA-IO combattants abducted three women in Ombasi from Yei end September. One of them escaped after three weeks with the rebels and was then detained for by police in Yei for three days in mid-October for questioning.

actor1: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: SLM/AW abducted two humanitarian workers in Sortony, North Darfur, over spying for the Government. They released them the same day.

assoc_actor_2: NAVUZ: National Vendors Union of Zimbabwe
notes: Suspected state agents abducted and attacked the wife of a civil society activist and a NAVUZ member
On 26 September, 2 people were abducted, along with some food, following the incursion of BH elements.

The deputy general manager of the Libyan Foreign Bank was kidnapped in Tripoli. He was seized by an armed gang in front of his house in the capital's Gargaresh district. The banker, from Zuwara, is also believed to be Amazigh.

assoc_actor_1: Government of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
notes: An armed group linked to the GNA's Interior Ministry abducted Jabir Zain, a Tripoli-based human and civil rights activist and blogger, from a cafe in the capital, and subsequently forcibly disappeared him, on September 25, 2016. His whereabouts are unknown.
Three residents were kidnapped near their homes in El-Maswora, south of Rafah city, on 23 September.
Two CRA engineers were kidnapped in the Souq Al Jumaa area of Tripoli.
Four Janjaweed militiamen allegedly adbucted two women on their way from their farms in west Tabit, Tawila locality, North Darfur. They were taken to Badi, the headquarters of the militia.
An abduction was reported at Checkpoint 27. Wirshefana forces man the Camp 27 checkpoint.
Two Italians and a Canadian working in the far south-western town of Ghat were kidnapped on 19 September near the town's airport.
Reported on 18 Sep. 2916, IS kidnapped 65 civilians who were trying to escape Nahiyat ar Riyad, Haweeja district, Kirkuk. No reported fatalities.

actor1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)

Janjajweed militiamen abducted two Fur civilians at gunpoint from Garsila IDP camp over allegedly owing them money, taking them to Damra mountain.
On 16 September, Boko Haram men attacked Sandawadjiri, Mayo Sava: two wounded and two people kidnapped.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 6 people were reported kidnapped in the Rutshuru area in September (2 coded in other events).

notes: Members of the pro-Taban Deng Gai faction of SPLA-IO forces abducted 26 youths to forcefully recruit them into their forces in Thokwathnwyotni, Guit County, in Unity in September. One of them escaped. At least three others were abducted for the same purposes in Guit the same month.
SPLA abducted approximately 25 women, including at least two children, in Juba in September.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A number of Tanzanian truck drivers and at least 12 trucks were taken hostage by unidentified assailants who demanded a ransom. The "rebel group" responsible demanded the ransom from the Tanzanian contigent of MONUSCO.
As reported on 14/09/2016, unidentified armed men abducted a taxi driver in Musayab district, Babylon.
Four Janjaweed militiamen abducted two Fur men in Dobo El Omda in North Darfur. Reasons are unclear.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A truck driver was kidnapped in the Ngombe area of Rutshuru, near Nyamilima.

2 MDM officials were kidnapped and beaten by unknown assailants allegedly driving a vehicle belonging to a FRELIMO official
Three Janjaweed militiamen led by Ahmed al-Ghali abducted a displaced man in his farm near Silk IDP camp in Korma, taking him to Gunjar Mount and later demanding 100,000 SDG for his release.
Pro-government militiamen allegedly kidnapped three persons for a ransom in Korma, North Darfur, forcing them into their vehicle at gunpoint.
As reported on 11/09/2016, unidentified armed men abducted a factory owner in Mahawil district, Babylon.

Unidentified gunmen abducted three civilians, including a Fur from Al-Hamadia IDP camp, in the border region between Libya and Sudan and imprisoned them on the Libyan side of the border at Ajdabiya along with 25 other Sudanese civilians. The abducted persons had entrusted the help of smugglers for their journey to Libya.
LRA forces looted a number of households in Bariguna, South Sudan. They also abducted 5 civilians from the community.

Reported on 6 Sep. 2016, IS started a mass arrest campaign against its fighters who refuse to join the battlefront in Mosul, Ninewa. At least 30 of its own fighters were taken captive, as well as others who had attempted to escape battles.
Militia from Arab/Abdalla clan carjacked a vehicle owned by Majeerteen and abducted the driver.

Reported on 5 Sep. 2016, IS started a mass arrest campaign in Mosul as a result of the Popular Resistance remote attack on IS in Al Rashidiyah, Mosul - Al-Hadbaa. At least 60 civilians were taken to an undisclosed location.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 6 humanitarian workers from the Norwegian Refugee Council (NRC) were kidnapped in the late afternoon in Mashinga, in Masisi (North Kivu) on their way to a humanitarian mission to Kalembe. Police sources said the kidnappers demanded the payment of a ransom of $1,000 each before their release. Nyatura would be the perpetrators. If the membership of the captors is proved, this kidnapping would be considered a violation of the act of commitment signed in August by Nyatura and APCLS militias to end insecurity.
As reported on 05/09/2016, IS militants abducted 4 truck drivers on the road between Kirkuk and Baghdad near Sulayman Bak in Tooz district.
On 03/09/2016, IS militants abducted 55 families trying to escape from Haweeja district, Kirkuk.
Unidentified gunmen abduct 15 oil workers outside Port Harcourt along Omoku/Elele road.
Two Chinese nationals are kidnapped in Odeda LGA. The pair was rescued in the following week.
Suspected LRA abducted a 15-year-old South Sudanese as he was hunting with his father near Source Yubu, South Sudan.
SPLM-N abduct a shepherd in South Kordofan and take him to their base in Tassi. On the same day, they looted livestock from another shepherd.
On August 30, Islamic State militants abducted 40 civilians in the Haweeja area.
Members of Dhulbahante sub clan kidnap two from Warsangeli-Aden Siciid in the basis of clan revenge.
Al Shabaab abducts four civilians from their homes in Ato and takes them to an unknown location.

HPG reported that on August 29, the group attacked the workers employed by Turkish forces to build roads in Deriye Sevo area of Sirnak province. Three workers were kidnapped and one construction vehicle was burned down.
As reported on Aug 27, IS militants abducted 12 Kurdish families from different areas in Mosul (Al Bakr in Al Zuhur, al Mashriq, and al Jazaer) for allegedly cooperating with Peshmerga forces.
As reported on Aug 27, IS militants abducted 12 Kurdish families from different areas in Mosul (Al Bakr, al Mashriq, and al Jazaer) for allegedly cooperating with Peshmerga forces.
As reported on Aug 27, IS militants abducted 12 Kurdish families from different areas in Mosul (Al Bakr, al Mashriq, and al Jazaer) for allegedly cooperating with Peshmerga forces.
A young man disappeared from Musaga. He is believed to have been abducted, although the identities of the perpetrators are unknown.

HPG reported that on August 25, the group seized control of a road between two villages in Beytussebap district of Sirnak. Two people working for AKP were kidnapped by the militants during traffic stops.
On 23 August, two Nigerian displaced people were abducted by some armed men in Mayo Sava and brought to Nigeria.

A Janjaweed militia under the command and control structure of Fadul al-Nagi kidnapped six Fur persons from Adidi village in North Darfur after an incident in which a farmer from Dankoj IDP camp hit and injured a camel while driving. They were taken to the commanders residence in Basm village in Saraf Omra locality and released after a ransom was paid.

Boko Haram fighters riding on bicycles sacked Shawa village in Askira/Uba LGA of Borno state in the early hours of Sunday. Though no dead body has been found, [witnesses] said several villagers were missing.

Two people, including a police officer, were kidnaped on August 21 by a group of armed men wearing military uniforms in Nkanga, on the Burundian-Congolese border near Mutimbuzi. The attackers returned to the DRC later on.
As reported on 20-08-2016, IS militants abducted 28 civilians from their homes, and lead them to unknown location, in Mosul city, Ninewa

The head of the National ID board was abducted on 20 August in the Ras Al-Hassan district in Tripoli. There are unconfirmed claims that the man was grabbed by a militia seeking the hand-over of confidential information.
SPLM-N kidnapped a teacher on his way to his farm in Dandaro village in Kurmuk locality, Blue Nile.
Five Janjaweed militiamen assaulted and kidnapped two cattle jerders from Dobo Al-Omda village, north Darfur. They then proceeded to Malam.
Assumed on 16 Aug 2016, a school teacher was abducted by five suspected Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG) militants in Brgy. Liang, Patikul, Sulu while the victim was on board a vehicle heading to the school.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 3 members of the Catholic NGO Caritas were kidnapped as their convoy passed through the Mpati area of the Bashali-Mokoto grouping in the Masisi area. A second vehicle escaped although it was fired upon, resulting in wounds to a German journalist. The hostages were later released after a ransom was paid.

The Shaafyin allegedly kidnapped three members of the military council's forces, including Abdulrahman Al-Safih's brother, saying that they would not release them until Abdullah was free. The military council, however, then detained Abubakr Rajab Khalifa, another member of the Shaafyin tribe. Abdullah is an alleged Islamic State (IS) supporter, arrested after he had arrived from Benghazi for a family wedding.
Janjaweed militiamen abudcted two civilians from Tor in Nertiti locality, Central Darfur.
Three Janjaweed militiamen kidnapped two civilians from their homes in Tor village, south of Jebel Marra.
Al Shabaab detained two civilians in or near Saacow. The two individuals had a past of working with anti-al Shabaab forces.
On 11 August, 10 people were kidnapped by Boko Haram men in Bame, Kolofata.
On 11 August, 3 people were kidnapped by Boko Haram men in Ashigashiya, Mayo Sava.
On 7 Aug 2016, suspected Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG) members abducted three (3) civilians in Brgy. Timpok, Patikul, Sulu.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

Al Shabaab attacked the residence of a Warsangeli clan member in Laasqoray over suspicions of collaborating with US agents. Four people reported abducted.
Unidentified gunmen kidnap two Chinese workers in Agada (Agwada).
Twenty-seven Egyptian workers were abducted by militants at Brega City on 6 August and the Libyan army has been deployed to bring about their release.
Kidnappers abduct a lawmakers father while he travelled between Okpoama to Egweama in Bayelsa State.
Unidentified gunmen kidnap two Chinese workers in Agada (Agwada). The two were later rescued.

The Abu Sayyaf kidnapped three civilians (husband, wife, and son) on 5 Aug 2016 from Barangay Kulisap in Payao, Zamboanga Sibugay and transported on a motorboat to Sulu. The wife was released on 23 Aug and husband on 14 Nov in Jolo, Sulu, while their son is still being held captive. The family had allegedly paid ransom to Abu Sayyaf.

Three Janjaweed militiamen, under the command and control structure of Badr Abu Keneish, kidnapped a boy grazing his sheep in Marar, Tawila locality, North Darfur and took him to an unknown destination.
A man in his seventies has been kidnapped near Warshefana and is being held for a million dinar ransom.

actor1: ULFA: United Liberation Front of Assam
notes: On August 1, the son of BJP leader Ratneswar Moran, from eastern Assam's Tinsukia district was abducted by the anti-talk faction of the United Liberation Front of Asom (ULFA).

A former Burundian Armed Forces soldier has been missing since August 1st. A local source said he responded to a call from an acquaintance around midnight and never returned; he has been missing since that night. His wife searched for him in all the prisons and has not found anything. He had returned from a peacekeeping mission in Somalia three weeks ago.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2015-2016) Supreme Revolutionary Committee
notes: On 31 July, pro- Houthi fighters abducted four four tribal leaders of Al-Omer area in Dhi Na'im district, from them houses and they didn't abide by Houthi demands They were taken to a valley in Al Malagim district.

Two people were injured and seven others kidnapped in an ambush by an unknown armed group. The military pursued this group, until the 7 passengers were released. A significant amount of money and phones were stolen according to a local source.

On July 30, Islamic State militants abducted 20 civilians in several villages and in the areas of Riyad and Abbasi in the Hawija area, those abducted were accused of collaborating with security forces.
On July 29, unknown gunmen presumably Islamic State militants abducted a civilian after intercepting a car on the road between Baquba and Muqdadiya.
A photographer was abducted, allegedly by Rada (Deterrence) forces, while he was covering anti-Presidency Council demonstrations in Tripoli on 29 July.
Al Shabaab abducted two women affiliated with the local government in Ceel Garas.

Popular Resistance forces abducted at least 125 civilians from the villages of As Sarari, Al Hiyar and Dhi al Brah in Sabir Al Mawadim district, Taizz governorate, a day after overtaking the area. Several houses were also burnt.

A man was kidnapped in Tripoli for eleven days. He was later released by Rada Special Deterrence Force.
The son of Sindh's Chief Justice was kidnapped by militants of a TTP splinter group affiliated with Al Qaeda in the Clifton area of Karachi.
On July 18, Islamic State militants abducted 40 women in the village of Salamiya.
On 16 Jul 2016, members of the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG) abducted a civilian (Patrick Almodovar, 18) of Jolo, Sulu.

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: A suspected breakaway group of the Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army (SPLA) raided Ngomoromo village in Lokung Sub-county, Lamwo District, in a fresh border row, causing at least 20 households to flee their homes. The group set up its base at a former UPDF detachment in the village, claiming ownership of the 11-kilometre piece of land from the South Sudan border to River Limu in Ngomoromo. Six Ugandans were abducted by the rebels in Ngomoromo the following day.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: On 16 July 2016, an IWACU journalist went missing in the Bugarama area of Muramvya province. Witnesses at the scene said that they saw him being arrested by agents of Burundi's national intelligence service. His whereabouts is unknown.

assoc_actor_1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Suspected SPLA-IO allied rebels abducted 8 Ugandans in attacks targeting vehicles travelling along the Juba-Nimule highway in Lobone sub-county, Magwi county, in July. SPLA-IO denied the claims.

notes: A youth member of MSD and his brother (who works as an SNR agent) have been abducted. While the motive of the kidnapping is unknown, the MSD member was suspected of being the mole who betrayed young MSD demonstrators against the third term to the SNR.

Boko Haram abducted 6 women. One man on a bicycle escaped and alerted soldiers and vigilantes, who when on patrol to find the women.

Two men kidnapped at different times. A first man was abducted after receiving a phone call while he was organising his wedding; the second incident: the first mans brother disappeared after going looking for him.

Security forces in Luxor freed a young man after 24 hours of his abduction by unidentified persons.
