An expatriate of unknown origin is kidnapped in Epe.

Cattle-rustling incident involving suspected SLM/A members and Nuwayba farmers in Central Darfur. Following the incident, armed Nawaiba abducted five Fur in Kude Mara, north-east of Nertiti, whom they released on 18 July following intervention of a local conflict resolution committee.
3 people were kidnapped from the Obo-Mboki axis by LRA rebels.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: A trader was abducted by SNR agents while he was fixing his car. He was released on Monday the 4th, after several warnings from his family and human rights defenders. His family couldnt say the sum he had to pay for his release.
Unknown gunmen on 01/07 kidnapped Sierra-Leonean Ambassador to Nigeria, Maj-Gen. Nelson Williams (Rtd) along Abuja-Kaduna Express way while en route to Jaji, Kaduna.
25 civilian construction workers were kidnapped on July 1 in the district Gurpinar, Van by PKK militants. The militants also burned the vehicles of the workers.
Student kidnapped from Ngagara.
Armed men beat and abduct a farmer north of Sortony camp.

Mr Hassan Hussein Sharlawe aka Hassan Nuur a Somali Diaspora (British Citizen) was reportedly abducted by al Shabaab fighters at Tarda village (Approx. 185km East of Belet Weyne town). The reason for the abduction is not known.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Border Guards
notes: According to some Libyan officials, four Libyan customs officers were seized on 24 June on Libyan soil by masked Tunisian traders/smugglers. Although they were later released, this allegedly then led to 12 Tunisian traders being seized near the border and taken to Zuwara by Libyan border guards, where they are supposedly still being held. The Ben Guerdane official, however, denies this version of events, saying that the four Libyan customs officers were arrested on corruption charges by a Libyan brigade which he named 'Al Muqannaoon' (the hooded/masked men).
On June 23, it was reported that Islamic State militants had arrested 17 civilians, accused of cooperating with security forces.
Suspected former Seleka militiamen kidnapped 2 people during a raid on Dekoa village to carry goods looted from the area.

The Sahara bank closed down due to the kidnapping of its staff who are in the investigation committee of the robbery of LD 7 million from the safe of its Sebha branch. It reports that it was carried out by the Bab Tajura militia.
Unknown gunmen abduct governors camerman from Jebel-Khair neighbourhood of Wau.
A student and member of the 'Tripoli Good Project', was abducted in Tripoli.

actor1: KIO/KIA: Kachin Independence Organization/Kachin Independence Army
notes: On June 21, 2016, nearly 50 Palaung were detained overnight in Kutkai township and then released by members of the KIA. One of the detainees said members of the KIA had arrested the group, mostly farmers, due to a disagreement over land.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_2: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
notes: A trader and member of FRODEBU was abducted in Kigoma while she was returning from Uganda; she was released in Buyenzi after two weeks. She had to pay her captors a sum she refrained from revealing. Some eyewitnesses reported she was abducted by SNR agents.

On 20 Jun 2016, unidentified armed men hijacked a tugboat sailing Sulu sea, Philippines en route to Samarinda, East Kalimantan, Indonesia and abducted seven Indonesian sailors. Six other sailors were left unharmed.
Six Egyptians were kidnapped in the city of Bani Walid by an armed group that interjected their path, stopped their car and took them to an unknown location on 20 June.

A municipal elected member of the FNL party was abducted by unknown armed people in a bar called "Maman Subila". Another five people were kidnapped as well, but released afterwards. They were questioned by the police for investigation reasons.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: At least 85 people have been kidnapped from Goma since the beginning of 2016, many of whom (specifically young men) have allegedly been sold to rebels groups, specifically the ADF, who in turn sell them to other "Muslim groups" based on the reports of Lets Uproot Human Trafficking, an NGO based in the Eastern DRC.
On 16 June, some herders were intercepted by Boko Haram fighters in Gnangnan, Waza: one herder was kidnapped, and two herds were seized.
Eight Kenyans have been kidnapped by the al-Shabab militants in the past month in the Alango and Kurokura (Mandera County) areas. Dates unknown, though the latest kidnapping took place on 10/07.
7 displaced farmers abducted by militiamen in Jabour area, 10km west of Gereida.

A journalist of "Oximity News" went missing last week. He was arrested by unknown people when he was at home to be held in the SNR jail. (Because he has not been found in the SNR jail, he is considered to be abducted by unknown group.)
On Monday night, a group of armed unidentified assailants abducted Mongpru Marma, joint convener of the Bandarban upazila unit Awami League, from Jamchhari Para area in Sadar upazila.
LRA rebels kidnapped 27 people from Modoguere in the Ippy locality and looted the village market.

Four Janjaweed militiamen dressed in military uniform abducted Adam Ahmed Saror, a local merchant in Zalingei's main market, from his shop before driving away. Fortunately the merchant was later rescued by the police with additional assistance.

source: Radio Ndeke Luka; Radio France Internationale
notes: At least 17 people were kidnapped by LRA rebels in the Kadjema area of Obo. They also "completely looted" the town.
Al Shabaab fighters kidnapped 13 traditional elders from the village of Gamboole. The 13 were taken to Show, Hiiraan region, where they are currently being held.
On 12 June 2016, IS closed down the last 8 money transfer agencies and abducted the people who work there for allowing some police officers to receive wire transfers through their companies.
SAF abducted three people working on their farms in Oli village, Alazrag Payam, taking them to an unknown destination.

Police rescued a Hindu priest, who was abducted by unidentified assailants, from Moghalhat frontiers in Rangpur-Lalmonirhat districts on Saturday. The victim was identified as Uttom Kumar, 58, is a priest of a temple at Osmanpur village in Pirganj upazila of Rangpur district.
Reported on 11 June 2016, IS arrested around 50 civilians in the city of Mosul and took them to an unknown place.
A man was allegedly abducted by four armed Maoists from the road between Mosaboni to Dumuria on June 8.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Armed assailants stole money and phones from a dozen women in Basalolo in the Bunia area. The attackers also stole other property, kidnapped 4 women and wounded a man with a machete.
Reported on 7 June 2016, unidentified gunmen kidnapped a farmer and his son in Qarat Tabbah, Diayala.
The Yemeni army (Hadi) and pro-Hadi militiamen kidnapped citizens from their houses in the Ath Thawrah neighbourhood of the city of Taizz.

At least seven people were detained by an unknown armed group and then went missing. Other drivers passing by the spot where they were last seen said the TNLA had blocked the road and were detaining every car that passed.
Gunmen abducted a man from Bindisi.

HPG website reported that on June 5, the group burned down three vehicles used for cutting trees in Nazimiye district of Tunceli, claiming that the people cutting trees were previously warned. They also took one person cutting trees, stating that he was detained.
On June 4, it was reported that Islamic State militants had abducted 19 teenagers in the Haweeja area, in order to force them to fight for the organization.

About 50 LRA rebels raided Gamba village in the Bili chieftancy of Bondo territory. They looted a large amount of goods, livestock and other property, and kidnapped as many as 100 people to help them carry it. Some of those kidnapped were later released.
The Yemeni army (Hadi) and pro-Hadi militiamen kidnapped citizens from their houses in the Al Kayatin area located just above the Great Door, and in Ath Thawrah neighbourhood of the city of Taizz.
The Yemeni army (Hadi) and pro-Hadi militiamen kidnapped citizens from their houses in the Al Kayatin area located just above the Great Door, and in Ath Thawrah neighbourhood of the city of Taizz.

A boy was abducted in Burenza, Muramvya on June3. He was found on June5 in traumatic shock - naked, gagged with legs and arms tied. He recognized the vehicle from his abduction: a vehicle with black windows, allegedly belonging to SNR agents.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: RSF kidnapped a man from Kass market.

On 31 May, 100 local youths were abducted by IS gunmen in Fallujah, taking them to unknown locations. IS militants also reportedly took people hostage to use as human shields in Falluja to try to prevent attacks on their fighters.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A member of Imbonerakure was kidnapped by two men in military uniforms, in Bururi quarter of Kinama. A local source said his wife was looking for him at the military position of Mutakura neighborhood; he was allegedly led to an unknown place overnight.

assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
notes: The head of the MSD in Mpanda commune was kidnapped in broad daylight at his home in Musenyi and his family has had no news of him.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: RSF militiamen seize a vehicle that was loaded with goods. They also abduct six passengers to an unknown destination.
Armed men abducted 7 in Fanga.
Armed men kidnapped off-duty police officer.

There are unconfirmed reports that the youngest son of State Council head Abdulrahman Sewehli was briefly kidnapped on 26 May by the Bab Tajoura militia from Tripoli's Suq Al-Juma district. It is said that he was seized in a busy central area of the capital. The source said that a force had been sent to the militia's HQ and forced the young man's release. The Bab Tajoura militia denied the event.
Two Saad women are abducted by suspected Wagardahac clansmen near Galinsoor.
Unidentified attackers abducted two men and a woman from Isiokpo on 25/05 for unknown reason. The victims were later recovered after military forces engaged the attacked in a gun battle.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 2 Congolese aid workers of the NGO International Solidarity were kidnapped by an unidentified group in the Lubero area.
Murle tribesmen abduct two children in Ajong Payam.

The Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) contestant in the February 18 parliamentary elections was allegedly abducted from his home in the African quarters in Pece division, Gulu municipality. He had contested the election results after he lost against the National Resistance Movement (NRM) opponent.
A secondary school student is kidnapped by gunmen in the North Darfur gold mining area of Abdul Shakoor in Kutum.

On 21 May, the manager of one of the departments at the Libyan Centre for the Study of Terrorism was reported to have been seized in Tripoli. He was taken while on his way to work in the west Tripoli suburb of Hay Andalus. The brigade responsible is unknown, though many victims have been held for ransom, allegedly by members of militias now supposedly providing security for the Presidency Council (PC).
Armed Murle attack Fagak in Duk county and abduct two children and injure two civilians.
A woman was abducted by Boko Haram in Maiduguri on 20/05, then later escaped.
Pro-government militiamen kidnap a North Darfur policeman from his home.

Late on Thursday night, Maoists laid siege to the Jhargram Dhanbad passenger train for an hour at the Kokpara station in East Singhbhum district. They abducted the driver and the guard, and beat them up at the station master's cabin before they decamped with their walkie-talkie sets.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2015-2016) Supreme Revolutionary Committee
notes: Pro Houthi forces reportedly abducted the Imam of a mosque in Qayfa. It was not mentioned where he was taken or why he was abducted. His fate remained unknown; May 19.

Gunmen reportedly abduct two Nigerian high court judges on 19/05, one in at Ojuocha in Ofu Local Government Area during a farm inspection, while the second was reportedly abducted while on his way to the court in Ayingba, Dekina Local Government Area of the state.

Gunmen reportedly abduct two Nigerian high court judges on 19/05, one in at Ojuocha in Ofu Local Government Area during a farm inspection, while the second was reportedly abducted while on his way to the court in Ayingba, Dekina Local Government Area of the state.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: A number of displaced people from a camp in Gireida locality, South Darfur, were kidnapped by the RSF.
Unidentified gunmen, on 18/05, invaded Rumukwachi community in Obio/Akpor Local Government Area of Rivers State and abducted two residents.
Seven people kidnapped in Al Kereinik by militiamen.
A Raia Mutomboki militia attacked the Luhago locality in Kabare territory. They looted several properties before kidnapping 5 village chiefs and demanding a ransom.

A local councillor was abducted by unidentified gunmen believed to be from his own sub-clan in Burco on 17/05. The motive of the abduction remains unclear but it is believed to be related to a recent no-confidence motion tabled by some local councillors including the abducted official against the mayor of the town over corruption allegations. The councillor and the mayor both hail from the same sub-clan (Habarjeclo/Reer Biniin). The abducted councillor was reportedly taken to Naqdhibiijo Village (46km SE of Burco). Burco police conducted security operations in the outskirts of the town in search of the abducted official.
Unidentified gunmen abducted 20 people from the north-western Yumbe District, bordering South Sudan, and pillaged a village in Moyo district, stealing cattle and food.

Al Shabaab fighters in Xarardheere district reportedly started to forcefully recruit students from the Koran schools (Madarasa) on 16/05. The group is reportedly targeting teenagers. The recruitment drive seems to be related to al Shabaab's agenda to improve their military capacity in the region. It is not clear whether the group will send those youngsters to be trained or to fight directly.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: A butcher is abducted by members of the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) militia on Monday, he refused to pay compensation for agricultural crops
Gunmen abduct a tribal leader and 2 others between Saraf Omra and Karnoi in June.

assoc_actor_1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Suspected SPLA-IO allied rebels abducted 23 Ugandans in attacks targeting vehicles travelling along the Juba-Nimule highway in May. SPLA-IO denied the claims.
Mayi Mayi militiamen stole about 40 pirogues from the Visthumbi area, near Nyakakoma, and kidnapped 3 Ugandan fishermen.
As reported on 11 May 2016, IS abducted 12 civilians in Mosul - Al-Hadbaa for trying to communicate with the relatives outside the city of Mosul.

Unidentified assaillants kidnapped opposition Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) Vice Chairperson for youth after attending prayers in Kampala. She was found on 23 May. She suffered serious injuries while she was held by the group.
A Sudanese coptic priest is abducted by three gunmen in a landcruiser in Nyala
Militiamen intercept a water tanker en route from Sortony to Kabkabia and abduct 3 camp residents traveling on board.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: Houthi militants kidnapped an office worker in Dhamar on 9 May. No further details were reported.
Militiamen abduct 2 women in Mashrou Abu Zeid near Jabal Marrah.
Militiamen kidnap 2 displaced from Karkara market.

Six people from Majeerten/Omar Mohamud sub-clan were kidnapped by suspected armed clan militias from Majeerten/Osman Mohamud sub-clan in Sanjilbo Village (8km NE of Qardho) on the evening of 06/05. The perpetrators took their captives to Xabaalreer Village (47km NE of Qardho).

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2015-2016) Supreme Revolutionary Committee
notes: Houthi-Saleh forces kidnapped 11 UN employees after their arrival in the Al Hadba area of the Far Al Udayn district, Ibb governorate.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
notes: 3 Congolese ICRC workers were kidnapped as their convoy went through the village of Kyaghala in Rutshuru. They were later released.
Suspected Murle militia abduct 2 children from Dong Boma of Liith Payam in Twic East.
Ethiopian soldiers allegedly abducted five students at Haramaya University.
On 28 April, Boko Haram elements kidnapped women in Limani, Mayo Sava.

A former Minister of state for Education, Senator Iyabo Anisulowo was on 27/04 kidnapped by armed men alongside her security aide along Igbogila road in Yewa North (or Egbado North) local government area of Ogun state on 27/04.
Displaced woman and daughter abducted near Sortony camp.
Reported on 26 Apr. 2016, IS arrested 100 civilians in Bab al Toub in Mosul - Old City.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: RSF abduct a displaced man at gunpoint in Kabkabia.

On 25 Apr 2016, New People's Army (NPA) From 19A members detained 6 reelectionists and demanded them to pay permit-to-campaign (PTC) fees in San Francisco, Agusan del Sur. They were freed after the brief detainment.
Reported on 25 Apr. 2016, IS arrested 25 Iraqi youth in a campaign conducted by the militant group to limit the cooperation with the Iraqi security apparatus.
Abala militia kidnap 2 from Kalma camp, demanding ransom.

source: Agence France Presse; Xinhua General News Service
notes: A Serbian worker was kidnapped in Libya, while visiting Messla Oil Field near the border with Egypt. He was released on the 27 April.
LRA rebels ambushed 6 people between Dungu and Sambia, stealing their property and forcing them to transport it before releasing them.
A Congress booth worker Basu Malpaharia was abducted by the TMC workers and was later rescued. A complaint was lodged at the Hariharpara Police Station.
LRA rebels abmushed 6 artisanal miners near Sambia, while traveling to Dungu. They had their property stolen and were kidnapped, but 4 managed to escape.

There were reports that IS fighters in Gwarsha captured two medical workers from the Benghazi Medical Centre who were working at the front. It is unclear how this happened but it suggests that IS fighters are still capable of mounting counterattacks. The fate of the two men is not known.

assoc_actor_1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: 5 aid workers of the NGO Mercy Corps were abducted by alleged Nyatura fighters and FDLR in the Mushikiri area between Nyanzale and Kikuku. The workers were later released.
In election related violence, a CPI(M) agent was abducted from a booth in Kankartala of Dubrajpur constituency under Birbhum district.
5 people were abducted by LRA rebels during an attack on the village of Agoumar in the Rafai area. The villagers reportedly fought back, injuring and capturing one LRA fighter.

assoc_actor_2: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
notes: Three ICRC workers kidnapped and freed one week later.
Murle militia abduct a boy in Nyinmajok in Kolnyang.
The finance manager of Afriqiyah Airways was kidnapped in Tripoli on 16 April.

On 15 Apr 2016, 4 Indonesia crewmen were abducted by the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG) in the waters off Sitangkai, Tawi-Tawi. Six managed to flee, one crewman who was injured. The abducted crewmen were eventually freed by the ASG around 11 May 2016 in Jolo, Sulu, Philippines.

A group of fans from Benghazi are reported to have been seized in Tripoli after attending the final of the national volleyball championship on 15 April. According to an Ahly club official, they were grabbed afterwards by a Benghazi Islamist militia commander known as Abu Azam.
Militiamen kidnap a shiekh and 2 others in Central Darfur and held for ransom. Released 7 days later after negotiations in Kibro.
Gunmen kidnap a Coptic priest in Bielel.
As reported on April 13, Islamic State militants kidnapped 33 people from Haweeja while they were trying to escape to Al Alam east of Tikrit.
On 13 April 2016, IS kidnapped 33 civilians in Kirkuk city. The civilians were on their way to the Hamarin Mountains.
Gunmen in military uniforms abduct 5 civilians, including 4 members of Darfur Referendum Commission in Galab.

The General Electricity Company of Libya (GECOL) reported that eight of its trucks loaded with 500 wooden telegraph poles were stolen by armed militias. The trucks had left Tripoli heading south but were stopped at the Shwerif area. GECOL named the person responsible for the theft as Abdelhamid Abukhres Al-Magarhi. He was accused of kidnapping the drivers of the trucks and holding them prisoners at his home. It reported that Magarhi took the vehicles and their loads.

CPM polling agent Zulfan Ali was abducted from booth number 289 of Ghatal. While the CPM alleged that ruling party workers had been behind this, the Trinamool district leadership brushed aside all allegations.
A traditional leader from Kimbili village was kidnapped by Raia Mutomboki Mabala militiamen.
2 men dressed as police kidnap a Rwandan national in Bujumbura.
As reported on April 4, Islamic State militants kidnapped 30 youths from Haweeja district and took them to an unknown destination.

source: Associated Press International; Philippines Daily Inquirer
notes: On 4 Apr 2016, six Christian sawmill workers were abducted by suspected Muslim militants in Butig area, Lanao del Sur. 4 were freed on 11 Apr 2016.
On Sunday, April 3, 2016, Islamic State started mass arrests targeting Mosul's young men.

A Misratan journalist was kidnapped on his way to a press conference called by Faiez Serraj at Tripoli's Bu Sitta naval base. He was released a day later. The family reported that his car was later found abandoned near a base of a Haithem Tajouri's Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade. When relatives approached the brigade, they claimed they were told that the man had been released but then been picked up by militiamen belonging to Abdul Ghani Kikli (aka Ghneiwa). When this militia was in turn approached, this was reportedly denied.
Three children were kidnapped and later escaped.
Former Seleka rebels abducted a young trader in Batangafo a few days after the signing of a non-aggression pact between armed groups and communities in the city.
On 31 March, the village chief of Djiala (Kossa), Mayo Sava, was kidnapped by Boko Haram men.

On 31st March five Civil Registry Authority (CRA) employees were kidnapped from their workplace at Libya Telecom and Technology (LTT), Libya's main state ISP. The Deputy head of the CRA accused the Bab Tajura militia in control of Libya's intelligence service representing the internationally unrecognized Tripoli government.

On March 29, Municipal leader of AKP Ispir (Erzurum) was reportedly kidnapped by PKK militants on a highway between Bingol and Diyarbakir, when their vehicle was stopped by PKK militants who saw his AKP ID.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: FARDC soldiers allegedly arbitrarily detained a boatman and demanded a ransom before releasing him in the Kabeya-Kamuanga area.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: A widely-followed blogger and social activist disappeared from his Marj home along with two friends on 28 March. It is being claimed that the trio were seized by three armed men in military uniforms who drove them away in a black Chevrolet. At the time an army spokesman denied that the authorities had arrested the young men. It was suggested that they had travelled to Ajdabiya to be with Ibrahim Jadhran.
Suspected Abu Sayyaf militants took 10 Indonesian sailors hostage after seizing their tugboat off Tapul, Sulu area on 26 March 2016.

On 26 Mar 2016, 10 Indonesia crewmen were abducted by the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG) while their tugboat was sailing from South Kalimantan province, Indonesia to Batangas province, Philippines. The tugboat has been recovered in the waters of Languyan, Tawi-Tawi, and the abducted crewmen were eventually freed by the ASG on 1 May 2016 in Jolo, Sulu, Philippines.
In Tripoli, two Bangladeshis were kidnapped. They were chased and seized by five armed men in a car. It is believed that the gunmen were members of IS.
Military kidnapped several people from Mutakura neighbourhood.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: MONUSCO reported that 8 individuals, including the former head of the village of Kaitango, were kidnapped by FRPI militiamen in the region between Kaitango/Kaimagaro in the Bukiringi area.
On Mar 23, IS militants abducted three former Iraqi soldiers from their homes in southern Mosul for allegedly cooperating with Iraqi security forces.
Boko Haram abducts 18 women and two girls from Sabongari in Adamawa on 23/03.
23 people were abducted by a Mayi Mayi militia led by Chuma Maliene Jado. They were released after a payment of a ransom.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: FRPI elements attacked the village of Kagaba, assaulting two women and kidnapping 4 others.
On 19 March 2016, in Kan Souk Village, Kyauktaw Township, Rakhine State, soldiers from LIB 538 of the Myanmar army forced 3 villagers to carry rice through the jungle.

Between 17-19 Mar 2016, in, Paletwa Township, Chin state, soldiers from LIB 538 of the Myanmar army forced villagers from Pikhyang, Laymyo Chaung, Upae and Kawae Villages to serve as guides and porters.
On 18 March 2016, in Kan Souk Village, Kyauktaw Township, Rakhine State, soldiers from LIB 538 of the Myanmar army forced 9 villagers to carry rice through the jungle.
Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a khat vehicle near Komorogoof village (32km SW of Doolow) on 18/03. The vehicle and the cargo was burned and the driver was taken to an unknown location.
As reported on March 17, Islamic State militants kidnapped 25 Turkoman children from an orphanage in Mosul and took them to a training camp in Telafar.

The chairman of Rahila fuel distribution company disappeared on 16 March while on his way home to Zawia. He is presumed to have been kidnapped. He was last seen outside his office in Tripoli's Hay Andalus district.
Man forcefully abducted into a police vehicle in Cibitoke and taken to unknown destination.
Al Shabaab abducts three humanitarian workers from Siidimo on 15/03.

source: Egypt Independent; Aswat Masriya; Libya Herald
notes: Fifteen Egyptian workers were abducted by Islamic State (IS) militants in Tripoli, Libya. They were apparently abducted at noon on 14 March as they returned home from work in Tripoli. Aswat Masriya reported that they abducted around 11 March.
The leader of Khoms military council was kidnapped on 14 March along with an assistant and Khoms customs director near Tripoli's Salaheddin district. They were later released on the same day.
A female doctor was kidnapped in Tripoli on 14 March. She disappeared in front of Masra private clinic on Shara Al-Shat in Tripoli. The second incident in a week.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
assoc_actor_2: Hema Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A significant member of the Hema community was kidnapped by FRPI militiamen.

A Jumhouriya Bank general manager was kidnapped along with two other bank officials. They were seized from the bank's offices in Shara Al-Serim in Tripoli. It is not known who took them although the leader of one of Tripoli's militia's has been accused.
Militiamen abduct a man on road between Golol and Thur.
A leader of the Mayi Mati Nyatura militia kidnapped a girl from the Mpati IDP camp in Masisi.
Armed men searched houses and kidnapped 5 people, injuring others, in three villages in the Tchabal area.

assoc_actor_2: Houthi Movement - Ansar Allah; GPC: General People's Congress
notes: Islamist militants kidnapped an unspecified number of supporters of the Houthi movement and members of the General People's Congress in the city of Taizz, Taizz governorate.
A female doctor was reportedly abducted in front of Masra private clinic on Shara Al-Shat in Tripoli.
Unidentified persons kidnap an Edo State magistrate in Obadan on 10/03, reasons not known.
Murle militia abduct 4 children from Jalle Payam. In a separate incident, unknown attackers kidnapped 3 other children from nearby Baidit.
3 children abducted by unknown group in Baidit. Rescued the following day.

actor1: AQAP: Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
notes: AQAP militants kidnapped Haydara Daha, tribal leader and alleged governor of the Abyan governorate in the Musaymir area west of Zinjibar, Abyan governorate. No casualties were reported.
A lawyer was allegedly arrested and kidnapped on 7 March by police forces from his house in Gharbeya. His family said his whereabouts is still unknown and they do not know of what he is accused.
11 people were kidnapped and their property was stolen by LRA rebels in Tabane in the Zemio area.
On Mar 05, IS militants abducted 13 motorcyclists in central Mosul, following an incident where an IS militant was killed by a motorcyclist.
Unidentified gunmen attacked a house in Hachana, assaulted and kidnapped a man, before freeing him a few hours later. They also stole food and covers.
Journalist kidnapped and beaten, and released alive near a graveyard in Juba.

Agents of the Department of State Services (DSS) invade the Ekiti State House Assembly, abducting four lawmakers. It is believed the four were kidnapped after they refused to involve themselves in the impeachment process of the governor.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 3 Save the Cildren employees were kidnapped from a convoy of vehicles in the Lubero area by unidentified armed men. They were later released.
Gunmen suspected to be "pipeline vandals" abducted three girls from a hostel in Ikorodu on the evening of 29/02.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2015-2016) Supreme Revolutionary Committee
notes: The daughter of a detainee said that a group of gunmen of Ansar Allah arrested her father while he was having breakfast meal with seven friends in Al-Zobairy Street, in the capital Sana'a. They took him and his friends to a police station before transferring him to the security directorate of Al-Wahad district in A'sir area. At that time, the family was informed that they were transferred to the investigation department in Baghdad Street. Ansar Allah denied that her father and his friends were held by the group.

The Swiss-based organisation Alkarama reported two enforced disappearance case of two Egyptian students to the United Nations Working Group on Enforced or Involuntary Disappearances (WGEID). The second student was arrested from a pharmacy in the Fifth Settlement where he works, along with the pharmacys owner on 28 February.
On Feb 27, IS militants abducted three administrative employees working for Sama channel in al Hadbaa district, Mosul.
A group of lawyers in Sharqeya claimed that a police conscript "kidnapped" their colleague in a case of enforced disappearance. The Ministry of Interior denied the claims.
Alleged CPM supporters abducted Gunamala Debbarma, Lalu Kumar Tripura and Sachindra Debbarma, all BJP candidates, from Salema block to force them not to contest the polls.

Armed men reportedly abducted a known local businessman, Abadur Mohsen, belonging to the Bohra group, from the front of his house in Enma in Al Mansourah of Aden. It was also reported that they had taken his car; February 22.
Journalist kidnapped and tortured in Juba, released the next week.
Three journalists working for Anadolu Agency were kidnapped by PKK members on February 21 in Nusaybin district of Mardin. PKK released the journalists on the same day to HDP members in the same area.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: Houthi militias kidnapped two civilians in Alvevani area of Huth district, Amran governorate, on 21 February.
Gunmen attacked a government official in Jubas Gudele area, kidnapping him and later releasing him.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Libya (2014-) House of Representatives
notes: A local House of Representatives (HoR) member Abdulnabi Abdulmuali was seized by unknown gunmen after returning to Zawia from Tobruk on 19 February.
Independent councillor of the Kandi municipality was abducted by Trinamul activists on February 16.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: SNR agents abduct a girl in Mutanga, later released her.

A local police chief (chef de poste) in Nyakabiga and former member of the judicial police, Donatien Twizera, disappeared in early February. Twizera had worked on a sensitive investigation into the murder of three Italian nuns in Bujumbura in September 2014, which may have implicated members of the intelligence services. The victims motorcycle was found outside Bujumbura.

An unidentified group (suspected to have been Abu Sayyaf) abducted three fishermen and demanded ransom. The boat was hijacked between Basilan and Zamboanga City on 15 Feb 2016. By 20 Feb 2016, two fishermen had been released, but ransom was still being demanded.
LRA rebels have allegedly abducted as many as 296 people from CAR and DR-Congo in the first quarter of 2016, according to the NGOs Resolve and Invisible Children.
LRA rebels have allegedly abducted as many as 296 people from CAR and DR-Congo in the first quarter of 2016, according to the NGOs Resolve and Invisible Children.
The Maoists abducted two employees from Uren under the jurisdiction of Jamalpur rail police.

Senior Afghan politician and former governor Syed Fazlullah Wahidi was kidnapped in Islamabad by unidentified, but suspected TTP militants. Through cover operations he was recovered 2 weeks later in Mardan, KPK.
A communications engineer from Kufra was kidnapped in Tripoli.
On February 12, three truck drivers were kidnapped by unidentified armed men in the Darbandihkan area.

assoc_actor_2: Kurdish Ethnic Group (Iraq); Government of Iraq (2014-2018)
notes: On February 12, three Kurdish employees of the Presidential Protection Brigade were kidnapped by unidentified gunmen in Tuz district.
NRM member Muhabwa was allegedly kidnapped in Kibinge Sub County. He had earlier attended a campaign rally by the Democratic Party parliamentary candidate Kiyingi.
The cousin of House of Representative's member for nearby Maya Omar Ali Tantoush and a lawyer working with the economy minister, was kidnapped.

Ain Zara councillor Mohamed Margheni was abducted along with his office manager on 10 February by an unknown armed group. The reasons of the abduction are unknown although there are reports of an internal power struggle. He was released the next day.
On February 8, Islamic State fighters arrested 35 residents from markets and public places in Mosul.

Unknown armed men reportedly kidnapped Mansour Saleh Al-Henshi, a senior military officer in charge of giving out salaries, while he was traveling on a road near Al-Bureihi Hospital in Al Mansourah in Aden; February 8.
1 abducted in Dobo Umda.
Gunmen kidnap 1 displaced in Saluma.
Gunmen kidnap 1 displaced in Daba Naira.
A dozen people were abducted from Akpo village near Bria by LRA rebels. They were used to transport goods that the LRA fighters looted from the town.
19 were reportedly arrested on 4 and 5 February and were forcibly disappeared afterwards. They later reappeared in Al-Montazah Police station in Alexandria on 13 February.
2 students abducted from Konj village, half a kilometre east of Golo.
Abala militia abduct several Salamat members in retaliation for Abala man being injured.
19 were reportedly arrested on 4 and 5 February and were forcibly disappeared afterwards. They later reappeared in Al-Montazah Police station in Alexandria on 13 February.
Soldiers abduct 5 from Mutakura.
LRA rebels attacked the towns of Ouango and Niakari between Feb.2-4, kidnapping 20 people. They later released 9.
LRA rebels attacked the towns of Ouango and Niakari between Feb.2-4, kidnapping 20 people. They later released 9.
Gunmen posing in police uniform abduct a trader in Gitamo.
4 people were kidnapped by Raia Mutomboki militiamen in the mining town of Nduma.
A 17-year-old Coptic girl was kidnapped by two men riding a tuc-tuc on 31 January in the village of Hassan Basha in Samalout, Minya.
As reported on January 30, Islamic State militants have kidnapped around 30 children from a primary school in Mosul.

Human Rights Monitor reported an extra-judicial violence case in which police forces arrested a man on 30 January while he was visiting his relative in Al-Aqrab prison. The group reported that Ibrahims family said their son did not return home after the visit.
At least 6 people were kidnapped by Raia Mutmomboki militiamen as they were on their way to a seminar on sexual violence in Lulingu. They were later ransomed.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: FRPI attacked Bikima in the Irumu area. They kidnapped 5 people to help them transport the goods.Approximately 70 cows and other property looted
Unidentified gunmen abduct traditional ruler in Isoko South Local Government Area.
Suspected TTP militants kidnapped six people, including a tribal elder and some officials, from Sanjavi area in Loralai district on Jan 28 when they were returning home from another elder's house.

Unidentified assailants at 10 pm on Wednesday abducted 2 individuals from New Sangbar village under Umrangsu Police Station and then proceeded to Thingdol village, from there they abducted anothe person. Then they went to Dimainu village and fired several rounds in the air.

Unidentified assailants at 10 pm on Wednesday abducted 2 individuals from New Sangbar village under Umrangsu Police Station and then proceeded to Thingdol village, from there they abducted another person. Then they went to Dimainu village and fired several rounds in the air.
4 people were kidnapped by LRA rebels in an attack on Tambourah town.
LRA kidnap 4 farmers in Boro Madina, Raja County. Military of South Sudan rescued the farmers.

A senior member of the Misratan 3rd Force, was abducted in al-Shati in South Libya. A convoy of vehicles from Misrata headed south in response. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the Ben Nayal tribe militias (seen as pro-Gaddafi) were involved in the kidnapping. No mention of a battle.
Unidentified gunmen abducted a man at Igbedi Community in Kolokuma/Opokuma Local Government Area of the state during the nighttime hours. The reason for the abduction is not known.
Military kidnap two young men.
LRA rebels looted the St. Andrew Catholic Church, injured a nun, and kidnapped two civilians in Bakouma.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2015-2016) Supreme Revolutionary Committee
notes: On 22 January 2016, 47-year-old political activist Abdulrahman Saeed Hasan Al-Buriahi was driving home with his son, Soheib, when they were stopped by members of the Houthi-Saleh Coalition in civilian clothes at the Khamsine Avenue, in Sana'a. They were then both immediately arrested and taken to an unknown location. While Soheib was released one month later, his father Abdulrahman remains disappeared to date. His family was informally told that he is currently detained at the Political Security Headquarters, however they received no official confirmation.
Unidentified gunmen kidnapped four members of the Bohra Shia minority in the city of Aden, Adan governorate. 3 have been released.
LRA rebels attacked the village of Tomboura on the "Obo-Zemio axis". They looted the health centre and kidnapped 16 people, who were later released.
LRA rebels injured 4 civilians and kidnapped people in the localities of Nzacko and Popo near Bria.
A young Tripoli imam was abducted by unknown gunmen as he headed from from Ishaa prayers at his mosque in Tripoli.
A man is enforceibly dissappeared by the military.

source: Xinhua General News Service; Al Jazeera-English; Xinhua General News Service; ISIS Live Map; Bas News; Rudaw; Iraqi News
notes: On January 17, unidentified gunmen wearing military uniforms kidnapped three Americans in the Doura district of Baghdad (Al Rashid). Some sources suggest that the unidentified gunmen were part of an Iranian-backed Shia militia but this is not confirmed. According to Iraqi News, Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi expressed doubt that the three Americans were kidnapped and denied allegations that Iran played a role in the incident.
35 people were kidnapped by Mayi Mayi Simba militiamen in the Mambaka locality, close to Biakatu.

The Director of the passport authority Gharyan branch was kidnapped on 17 January in mysterious circumstances. The man disappeared in Al Regaiat on Kassarat highway on his way back to Gharyan from Tripoli.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2015-2016) Supreme Revolutionary Committee
notes: Three Yemeni journalists working for Al Jazeera, Hamdi al Bokari, Abdulaziz al Sabri anf Moneer al Sabai, are suspected to have been kidnapped by an unidentified armed group in Taizz city, Taizz governorate. Upon release on 28/01, they said that they had been kidnapped by Houthi fighters.
IDPs abducted from in Jabal Koli near Tabit.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: FDLR rebels have allegedly kidnapped five Ugandans for ransom in the course of the month of January. Location of kidnapping unknown, though likely near the border with Rwanda.

assoc_actor_1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
source: Sahara Media news agency ; Xinhua; Agence France Presse
notes: Al-Qaida linked "Emirate of the Sahara" group kidnapped an elderly Australian couple. On February 6th, Al Mourabitoune claimed responsibility for this event, also stating that he carried out the kidnapping under Al Qaedas orders.
SPLA/M-IO accuse soldiers of abducting three women from Lanyi.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Man abducted for two days by Imbonerakure in Ngozi.

source: Libya Herald; Libya Security Monitor; Al-Wasat
notes: There are unconfirmed reports that Islamic State militants are holding more than 150 men in a compound in Nufaliya, 140 kilometres east of Sirte. Their offence has been that they either refused to join the fighters or declare their allegiance to IS.

Al Shabaab fighters reportedly abducted another al Shabaab fighter in the vicinity of Idale village (56km SW of Baidoa) in the morning of 13/01 while heading towards Baidoa. Reports indicate that the al Shabaab fighters suspected the member of being spy for SNG forces.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 2 people were kidnapped by unidentified gunmen in the Butsha area after they fired upon their vehicle.
Sheik abducted from camp in Korgol.

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: SPLA-IO kidnapp the commissioner of Kangapo County during Sunday services in early December.
LRA rebels killed a villager and abducted dozens of others during two weekend raids around Diya, about 600km east of Bangui.
Abala herdsmen raid Katur and took hostages to demand payment for dead camels.
Militiamen injured 2 villagers, abducted three.
As reported on January 9, Islamic State militants abducted 54 families in the Hamrin mountains near Haweeja.
Armed group abduct a person from Kinanira.

Thirty people from the city of Sabratha were kidnapped in nearby Surman on Friday connected to the Shershary children kidnapping. The kidnapping was in revenge for the arrest of a kidnapping and extortion cell in the western region.
An influential landlord reportedly tortured a man after kidnapping him over a land dispute. The assailants fled from the scene after throwing the victim outside Lahore's Mayo Hospital on Thursday.

actor1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
notes: Gunmen abducted a Swiss woman, Beatrice Stockly, from her home for the second time. AQIM later claimed responsibility.
On Jan 05, Islamic State militants abducted 25 civilians on charges of cooperating with security forces in the villages of Shaut and Haot in al-Hawija.
A group of Maoists abduct and shot a TDP: Telugu Desam Party members in Jerrela village in Visakhapatnam district.
Police kidnap two youths, including one girl injured on the head from a beating.
On Jan 04, Islamic State militants abducted nearly 80 teachers in Nineveh governorate.
Naxal abducted and released three Pune youths abducted in Chhattisgarh.
On Jan 01, Islamic State militants kidnapped over 200 people in Ramadi city.
A 25-year-old Sudanese man was abducted by LRA forces near Deim Bushara, Sudan in a mining camp.

actor1: PSLF/TNLA: Palaung State Liberation Front/Ta'ang National Liberation Army
notes: Twenty-three villagers have been missing since a series of clashes between the TNLA and the RCSS in late November. It is reported that the citizens, whose whereabouts are unknown, have been detained by the TNLA.
LRA rebels attacked the Ebale area, looting property and kidnapping 12 people.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters carjacked an ambulance in the outskirt of Dhusamareeb town in the night of 29/12. The carjackers also abducted the driver and another person to unknown location. Reports show that the Ambulance was contacted by some people who were pretending to be patients and asked the hospital to send an ambulance, but locals believe that this was an al Shabaab trap. The motive behind the abduction so far is unknown.
Soldiers reportedly kidnapped a 10th grade student at Ambo secondary school following protests against the governments master plan
4 kids abducted in Cibitoke.
2 kidnapped in Jabe.
Abductions in Buterere.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters abducted three Somalia local aid-workers, working for a local NGO in Tubaake Village (15km SE of Bardheere) on 27/12. The staffers were conducting outreach nutrition program but were stopped and taken to an unknown location. The motive is unknown. However, following local elders intervention the staffers were released later and return to their base in Bardheere.
A government official of Degema Local Council is kidnapped in Buguma, along with her son on 27/12, perpetrators not known.
Militants belonging to the Islamic State (IS) allegedly kidnapped six labourers in Kurram Agency and shifted them to Afghanistan.
Militiamen abduct one boy from El Gahra west of Kabkabia and one boy from El Amiriya in Kabkabia.

actor1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: Violence broke out in Chitungwiza yesterday, after a group of suspected Zanu PF supporters stormed a funeral wake and abducted one of the mourners.
LRA gunmen who attacked the Kungu area earlier in the month attacked Kpokpo area of Ango, looting food and livestock and kidnapping young people to help them carry the goods.
Boy abducted in Jebelein camp in Garsila.
Charcoal burner abducted in Tegaro village in Kass locality.
7 women abducted in Hamidiya camp.

A Coptic man was kidnapped for ransom in the village of Arab al-Awamer in Assiut, Upper Egypt. Armed strangers shot at his car's tyres and forced him into a car that had no licence plates and drove him outside the village.

Police arrested and detained a young woman for selling traditional Oromo clothes the day after a protest in East Wellega. After one week at a police station, where she was beaten, she was sent in an unknown location, where she suffered ill-treatment.
A Bayelsa State commissioner is kidnapped in Ogbia LGA.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Young man who had been jailed and released was then abducted by police and Imbonerakure in Muvyuko.
15 LRA rebels allegedly ransacked the Kungu locality of Ango, looting granaries and abducting 4 people to help them carry the stolen property.
An 11-year-old who lives in the village of Rahmaniya in Nag Hammadi, Qena, Upper Egypt was kidnapped in broad daylight. The exact date was not given.
A Maltese doctor working at Tripoli's St James Hospital was seized and taken away by unknown gunmen.
Woman abducted by Ethiopian militia.
A member of the Libyan National Commission for Human Rights was seized by gunmen in Tripoli. The group's rapporteur was abducted on 11th December. No further details of the kidnapping.
Pro-government militia on camel abduct two women from Mashrou Abu Zeid near Tabit.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
notes: A Burundian woman is forcebly disappeared after she is forced into a vehicle belonging to the National Intelligence Service. A call is later made to the victims relatives demanding a ransom.
Militia beat and abduct a man from Garsila camp.
Militia abduct man in Nemra.
Pro-government militia beat and abduct villagers from Shangil Tobay.
Fulanis kidnap three contractors in Onicha on 05/12, reasons not known.
Camp commander abducts 32 people from Mutakura.

FDC candidate for Nakaseke North MP, Ivan Masembe disappeared on 3rd December in Luwero, shortly after being nominated. He was discovered 6 days later. FDC chairperson for Nakaseke district, Sseguya Matovu insists Masembe has been under captivity for political reasons.
Seleka militia looted goods and abducted 30 people in Mbimbi, Bedamou and Ngoro villages in Dekoa, Kemo. Three managed to escape, while another three were freed by the group.
Seleka militia looted goods and abducted 30 people in Mbimbi, Bedamou and Ngoro villages in Dekoa, Kemo. Three managed to escape, while another three were freed by the group.
Seleka militia looted goods and abducted 30 people in Mbimbi, Bedamou and Ngoro villages in Dekoa, Kemo. Three managed to escape, while another three were freed by the group.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Libya (2014-) House of Representatives
notes: Nabil Aoun, the House of Representatives (HoR) member for Aziziya, was kidnapped by armed men on 30 November by an armed gang that broke into his home in the central Tripoli district of Zawiat Al-Dahmani. He is thought to have held at one of the prisons in Mitiga airbase. The reasons for his abduction - whether political or for ransom - are not known. He was freed on 27 January 2016.

actor1: PSLF/TNLA: Palaung State Liberation Front/Ta'ang National Liberation Army
notes: The Shan Nationalities Democratic Party (SNDP) accused the TNLA of abducting 23 villagers in Namkham Township end of November 2015. The TNLA denies the allegations.

11 Tunisian workers were kidnapped in Libya by armed men to pressure for the release of Libyan prisoner in Tunisia. The exact location of the kidnapping was not specified, although one of the abducted was reported to work in a restaurant in the oil refinery in Al-Zawia city.
5 civilians were kidnapped by Raia Mutomboki militiamen from the Ndarumanga faction during an attack on Lukidi village in the Ngweshe chieftancy. They also looted peoples homes.
Unidentified gunmen abducted a total of about 50 men from four villages in Shan State outside its largest township of Lashio.

A 26-year-old university graduate, and a member of the Ultras Ahlawy (UA07) fan group was forcibly disappeared when security forces stormed his house in Nahia, Giza. Over a dozen masked and armed police destroyed the apartment.

An 'extra-judicial' detention and torture case was reported in Shubra police station, involving a 16-year-old girl. The girl was arrested in the early hours of Thursday, after which she was detained and reportedly tortured in the police station.

actor1: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
notes: Security agents abduct an IDP student at gunpoint in Juba.
10 people were kidnapped in the Kimbili area, allegedly by Raia Mutomboki militiamen of the Mabala faction.
3 children abducted, 2 wounded by gunmen in Ajoope area of Pochalla.

A Canadian International College (CIC) Faculty of Engineering third year student was abducted from outside the universitys gate by unidentified gunmen. The victims friends were beaten and college security personnel did not interfere despite being present.

A former Egyptian air force general was arrested in an enforced disappearance at Cairo International Airport whilst on his way to Russia. It is believed that that his arrest was triggered by his intention of creating an opposition political party, the Civilized Alternative Party, and fears that he could be tortured while in secret detention in retaliation for his political affiliations.
Pro-government militia abduct two in Tanzam near Nerteti.

source: Libya Herald; Libya Prospect; The Libya Observer
notes: The Abu Salim Brigade (a Tripoli revolutionary militia group loyal to Abd-al-Ghani Kikli - also known as Ghnaiwa) set up checkpoints across Tripoli, even on the main highway on [17 November]. Eyewitnesses reported that anyone from Misratah was arrested. Dozens were said to have been seized, Libya Prospect reported the figure as 82.
Al Shabaab kidnaps a teacher at a refugee camp Hagadera. The victim was rescued four days later.
Ethiopian gunmen abduct 5 Sudanese farmers in Atarab and Tegelein, Basanda, El Gedaref.
On 13 Nov 2015, the Burmese Army forced a villager of Bang Gan village, in Namtu Township, Shan State to work as a porter.

The Swiss-based organisation Alkarama reported two enforced disappearance cases of two Egyptian students to the United Nations Working Group on Enforced or Involuntary Disappearances (WGEID). The first student was arrested from his home on 13 November 2015 by security forces and taken to an unknown location in a car. His mobile phone and computer were confiscated. In February it was revealed that he was being detained in 6th of October City Homeland Security.
Plain-clothed security agents kidnapped a man during a wedding. The exact location was not specified but the family were from Alexandria.

The former Libyan ambassador to Niger, is reported to have disappeared and is feared to have been kidnapped. According to the Beida officies of the Libyan news agency LANA, he apparently vanished on Thursday night at Gasr Khiyar, some 80 kilometres east of Tripoli.
Militiamen abduct 4 in Tawila.
Ethiopian militia abduct 2 Sudanese in Basunda.
People dressed in police uniform kidnapped 2 people from Kiyange area of Buterere.
A journalist working with Online News Agency was abducted by unidentified assailants in Shahbaz Town of Quetta city.

Gunmen hailing from Majeerteen/Omar Mohamud reportedly abducted a herder from Habar Gidir/Saad sub-clan near Lamo Ali Biid (16km N of Galkacyo) in the evening of 08/11. The motive is not clear but unconfirmed reports indicate the abduction followed after unspecified number of camels crossed to Saad area and presumed that the camels had been stolen by Saad. Omar Mohamud clan elders stepped in to release the victim.
In retaliation for an attack on one of their members, activists of the Mahar group kidnapped three PML-F activists.

A relative of Omar Tantoush - the head of the Wersheffana military council - was kidnapped in the Tripoli suburb of Suq Al-Juma, a Libya Dawn stronghold. He was confronted by an armed gang, bundled into a waiting vehicle and driven off to an unknown destination.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Libya (2014-) General National Congress

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 16 aid workers from CEDERU, an affiliate of the WFP, were abducted in the Katwiguru area of Rutshuru territory by an unidentified armed group. 2 women were later released.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: National intelligence kidnap 4 youth for alleged paramilitary training.

New rebel group Tiger Faction New Forces led by Yoanes Okij and made up predominately of members of the Shilluk ethnic group, holds Manyo County Commissioner hostage in Wadakona, claiming control over Wadakona as its headquarters.
Ethiopian gunmen abduct three farmers in Basunda.
Boko Haram conducted an incursion into the village of Gafe, abducting 6 civilians before the military could be alerted.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 2 Two Concern Worldwide workers, a Congolese citizen and a British national, were abducted outside Kibua by 4 men from an unidentified armed group.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) API Unit
notes: API abduct 2 men in Ntahangwa.
A Libyan cameraman working for the Chinese newsagency Xinhua has disappeared and is feared to have been kidnapped. Neighbours reported seeing him being bundled into a black 4X4 vehicle.
One of Omar Tantoushs - the head of the Wersheffana military council - relatives was kidnapped on 29 October in the Tripoli suburb of Siyahiya allegedly by Libya Dawn gunmen.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: Intelligence Services kidnap a person from Rubiza, Kanyosha.
Two families abducted by unknown group.
