actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure abduct two people in Bukinga.
Gunmen beat and abduct a displaced man in Kassab. Released the next day.
Gunmen abduct 3 residents of Dankoj camp while they worked on their farm in Wadi Bardi in Saraf Omra.
6 abducted from Gihanga.
A journalist from Al-Nahar newspaper was forcibly disappeared by Egyptian security forces on 23 October on his way to the Cairo International Airport for a trip to London.

Masked and armed Egyptian security forces raided the office of an organization in Cairo that trains and aides journalists on 21 October. The forces detained all staff members present in the office of the Mada Foundation for Media Development and the Journalists Syndicate accused security forces of kidnapping two of its members, considered an enforced disappearance.

actor1: Police Forces of Republic of Congo (1997-)
notes: According to Reporters Without Borders, a journalist was abducted by men in uniform after being repeatedly threatened by the Pointe Noire police. After escaping he has continued to be threatened with kidnapping and death by the local authorities.
Militiamen abduct and beat a cattle dealer in Kass.

Two gunmen hailing from Habar Gidir/Saad sub clan reportedly forcefully took an AK-47 rifle from a man hailing from Habar Gidir/Saleban sub-clan near Qaydarrey Village (125km W of Hobyo) in the morning of 18/10. In revenge, armed Saleban men, abducted two unarmed Saad men in the area.

Al Shabaab fighters carjacked a vehicle transporting khat in Tuulo Barwaaqo Village (18km N of Garbaharey) in the morning of 17/10. The al Shabaab fighters also took the driver and two other people on board. Reports indicate that the vehicle came from Beled Xawo and was heading to Garbahaarey when the incident happened.
Boy adbucted from El Mawashi camp in Kabkabia. Armed group beat the mother with rifle butts.
A teacher is kidnapped by suspected al Shabaab in Hagadera refugee camp. The teacher was later rescued by Kenyan forces across the border into Somalia.
Unidentified gunmen abduct five teachers in Agbar-Ndele. The motive for the kidnapping is not known.
On 12 Oct 2015, at Mowlon (Auk Ywa) village, Manton Township, Shan State, government troops from Div-77 forced villagers to carry loads.

12th October: over a hundred Tunisians were kidnapped at random by an armed group in the town of Sabratha. The seizures appear to be in response to the arrest Saturday of the Sabrathas acting mayor, Hassen Dhawadi, when he arrived at Carthage Airport, Tunis. They were later released.
Gunmen beat farmers. Several taken to hospital. 7 abducted, returned the next day.

actor1: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-) Military Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_2: IDPs/Refugees (South Sudan); UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
notes: Military intellgience agents abduct an IDP from Juba UNMISS camp.

Al Shabaab fighters abducted a civilian man from Luway sub-clan in Bulo Addoy (34km NW of Qansax Dheere) in the night of 11/10. Reports indicate that the motive of the abduction was in relation to the victims brother being one of the ISWA military officers leading recent military offensive against al Shabaab in Bulo Addoy village.
6 abducted by armed group in Gihanga.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: An unidentified armed group took the passengers of several cars traveling on the Bunia-Kaseny road hostage during an ambush on their vehicles.

Pro al Shabaab media reported that al Shabaab fighters abducted a SNA official from his residence located outside of Afgooye town on 08/10. They gave his name as Mohamed Haji Ai (aged 63) and also claimed to have seized his vehicle.

Militia men from Xawadle sub-clan abducted a lorry driver and his truck (Majeerten) in Jiracle (34km NE of Beled Weyne) on 06/10. The exact motive is unknown but reports indicate that it is a revenge for 2 other trucks that were carjacked in Puntland from Xawaadle owners.
Militiamen abduct a man in Tawila.
2 shepherds kidnapped in Buringa, later released along Rusizi river.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: About a dozen people were kidnapped off mini-busses by an unidentified armed group in the Busendo area of Rutshuru.
Myanmar military troops abducted civilians from villages in Mansi and forced them to work as porters.
Fulani gunmen abduct the traditional ruler of the traditional ruler of Apaa-Bunu community in Kabba-Bunu Local Government Area of Kogi State. The motive of the abductors is not known.
4 artisanal miners were kidnapped by NDC-Cheka militiamen in the Musindi area of Lubero territory.
Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Leer. Rebels accuse military forces of abducting 10 girls in attacks on Geer and Kany-gai in Leer County.

Elements from the organization of ISIL [Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant] imposed a cordon and siege on the area of Abu-Hadi, 17 km south of the city of Sirte, and abducted a group of youths from Al-Qadhadhafah tribe.
10 people were kidnapped by LRA rebels who arrived in the village firing their weapons in the air before plundering granaries and looting the village.

On 25 Sept 2015, near Momeik and Manton, Shan state, 9 Zupmai villagers and 10 Man Seng villagers have been forced to work as porters, inter alia to clear land mines, by Myanmar armys 88th Light Infantry Division soldiers, Northern Shan State. No fatalities noted.

Former vice chairman of Patani local government area was abducted by gunmen and whisked away to an unknown location. The victim was abducted along Isoko Road, close to Uloho Avenue junction. The reason for the abduction is not known.

On 22 September 2015, the Security Forces abducted the son of Mohamed El Beltagy, Secretary General of the Freedom and Justice Party - the political wing of the Muslim Brotherhood from his family home in Nasr City in the outskirts of Cairo. Since he was taken to an undisclosed location, his family has not heard from him since.

Sultan Wabars militia abducted a local businessman travelling from Ethiopia and heading to Borama on 21/09. The militia group reportedly accused the businessman of spying for the Somaliland government.
Unknown group from a neighbouring country attacked Halaib and Fashaga and abducted civilians.

Al Shabaab suspects abducted two youth Darood/Ogaden, Mohamed Zubeer travellers using Toyota Pajero from road junction 30km NW of Hoosingo Village (96 KM NW of Badhaadhe town) on 20/09. They were later released.
Murle militia abduct 2 children in Pinyleek village of Nyuak payam in Twic East County.
Two Indian medical staff were seized at the Ibn Sina Hospital in Sirte by Islamic State militants.
Herders abducted by militiamen in Mukjar.
On September 14th, 6 Balochistan Development Authority officers were abducted from their vehicle by Baloch Seperatist militants in Qila Saifullah district, Balochistan.

actor1: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
notes: Members of MASSOB abduct a Catholic priest in Onitsha, force him to conduct a mass. Police later arrested some of the perpetrators. Date of event vague: at least on or before 14/09.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) National Intelligence Agency
assoc_actor_2: MLC: Movement for the Liberation of Congo
notes: The Secretary-General of the MLC says that her son was picked up by intelligence officers at the Congo Protestant University and she has not heard from him since.
A group of unidentified armed men took about 50 villagers in Gbodoro, located 12km away from Bakouma, hostage and stole their food and money before leaving their village.

Three citizens from Al-Qaraboulli city, 60 km to the east of Tripoli, were abducted in Wirshiffana region on Thursday by highway bandits and a ransom of LYD 20.000 for each was demanded for their release. The rising abductions are linked to increased instability in Tripoli.
A journalist was kidnapped in Tripoli on 9 September.
A prominent doctor is kidnapped in Abakaliki. The demands of the kidnappers are not known.
Five unidentified gunmen kidnap the political aid of the PDP governor of Bayelsa.

On 6 September, Lashkar-e-Islam militants kidnapped 11 Tauheedul Islam (Aman Lashkar) members from the Sanda Pal area of Tirah Valley, Khyber Agency. They were later killed. Fatalities recorded on 7-8 September.
LRA rebels allegedly kidnapped 12 people in the Gbiavu area of Bondo territory. The attackers allegedly came over the Mbomu river from CAR.

On September 6, Islamic State militants allegedly abducted two Indians from Sirte, one of them a hospital worker along and took them to an unidentified location by blindfolding them. They were released on September 16.
Unidentified gunmen "at the weekend" abduct an Anglican bishop along the Onicha Ugbo/Ewhohimi road in Edo State.
Displaced man abducted from Camp Jebel, Saraf Omra, in retaliation for the mans brother escaping the group.
Unidentified gunmen attack and abduct a monarch in Gbarantoru.
Militiamen abduct 20 passengers in an ambush in Tawila.
There are unconfirmed reports that two daughters of a senior air force commander were kidnapped in eastern Libya. They were apparently seized in Marj.
The brother of a prominent former GNC member was kidnapped in Tripoli on 30 August. Forces allied to Libya Dawn are thought to have been behind his abduction.

The nephew of prime minister Abdullah Thinni was kidnapped outside his home in Beida by unidentified gunmen. It is not clear whether his abduction is linked to the accusations of embezzlement against Abdullah Thini and his whereabouts are still unknown.
Al Shabaab forcibly recruits, abducts children from Buale, Saacow and Jilib while they were at school.
Al Shabaab forcibly recruits, abducts children from Buale, Saacow and Jilib while they were at school.
Al Shabaab forcibly recruits, abducts children from Buale, Saacow and Jilib while they were at school.
Unidentified men abducted a protest organizer and took him to an unknown location.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: One person abducted by Imbonerakure.

Three men disappeared following their abduction from their home in Shubra El Kheima by Homeland Security officers on 23 August 2015. Men in civilian clothes claiming to be from Homeland Security broke into their home, destroyed objects and forced them into a vehicle that left for an undisclosed location.
Security forces reportedly forcibly disappeared a lawyer after he was arrested at his house in the city of Belbees in Sharqeya. So far, information on the lawyers location is still lacking.

A senior executive at Sebha-based Fezzan TV is reported to have been kidnapped in the latest assault on the television station. He was released three days later but no details were given about the circumstances.

Al Shabaab burnt unknown amount of charcoal stock in a charcoal dealers camp in the vicinity of Golasha Matrooba (100 KM SW of Kismaayo) and abducted five labourers on 17/08. Further reports indicate the labourers are still missing none of their relatives had known where they are about.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: One person abducted by Imbonerakure.
4 people were kidnapped by armed men in Gihanga.
Unidentified gunmen kidnap a woman in Shantalle Cinema (12/08).

Ten labourers residing in a primary school in Kurram Agency's Sarkai area were kidnapped while the school in which they were living and working on was burnt down. Officials believe militants have kidnapped the labourers.
09 August. LRA elements allegedly kidnapped five civilians in Bamunga.
LRA members kidnapped one man while he was on his way from the "kpo-kpo site" while he was on his way to Bria.
Boy abducted in Kabkabia. Released Monday after family paid ransom.
4 people were taken hostage by LRA gunmen from Kpokpo village in the Yalinga area.
06 August. LRA elements reportedly kidnapped two hunters in Nagilidanwe, near Duru.
About 60 people were taken hostage by suspected LRA members from the village of Mbari, although 45 later escaped.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
source: Les Depeches de Brazzaville; Agence France Presse -- English
notes: Between 6-8 Muslim preachers from Tanzania, as well as their driver, were kidnapped in the Kiseguro area of Rutshuru by FDLR rebels.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Border Guards
notes: Border Guards abduct 3 sheikhs from Fasi camp in Saraf Omra.
A young man was kidnapped by an armed group, dressed in military uniforms. They also robbed a store.
Four Indian nationals were detained near the Libyan city of Sirte on Thursday night. The area is under the control of Islamic State militants.
A man was kidnapped by armed men believed to be ex-Seleka rebels. The man was allegedly kidnapped as he was considered a traitor for working at the US army base in Sam-Ouandja.
A militant of FNL abducted and taken to an unknown destination.
Suspected Murle tribesmen abducted 3 children in Payeuny village, Bor county.
3 traders were kidnapped in the Nzako area, allegedly by LRA members.
A judge and member of Khoms Court of Appeal was seized by gunmen from the Islamic State (IS) when he was stopped at the checkpoint manned by them at Harawa, 70km east of Sirte.
A traditional ruler is abducted in Tombia. The abduction sparked a protest in Yenagoa.

assoc_actor_2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
notes: Gunmen abduct UNAMID worker, released on July 26.

On 22 July, A Croatian man working for French geoscience company CGG was kidnapped in Cairo by State of Sinai militants. The militants later released a video threatening to kill the abducted man if Muslim women jailed in Egypt were not freed.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Central African Republic (2014-2016)
notes: The mayor and deputy prefect of Baboua were taken hostage by unidentified gunmen. Other people were also kidnapped but they were released.
4 Italians working for a construction company in the Mellitah region were kidnapped by an unidentified group.

Islamic State militants reportedly seized three Christians (an Egyptian, Ghanaian and a Nigerian). The kidnapping took place in Noufliyah but the exact date was not specified. The release does not seem to be part of any reconciliation with rival towns. Though the authorities did not say so, it is likely to be a gesture to mark Eid Al-Fitr.
South Sudanese politican Peter Abdulrahman Sule abducted in Adjumani in July.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: The seller of the bi-weekly C-News on Victory Square in Kinshasa was allegedly kidnapped by men in civilian clothes. The paper was previously banned by the authorities, but no ban is currently in effect.
2 people abducted by an armed group on 5th avenue in Gihanga. They were directed to Rukoko forest.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 10 people were kidnapped in a raid by APCLS and Nyature Mayi Mayi militiamen in the areas of Biriba, Bukondo and Bahimba in the Walikale territory. The attackers also looted property.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 10 people were kidnapped in a raid by APCLS and Nyature Mayi Mayi militiamen in the areas of Biriba, Bukondo (lat/longs not available, grouped at Walikale) and Bahimba in the Walikale territory. The attackers also looted property.
Gunmen abduct a Rwandan refugee in Tawila.

actor1: Military Forces of Gambia (1996-2017) National Intelligence Agency
notes: Brothers Muhammed Fadel Hydara and Hatabu Hydara were reportedly picked up from their homes in Serekunda by alleged NIA members. They have not been seen since
A man who supplied local troops with rations was kidnapped on 8 July by unidentified men. He was seized near Ajdabiyas Security Directorate.

12 loggers were abducted by an armed gang near Kolling (lat/longs not available) in the Casamance region. The kidnappers demanded a ransom and they were later released on Jul.12. Local media believed that the kidnappers may have been a splinter of the MFDC.
A 23 year old girl was kidnapped near Sabha airport
6 people were kidnapped by LRA rebels at Sambia in the Dungu area while traveling to the market to sell agricultural goods.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed two men on motorcycles in Buur Weyn (29 KM S of Bulo Burte) in the night of 07/07. They were on their way, transporting khat to Bulo Burte. In the confrontation, one man was wounded and the second man was arrested by al Shabaab. Their motorbikes were also confiscated and nothing is known on their fate.
A civilian was kidnapped by an unknown group in Sabha city. His family paid the ransom and he was later released.
A village elder from Mera was kidnapped by the Mayi Mayi Cheka Guidon militiamen.
2 people were kidnapped by 6 unidentified gunmen with AK47s and military uniforms in Kabo. One was later released after a ransom was paid.
SPLM-N abducted two children from refugee sites in Unity state in 2015.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Libya (2014-) General National Congress
notes: The undersecretary at the Ministry of Awqaf and Religious Affairs in the Tripoli administration was kidnapped by an armed group in Tripoli.
An APC candidate is abducted in Akwanga during the overnight hours.

A Renamo group kidnapped and assaulted a traditional chief in the central province of Sofala, supposedly because he was mobilizing local people to undertake productive activities, in the context of publicizing the governments five year programme for the 2015-2019 period.
The wife of the former governor is abducted by unidentified persons at Agbura in Yenagoa LGA on 29/06.

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: SPLA-IO under command of Gen. Tanginye forcibly recruited boys in Fangak.
Five Tripoli port workers were seized by gunen from Rada (Special Deterrence Force).

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: A former CNDD-FDD kidnapped. His family accuses the Butanuka area manager of abducting people who refuse to keep working with Imbonerakure.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: 5 civilians were kidnapped during an ADF attack on FARDC positions in the Mayi Moya area (lat/longs not available), 50km north of Beni.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: A veteran CNDD-FDD was abducted by SNR agents.
The Deputy General Manager of United Bank was kidnapped near his home in Al-Khalaa in the Wirshefana area south west of Tripoli.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: 4 people abducted by Military men, including three members of CNDD-FDD; they were brought to the forest in Rukoko

Security forces seize a journalist from his house in Toukh, Qaliubiya governorate, seizing his laptop and mobile phone. The continuation of his detention and the unknown location of his detention is considered a forced disappearance.
The Director of Finance in the Ministry of Health was reportedly kidnapped in in Tripoli. The exact date was not specified.

actor1: Bor Clan Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan)
notes: Dozens of children from Lanya and Mangala areas of Equatoria have been abducted by suspected Dinka Bor and Murle tribesmen.
Soldiers and Bul Nuer militia abduct civilians in Kuerginya near Gwit.

actor1: Bor Clan Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan)
notes: Dozens of children from Liria and Jameza areas of Equatoria have been abducted by suspected Dinka Bor and Murle tribesmen.
A female polio supervisor from Union Council number 4 Gadap Town was kidnapped.
Militiary burns houses and abducts women in Dablual.
Eight Tunisians working in Tripoli were kidnapped. It is believed to be connected to the refusal by a Tunisian court to release a senior Libya Dawn commander.
A group of plainclothes police detained an April 6 activist in Alexandria. She was detained off official records in continued forced disappearances and secret detentions.

assoc_actor_1: Mbororo Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: More than 30 people were kidnapped by LRA rebels supported by Mbororo herders, who looted their homes during the night of Jun.8-9.
Militiamen injure 3 herdsmen and abduct 4 in area north of Tabit.
Two journalists were forcibly disappeared by homeland security from their prison cell in Tora Prison.
From June 7-9, Olonyis Agwelek Forces recruited 500-1000 children between ages 13 and 17 in Kodok and Wau Shilluk. Event coded to administrative capital Malakal.

Three Libyan charity workers were seized at Al-Shwayrif, 400km south of Tripoli. The three aid workers appear to have been abducted solely on the basis of their identity because they are from the town of al-Zawiya. The armed group appears to be holding the aid workers hostage in demand for the release of a man being held in al-Zawiya.

Two Libya aid workers were abducted June 5, 2015, in al-Shwayrif while they were on their way to deliver humanitarian aid to the south-west of Libya. The kidnappers would seek in exchange for their release, the release of a parent detained in their hometown of Zawiya since 2014.

assoc_actor_1: Bantu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Batwa Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 10 families were kidnapped by a Bantu ethnic militia called Luba Dragon in the territory of Manono and a ransom demanded.
Three students were disappeared after dining at a Cairo restaurant. After two weeks they appeared in different prisons.
Three men from Harawah were taken by Islamic State (IS) militants. They later handed them back in on-going negotiations between elders in the town.
88 Eritrean Christians were seized by Islamic State (IS) militants in an ambush attack near Oum Walid outside Tripoli.
At Nyanza Lac, a man was kidnapped on the night of June 3
A 23-year old freelance photojournalist was reported by her family to have been snatched on June 1 by security forces from a street in downtown Cairo, along with two male friends.

Two freelance photojournalist were announced missing Tuesday after disappearing since Monday near the Maadi Nile Corniche, in south Cairo, in more arrests and forced disappearances across Egypt. Approximately 150 people were arrested in the Maadi proximity that night.
The Kogi State Commissioner for Land and Housing is kidnapped by unidentified men on 31/05 in Osara, Adavi Local Council of the State.

Al Shabaab fighters in Salagle town picked two civilian men from their houses in the town in the evening of 31/05. The reason for the abduction remains unclear; and the abductees were taken to unknown location, both men hail from Awlihan sub-clan of Ogaden.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: FDLR rebels looted property and lifestock in the Mukondo area of Nyiragongo. Gunshots were also heard in the area. They kidnapped one villager to assist them in carrying the loot, who has not been found.

At least two students, from Students Against the Coup (SAC) and 6 April Movement were forcibly disappeared after being arrested by security forces on 31 May. The April 6 member was taken in an "arrest campaign" in Alexandria and the SAC member was taken from Cairo.

At least two students, from Students Against the Coup (SAC) and 6 April Movement were forcibly disappeared after being arrested by security forces on 31 May. The April 6 member was taken in an "arrest campaign" in Alexandria and the SAC member was taken from Cairo.
A member of Mellitah's administrative committee, was seized by a gang while travelling between Tripoli and Sabratha on Sunday. He was released unharmed 4 days later.
Unidentified armed persons took women polling staff hostage at Rasool Khan polling station and took away ballot boxes in election-related violence.
Armed men engaged in election-related violence in Bannu district, storming a polling station at Union Council Baizen Khel and damaging ballot boxes and papers. They also held polling staff hostage.
The brother of Libya's Justice Minister was kidnapped by unidentified men late Wednesday in Beni Walid.
Heavily-armed LRA rebels kidnapped 17 people and looted food from the Yangili locality before releasing 6 of them after forcing them to help them carry their loot.
A 44-year-old employee of the US Embassy, has been missing after government security forces visited his house on 25 May. It is believed to part of the forced disappearences by security forces.
Two militiamen ambush a group of 20 women in Kutum. 1 abducted.
Cattle herders abducted 13 farmers from Ronga Tas and Haidiya camps in Azum locality.
IS militants kidnapped a North Korean doctor and his wife in Al-Noufleya, eastern Sirte, when they were on their way to Tripoli after having finished work in Jalu hospital.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: 3 local community leaders were kidnapped by suspected FDLR rebels.
Unidentified gunmen abduct a woman in Aba, Abia State. The date and the motive for the kidnapping are not known - source dated 22/05.

assoc_actor_2: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: A ZANU-PF man is abducted by members of the Zimbabwean military. The victim is believed to be allied to Joice Mjuru.
The government in Beida claimed that 12 Jordanians were kidnapped in Tripoli. It did not say who they are or when they were seized.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: A representative of MSD in Gitega was kidnapped and held at the National Intelligence Service in Bujumbura.
The head of Tripoli Central Hospital, was abducted on 17 May. He was held in the Habda district of Tripoli by the Abu Salim Brigade.
16 cases of forced disappearence were reported in the governorate of Giza since April. The recent cases of forced disappearance have reportedly been linked to rising mobilisation in the streets.
60 cases of forced disappearence were reported in the governorate of Cairo since April. The recent cases of forced disappearance have reportedly been linked to rising mobilisation in the streets.

31 cases of forced disappearence were reported in the governorate of Kafr El-Sheikh since April. The recent cases of forced disappearance have reportedly been linked to rising mobilisation in the streets.

A group of unknown gunmen has kidnapped the member representing Toungo Counstituency in the Adamawa House of Assembly. The reason for the abduction is not known, though the politician had recently defected from the PDP to the APC.
5 girls abducted in Duk county in May 2015 by suspected Murle militia.
Pro-government militiamen attacked IDPs collecting firewood and abducted one from Sese camp, east of El Geneina.
Raia Mutomboki Mayi Mayi militiamen kidnapped 17 people, including some students, from Lukala, a town near Tshonka in the Shabunda territory. The abductions followed clashes with FARDC soldiers.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters confiscated a private vehicle and kidnapped the owner in Buur Weyn (29 KM south of Bulo Burte) on 13/05. The whereabouts and the fate of the driver are unknown and he stands accused of collaboration with AMISOM/SNF forces, who briefly took over Buur Weyn the previous week.
Al-Shabab kidnapped 14 crew members of an Iranian fishing boat off the coast of Galguduud.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters car-jacked a small truck, and kidnapped the driver, owner, his son and two other passengers. The motive is unknown but the owner could have defied the economic embargo imposed by al Shabaab on liberated towns.
Pro-government militia abduct a man in Kutum.
The director of Tripoli Central Hospital was kidnapped by an armed gang who stormed the hospital. It is widely suspected that it is politically motivated.

An ISWA soldier trainee who was visiting his family was abducted from his house in Hareri-Kaadoyow, approx. 7 KM SW of Baidoa on 10/05 by suspected al Shabaab fighters. They took him to Idale village, 57 KM SW of Baidoa together with his AK47. No more information is available on his fate.
The Raia Mutomboki Mayi Mayi militia has engaged in multiple raids in Kikamba in the Begala area of South Kivu, involving violence against civilians, kidnappings and systematic looting.
On 9 May, a Muslim Brotherhood sympathiser disappeared from Cairo. Although suspected of being held at a police station in Southern Cairo, officers denied holding him.

Misseriya militia abducted three Dinka Ngok women in Abyei while they were collecting firewood. The women were taken to an area called Maker to show where Misseriya could find cattle belonging to Dinka Ngok. Women were released later that day.

Al Shabaab abducted a local a pastoralist from Waraha Dhobley Village (45km NW of Buale) in the night of 30/04. Reports say the man was taken and detained in Buale. The reason of the abduction is not clear.

actor1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
notes: Security agents aducted two students near Kalma camp.
Pro-government militia abducted three men near Omi, near Nierteti.
The brother of the Chief of Warshefana Council of Elders was kidnapped near Janzur on Wednesday.

actor1: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: 1 person was injured and 3 others kidnapped by suspected "Hutu Nyatura" militia fighters after they ambushed a vehicle on the Kiwanja-Nyamilima road.

A group of gunmen suspected to be al Shabaab fighters stopped a mini-bus transporting goats from Maxaas to Buulo Burte in Abooreey (22km NE of Buulo Burte) in the night of 26/04 and abducted the owner and taking to unknown destination.
Francois Bizimana - spokesman of independent coalition Amizero yAbarundi - was kidnapped by unknown persons
Suspected Somali Al-Shabaab kidnapped two Kenyan teachers on the evening of 24/04 in the Mandera border town.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
source: Agence France Presse; Agence France Presse -- English
notes: 3 sub contractors with the UN anti mine service working with MONUSCO were kidnapped by an unidentified group in Kibumba, a farming community on the Rwandan border 30km north of Goma. The 3 contractors were later released without injuries.

A veterinarian and his son, who were affiliated with the Muslim Brotherhood, both disappeared after their unlawful arrest by the Egyptian Security Forces on 23 April 2015 in Qotour, 100km north of Cairo. The security forces took some money, phones and computers before forcibly dragging the two men outside without clothing.
Unidentified gunmen abduct the chairman of Ogbia LGA along the Otuasega-Okaki. Several gunshot reported fired by the gunmen, causing police in the area to flee.

Al Shabaab fighters allegedly abducted a header near Afmadow in the afternoon of 21/04 while grazing his animals. Reports indicate that the man was taken to Buale town in Middle Juba region (100km NE of Afmadow). The reason behind the abduction is currently unclear.
Five police officers from the Salam Police Station reportedly beat and electrified a 16-year old girl who claimed to have been kidnapped by a thug, claiming she had fabricated the story.

actor1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
notes: NISS and pro-government students abducted and beat a Khartoum University student leader at NISS offices near the Shendi bus station in Khartoum.
Recruitment: SAF recruits child soldiers in Wakara.

Gunmen abduct the chairman of Ahoada East local government area in Yiboko area. The chairmans party, the All Progressives Congress, boycotted the polls, which took place in six constituencies of the state.
Pro-government militia abduct a man in Kutum.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
source: Xinhua News Agency - French; Radio Okapi
notes: Between 30-40 people were abducted by FDLR rebels in an attack on Rwindi, and demanded a ransom from their relatives.
A group of women abducted a man securing a polling station in Dabri.
SPLM-N reported to have kidnapped civilians in South Kordofan the week of presidential elections.

assoc_actor_2: SPLM-Peace: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement (Peace Faction)
source: Sudan Tribune; African Centre for Justice and Peace Studies
notes: SPLM Peace Wing activist abducted from his home in El Roseires by unidentified group.

actor1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
assoc_actor_2: NUP: National Umma Party; SLM/A: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army
notes: Umma Party activist was forcibly taken from her car by suspected NISS agents in Omdurman. Farouk was released on April 15, after having been severely beaten while in detention. NISS also abducted another SLM member from her home in Omdurman.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A mans shop was looted by armed men who then took four people hostage, including the shopkeeper, to help them carry the goods. Afterwards they released the others and ransomed the shopkeeper. A primary school teacher also in Gihanga was robbed, kidnapped and ransomed by the same men as well. The armed men involved were allegedly Imbonerakure.
LRA fighters took a hunter hostage in the Obo area but he managed to escape.

Five members of the PDP were abducted by suspected pirates along the Brass waterway in Brass, Brass LGA. The PDP members were travelling to Twon-Brass to participate in the election the following day.

assoc_actor_2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
notes: Three militamen intercepted a UNAMID vehicle in Nyala, ordered the passengers to disembark at gunpoint, and abducted the driver. He was released later that day.
Unidentified gunmen abduct 30 Fulani men at a market in Sabon Birni. The kidnapping occurred "last week."
Unidentified gunmen, identified only as "militants," kidnap five Exxon Mobil workers in Qua Iboe Terminal Ibeno. The kidnapping may be related to the recent election.
Chadian soldiers have raided a village in Ngaoundaye and kidnapped 4 women and 2 men as a reprisal for a recent attack by the CAR rebel group Revolution and Justice (RJ).

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: WFP driver of Somali origin abducted by SPLA/M-IO forces along Mayom-Bentiu road while bringing food to displaced people. Rebels claimed the driver was transporting armed soldiers.

On 29 March 2015, Pyin So village, Paletwa Township, Chin State, the Arakan Army (AA) forced around 10 Chin men to dig a grave for a Myanmar army captain killed during clashes between the two groups and to carry loads to the border of Bangladesh. They were released after 2.5 hours.
Security agents stormed the home of a journalist in Cairo, confiscated his cell phone and laptop, blindfolded him and escorted him to an unknown location in an enforced disappearance.

The Baloch Liberation Front has claimed responsibility for the kidnapping of the head of the Kharan District Council. Sagheer Badini was newly elected and was on his way to a friends house. The BLF holds that the fate of the kidnapped will be decided after interrogations.

Gunmen from Dhulbahante/Hassan Ugas sub-clan reportedly carjacked a track and abducted three men from Hawiye/Hawaadle sub-clan who were on board at the time in the vicinity of Bali-Hadhac (62km NE of Buuhoodle) on 28/03. The motive of the attack is currently unclear but its believed to be related to a previous incident where gunmen from Hawiye carjacked a Dhulbahante track in Beled-Weyne area following a dispute over business. Reports indicate that Somaliland police in support of local Dhulbahante elders reportedly rescue the three men and their track and brought to Laas Caanood police station.

Militiamen in government uniforms abducted a resident of El Salam camp at gunpoint in Kabkabiyah. In nearby Wadi Berananjo, militiamen on donkeys assaulted four women and their children, shooting one child in the leg.
The economic attache at the Sudanese embassy in Tripoli was abducted and then later freed. The identity and motives of abductors was not disclosed.

assoc_actor_2: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
notes: The MDC-T welfare coordination officer for Marondera East Constituency is abducted by unidentified men.
TV presenter Michael Christopher supposedly abducted by elements of the military, after he was summoned to the military intelligence headquarters in Giyada in Juba.
Militiamen abducted sheikhs of Waro, Deidama, and Gio villages east of Deleig and held them ransom for money for the killing of a militiaman near Nyala on Apr. 21.
Janjaweed gunmen abducted two farmers near Dubo El Omda.

A former Ceel Buur District Commissioner during president Abdullahi Yusufs time was abducted by al Shabaab fighters in Daafeed village (21km SE of Ceel Buur) on 23/03. Reports indicate that the abducted man was taken to Wabxo village (43km NW of Ceel Buur). The motive is unknown.
Armed men set on fire to five oil tankers and kidnapped four drivers in Kirdi Gap, Mastung district.

A Standard newspaper journalist in Eldoret town said he was kidnapped outside his house on March 22, 2015 by people who questioned him about stories he had been writing about irregular land acquisitions by individuals in positions of influence. The journalist said he was threatened, drugged, and discovered unconscious two days later more than 40 kilometers away.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 2 drivers working for a well-known company in Goma were abducted in the Nyamilima area by an unidentified group.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: At least 8 people were abducted over the weekend (Mar.21-22) in the Rutshuru area by an unidentified group.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: According to MONUSCO, 2 people were abducted in Goma by an unidentified group.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: An unidentified group abducted 6 women and a baby are believed to have been in the Rwassa area of Kiwanja.
Al Shabaab kidnaps 30 outside a Mosque in Bandar and taken to Donburale, an al Shabaab control area. Many of the hostages were later released.
Gunmen abduct the traditional ruler of Bukkuyum, demands or political outcome not known.

assoc_actor_2: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
notes: A MDC-T district organising secretary for Mount Darwin District is abducted by unknown assailants. The victim is exposed to unknown chemicals and loses consciousness during his abduction.

source: Xinhua News Agency - French; Agence France Presse -- English; Associated Press International
notes: 16 people were kidnapped when a bus was seized near the CAR border at Babio by a heavily armed group believed to be made up of ex-Seleka rebels. Those kidnapped include four traditional leaders and the head of the Organization of Women of the Cameroon Peoples Democratic Movement (ORDPC). Some were later released, but reports conflicted over how many.
Unidentified gunmen kidnap a university provost from his home in Katsina-Ala, reasons unknown. The kidnapping led to a protest by students the following day.
Army and militia troops assaulted civilians near Golo. One man reported missing.

A group of 15 Ukrainian doctors were captured by a group of around 30 Islamic State (IS) gunmen from the Ibn Sina hospital in the Libyan city of Sirte on March 16 2015. They were released a day later, on March 17, according to the Ukrainian Foreign Ministry.
Militiamen on camels beat a group of villagers from Tiro, near Golo, and abducted one man.
Unidentified gunmen kidnap three Chinese workers in Lokoja. It was not immediately clear if the motive was ransom-taking. One police officer was killed when the gunmen launched their attack.

Al Shabaab abducted a woman from Shaw Village (21km NW of Jalalaqsi) on 13/03. The reason for the kidnap remains unclear. The woman was travelling from Jalalaqsi to Mogadishu on a minibus when the incident happened.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Libya (2014-) General National Congress
notes: An armed group raided the home of the Omer Al-Hassi's information minister, Ali Al-Huni and arrested him along with all his dinner party guests.

Following a MINUSCA operation to dismantle illegal roadblocks, Anti-Balaka fighters came back to Kouloumadja village outside of Bangui, accused a man of being a traitor, took his mother and brother hostage, then set fire to three houses.

On 10 March 2015, Bawng Koo village, Paletwa Township, Chin State, two minors and a 21-year-old were forcibly recruited by a warrant officer of Myanmar army's LIB 20. The two minors were released later; the whereabouts of the 21-year-old remained unknown.

actor1: MUJAO: Movement for Unity and Jihad in West Africa
notes: 2 Malian civilians were kidnapped by jihadists as they tried to drive towards Niger.
Activist Itai Dzamara, responsible for organising anti-government protests in Harare, is abducted by unidentified individuals.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 2 Congolese staff of the NGO Save the Children were kidnapped in the Rutshuru area, but were released 48 hours later after a ransom was paid.
A prominent Tarhouna elder, of the Al-Furjan tribe was reportedly seized by an armed group after making a call to General Khalifa Hafter.
Suspected Murle militia attacked Bor and abducted 2 children. 2 people also wounded.
Five Tunisian nationals were kidnapped and held in Janzour. They were released three days later. The identity of the perpetrators is unknown.

actor1: RUD: Gathering for Unity and Democracy
notes: Fighters from the RUD faction of the FDLR kidnapped several people.

Armed men believed to be al Shabaab insurgents took a civilian from his home at a bridge called Buundo Marehaan (1KM west of Luuq town) in the early morning on 05/03. The attackers were travelling with a pickup which they had left at a place far from the house and took the man to unknown location. The man was said to be from Marehaan sub clan of Darood and apparently was not involved in issues related to the SNG. The motive behind his abduction remains unknown.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Libya (2014-) General National Congress
notes: Unknown gunmen kidnapped the head of Hajj & Umrah department at the ministry of Awqaf and Islamic Affairs from his office in Tripoli on Wednesday. He was released two days later.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man was kidnapped by armed men who were allegedly Imbonerakure, taken to Rukoko and then ransomed.

source: Radio Tamazuj; The Resolve Crisis Initiative
notes: LRA abducts 13 boys in Nabiapai Boma, near border with Democratic Republic of Congo. 9 abductees were later released soon after capture.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: RSF stationed at Fanga abducted 7 boys as they walked in a group from the area southwest of Fanga to the camps of Tawila and Zamzam.
A government official was kidnapped in North Sinai governorate on Wednesday.

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Hundreds of men and boys were forcibly recruited by SPLA/M-IO in Old Fangak.

Al Shabaab fighters abducted three Xawaadle men in Ceel Ali/Halgan village (64km SW of Beled Weyne) in the morning of 26/02. The three men are believed to have been abducted for being members of Xawaadle clan militia who fought against al Shabaab fighters after Xawaadle pastoralists refused to pay Zakat demanded by al Shabaab late last year.

Five masked gunmen kidnap an American missionary from a school in Emiworo, Kogi State. She was later released the given to American authorities in the area (Agence France Presse - source dated 07/03).

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Mass recruitment of child soldiers by SPLA/M-IO in Panyijar.
A resident of Naivasha camp was abducted by 7 militiamen on camels in the area of Numeira, west of Tabit.

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Around 80 boys 13 to 14 years old forcibly recruited by SPLA/M-IO soldiers in Leer.

The deputy paramount ruler of Ikeinghenbiri, a coastal settlement in Southern Ijaw Local Government Area of Bayelsa State, Chief Collins Adikoko, has been abducted by gunmen. Family sources said three gunmen stormed the premises of the victim at about 2 am on Saturday and whisked him away in a waiting speedboat to an unknown destination.
Raia Mutomboki Mayi Mayi militiamen kidnapped the village chief of Nyamilingi in the Walikale area.
It was reported that at least 35 Egyptians were kidnapped in a round-up at various locations in areas controlled by Ansar Al-Shariah and IS.

Unidientified group forcibly abducted 89 schoolboys and 6 teachers that were preparing for exams in Wau Shilluk on Feb 16 and 17. UNICEF stated that the area is controlled by Gen Olonys government-allied Shilluk militia, but had no verifiable evidence of which group committed the abductions.
Johnson Olonyis rebel group forcibly abducted hundreds of schoolboys (originally reported as at least 89 abducted) and 6 teachers that were preparing for exams in Wau Shilluk on Feb 15 and 16.

Unidentified group abducted George Galus Mgoba, a chairman of the youth group. Mgoba was later released and underwent treatment at Muhimbili National Hospital, where police attempted to arrest him under suspicion of inciting unlawful assembly.
The UNHCR reported that at least 25 abductions by the LRA took place during February 2015 near the border between CAR and DR-Congo (8 of which were abducted on Feb.5 in the Digba area).
Two members of the National Commission for Human Rights-Libya, a non-governmental organization, were abducted on 13 and 14 February in central Tripoli. Both were later released.
Two members of the National Commission for Human Rights-Libya, a non-governmental organization, were abducted on 13 and 14 February in central Tripoli. Both were later released.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram hijacked a bus of 30 passengers in Tourou.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram stops a bus near Akada-Banga village of Bama district and abducted about 20 people, including women and children.
Fulani gunmen abduct the father of the former governor in Bokkos LGA. He was later rescued.
Al Shabaab abduct two clerics from a mosque in Xudur.
8 people have been kidnapped by suspected LRA rebels, who have also looted properties and agricultural goods in the localities of Digba and Dizaga in the Ango area.

Unknown gunmen kidnapped Mushtaq Abbasi, joint incharge of Muttahida Qaumi Movement's Unit City B, from Waleed Mohalla of Larkana city .MQM has recently protested against alleged kidnapping and extrajudicial killings of party workers and the its lawmakers have raised voice in the Sindh Assembly as well to press the provincial government to ensure protection of the party workers.

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
assoc_actor_2: Dinka Ethnic Group (South Sudan); WFP: World Food Programme
notes: SPLA/M-IO rebels in Jiech Payam, Ayod County detained a WFP helicopter that was bringing food to Uror and supposedly illegally landed in Jiech. Rebels forcefully removed Chol Aruai (National Bureau of Statistics), Mading Akueth (Lutheran World Federation), and Jacob Alier (WFP), all allegedly targeted because of their Dinka ethnicity. All the abductees were released in Juba on Feb 5.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 4 people were abducted in Rutshuru territory by an unidentified group. They were later released after being ransomed.
A pastor, his wife and 4 other residents of a village in the north of the country were abducted. All were released the next day except for the pastor.
The mayor of Khoms was kidnapped by unidentified gunmen. The group are said to have gone to the Muncipal headquarters and seized him and then driven off.
Unknown group hijacked two lorries and abducted eight people. Exact location unreported. Abductees were recovered by army forces the following week in Rahad al Bardi locality.
A 16-year-old boy was abducted near Tambura, South Sudan as he was on his way to buy some fish.
An armed gang ambushed and kidnapped the Consular of South Korea outside of his home. When security guards arrived, the kidnappers disappeared.
A number of young men were captured from Tajoura by Libya Dawn forces and imprisoned in Misrata.
28 people were kidnapped near Nzako. There were 9 unidentified men who attacked the people before capturing them and demanding a ransom.

assoc_actor_2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
notes: 2 Russian pilots working as UNAMID contractors in Sudan were kidnapped on Jan 29 when six armed gunmen in cars blocked a UNAMID minibus in Zalingei and took the passengers in an unknown direction. They were freed in Khartoum on June 6.
Unknown militia beat and abducted a man in Al Dabkar village in Al Sonut locality.
Militants kidnapped seven miners belonging to the Pakistan Mineral Development Corporation in Quetta.

Al Shabaab have captured 43 civilians from Gof Gadud and are holding them for ransom. The militants attacked the village in military vehicles and took mostly farmers and pastoralists as hostages. The date of the raid is not known, source dated 27/01.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Libya (2014-) House of Representatives
source: Associated Press International; Xinhua General News Service
notes: Gunmen beat and kidnapped the deputy foreign minister of Libyas internationally-recognized government in the eastern city of Bayda. He was released a day later.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Central African Republic (2014-2016); RJ: Revolution and Justice
source: Reseau des Journalistes de RCA; Associated Press International; Agence France Presse -- English; Centrafrique Presse Info (CPI); UN Integrated Regional Information Networks (Nairobi); Radio Ndeke Luka
notes: The Minister of Youth and Sports (and leader of the Revolutionary Justice movement) was kidnapped by armed men believed to be anti-Balaka militiamen as he came out of church. He was taken at a roadblock 10km outside of Bangui, and a number of vehicles were stolen at the same time.
State of Sinai members were accused of kidnapping a young man in North Sinai who belongs to one of the tribes south of Sheikh Zuweid.

actor1: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
source: Associated Press International; Centrafrique Presse Info (CPI); UN Integrated Regional Information Networks (Nairobi); Radio Ndeke Luka
notes: An 8 person team conducting public consultations ahead of the national peace and reconciliation forum were kidnapped by FPRC elements of the Seleka militia in Kaga Bandoro. The team included the regional prefect, one of his deputies and the towns mayor. They were released the next day, but their vehicle and other equipment were kept.

At least seven and maybe as many as 25 drivers have been seized driving fuel toward Ajdabiya in the last 48 hours. All were taken on the B11, the direct inland road between Tobruk and Ajdabiya. Tobruk fuel delivery drivers have gone on strike in protest.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Libya (2014-) House of Representatives
notes: An official from Libyas Health Ministry was abducted in the capital city of Tripoli.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters abducted a civilian man from his house in Koban village (21km SE of Qansax-Dheere) in the morning of 20/01. The victim is allegedly accused of collaborating with the SNG forces in Qansax Dheere. He was taken to an al Shabaab base in Idale (60km SW of Baidoa) and his fate is currently unknown.

assoc_actor_2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
notes: An Iraqi UN staff member who works for MINUSCA was kidnapped by the Anti-Balaka. She was released the following day.
The brother of Pachomius Pabandji, a well known journalist, was beaten and kidnapped by unidentified men, close to where the Iraqi MINUSCA employee was taken.

A female French aid worker who was working for the Catholic medical organisation CODIS was kidnapped alongside a local co-worker by the Anti-Balaka when they seized their vehicle. They were later released on 23/01/2014.
Militiamen in a Land Cruiser, mounted with a Dushka machinegun, abducted a merchant in Kutum.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters abducted a civilian man in Goorisine village (32km SW of Baidoa) in the evening of 18/01. The man was traveling to Baidoa with a motorbike when the incident happened. The reason behind his abduction is currently unknown. The man was a Khat dealer and used to run a football club in Qansax-Dheere District. Reports indicate that he was taken to Xawalbarbaar village (15km NE of Diinsoor).

Al Shabaab fighters kidnapped over 50 charcoal burners from Kidi Faani Village (31km SE of Badhaadhe) in the afternoon of 15/01. In Sadaxlogood Village (40km E of Badhaadhe), 25 charcoal burners went missing and are believed to have been kidnapped by al Shabaab fighters. Five charcoal trucks and three mini-buses are also reportedly missing and believed to have taken by the al Shabaab fighters. Reports indicate these villages are the main charcoal producers in the region. The charcoal is later transported to Buur Gaabo Village (43km SE of Badhadhe) along the coast of the Indian Ocean.

Al Shabaab fighters kidnapped over 50 charcoal burners from Kidi Faani Village (31km SE of Badhaadhe) in the afternoon of 15/01. In Sadaxlogood Village (40km E of Badhaadhe), 25 charcoal burners went missing and are believed to have been kidnapped by al Shabaab fighters. Five charcoal trucks and three mini-buses are also reportedly missing and believed to have taken by the al Shabaab fighters. Reports indicate these villages are the main charcoal producers in the region. The charcoal is later transported to Buur Gaabo Village (43km SE of Badhadhe) along the coast of the Indian Ocean.
LRA rebels kidnapped 13 people from Bili total, including 10 women in one attack and 7 men in another, but 4 of the men managed to escape.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters carjacked a private vehicle transporting Khat and abducted its driver in Lagadiimo (30km W of Luuq) in the afternoon of 15/01. The driver and the vehicle were taken to Goiweyn (31km SW of Luuq) where al Shabaab has a small transit camp. The fate of the driver is currently unknown.

assoc_actor_1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Recruitment: HRW reported a January spike in incidents of child soldier recruitment in and around Malakal by both rebel and military forces (especially those led by former militia leader Johnson Olony).
An executive from Libyas National Oil Corporation (NOC), who represents his country in the OPEC cartel is believed to have been abducted in the militia-held capital Tripoli.
A displaced man was abducted by Janjaweed on camels at his farmland in Naivasha camp in Shangil Tobaya on Jan. 15.

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: SPLA/M-IO attacked Gendrasa in Maban County in January. 4 women and girls abducted.

Assistant director of World Vision International was abducted from his home in Nyala on Jan. 14. Four gunmen in a Land Cruiser intercepted the assistant directors car at El Tadamon district, north of El Malaga Market, and seized him at gunpoint. He was released on Feb 5.
Unidentified gunmen adbucted a man from his house in the village of Dignij west of Kas in South Darfur on Jan. 14.

actor1: Military Forces of Gambia (1996-2017) National Intelligence Agency
notes: One man was reportedly abducted by men believed to be members of the NIA.
Ten Egyptians were claimed to have been kidnapped in Libya near the city of Beni Walid on 7 January.

assoc_actor_2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
notes: A Sudanese driver working for the UNISFA was kidnapped by unidentified armed men.

actor1: Military Forces of Gambia (1996-2017) National Intelligence Agency
notes: One man was reportedly abducted by men believed to be members of the NIA.
An Iraqi professor at the University of Sirte was kidnapped along with his three sons from their home.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 4 people, including 2 Ugandans, were kidnapped by an unidentified armed group. They were later released.

actor1: Military Forces of Gambia (1996-2017) National Intelligence Agency
notes: Five people reportedly abducted by men believed to be members of the NIA.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen have kidnapped 40 boys and young men in Malari on New Year's Eve. The kidnapping is believed to be forces conscription into their fighting force.

On 29 and 30 December 2014, villagers in Brame commune (Preah Vihear) confiscated bulldozers and briefly held hostage two drivers from Chinese firms Rui Feng International and Lan Feng. Villagers are in a land dispute against the company Rui Feng.
LRA members raided the village of Mangasaba, near Dungu, stealing food and taking 2 people hostage, forcing them to carry the goods they stole. The hostages were later released.

On 29 and 30 December 2014, villagers in Brame commune (Preah Vihear) confiscated bulldozers and briefly held hostage two drivers from Chinese firms Rui Feng International and Lan Feng. Villagers are in a land dispute against the company Rui Feng.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: The RSF ambushed a commercial convoy of three trucks in the Tawila locality, seizing 2 vehicles and kidnapping 60 passengers.
Ten Egyptians were reported to have gone missing on 25 December 2014 near Beni Walid. According to the report they were kidnapped by men in police uniforms.

Unidentified gunmen kidnapped a businessman (Majerteen/Dishiishe) from his home in Biyo Kulule neighbourhood in Bosasso on the evening of 23/12. The motive is unknown but unconfirmed reports indicate that the perpetrators could be al Shabaab operatives.
LRA elements attacked Dabiapali village, 5 km from Moussa (Mbomou prefecture). The group took six hostages and fled in the direction of Zemio.

assoc_actor_2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
notes: 11 armed elements of the LRA moved into Moussa village in Mbomou prefecture and took several villagers hostage and injured others. MINUSCA troops in Rafai responded by moving into the area, resulting in the LRA elements to flee, leaving behind all hostages.
Militiamen on camel-back kidnapped 2 young shepherds and stole 200 sheep near Arasho in the East Jebbel Marra area. They also beat up and robbed a number of villagers in the area.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: An unidentified armed group has kidnapped 10 people in the Ogambi Ngbele camps in the Dungu area. The gunmen also stole rice.
In December, unidentified armed militiamen abducted 5 high school students in Nierteti locality in Central Darfur. The abductees were released for ransom on Jan. 12, 2015.
A Professor of Constitutional Law and legal expert was kidnapped in Tripoli Monday.
A group of militiamen on camels and horses attacked Kolkul in the Zalingei locality, raiding houses and kidnapping 9 people. 3 were later released after a ransom was paid.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 2 secondary school students were kidnapped in separate incidents by unidentified assailants.

Unidentified gunmen kidnapped the director of the Ministry of Women and Human Rights from his house in Via Liberia neighbourhood (Waberi District) in the night of 11/12. The motive is unknown. It was later found out that the director was arrested by SNG forces. He was released on 12/12.
Nine people, including a 13 year old girl, were abducted by the LRA.

Members of the Mayi Mayi Simba militia have taken over the Muchacha mining operation near the village of Bandegaido in Mambasa territory, and have taken 50 traders hostage after looting several properties in the area.
Al Shabaab fighters picked four men (Ogaden/Bartire) from the homes in Welharey Village (79km NW of Afmadow) in the night of 06/12 and took them to Jilib. The motive is unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters kidnapped three pastoralists from Hawadle sub-clan Yasooman Village (30km NE of Bulo Burte) on 04/12 and took them to unknown location. The incident is believed to be related to the conflict between Hawadle pastoralist and al Shabaab over the payment of Zakat in the pastoral villages in Bulo Burte.
21 Tawargha men were abducted in early December 2014 while fleeing violence in Benghazi. Their whereabouts remains unknown.

3 Malian civilians from the same family were kidnapped by armed men near Menaka. They are believed to have been taken by MUJAO, as other attacks have taken place in the same area carried out by MUJAO.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 7 people were kidnapped in over two weeks in Bunia. Several have been released after payment of ransoms.
A local journalist is believed to have been kidnapped and take to a location near the Ethiopian border.

Three men and two women were kidnapped by members of the LRA in Kouango, 5km from Mboki. Food and other goods were also stolen. Others reports state that 9 people were kidnapped, with eight later escaping on 5th December 2014.
8 well-armed LRA forces reportedly abducted a family of 7 civilians near Ezo, South Sudan, and looted food from the victims. Among the abducted civilians were 4 men, 1 girl and 1 woman.
Kidnapping by unidentified armed group.
Thirty elements of the LRA kidnapped several people, including children, from the village of Fode. 15 abductees later managed to escape.
6 people were kidnapped by the LRA in Ezo county. The 5 men kidnapped were released but the 6th was a woman and is still missing.
A leading Libyan imam and preacher was kidnapped as he left his local mosque in the Tripoli suburb of Ain Zara.
A political activist known for his anti-dignity operation views, was kidnapped in Tobruk.
An "Indo-Pakistani" was kidnapped from his store by men who spoke in Malagasy.

A co-pilot for United, a government-owned aviation company affiliated with the interim government, the House of Representatives (HoR), was abducted by unknown assailants on 27 November 2014. He was forcibly taken from his own car as he was parking it outside of his house in al-Hani area of Tripoli. His fate and exact whereabouts have remained unknown. However, reports suggest that he is being held in a detention facility in Abu Salim area under the authority of Salah Burki, a field commander with the Libya Dawn coalition.
A young student was abducted and 2 displaced women severely beaten by militiamen near Kutum.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters stopped a taxi carrying passengers at Wareer-Male village (38km NE of Baraawe) in the night of 25/11. The perpetrators ordered five occupants out of the car, burnt down the car and taken the five people in to unknown location. A few hours later the abductees were released. The motive behind the incident and identity of the attackers remains unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters abducted two local NGO staff members in Toos Weyne (52km W of Baidoa) on 24/11. The abducted staffs were on a mission to visit a health facility in the area and were taken to Buulo Xaawo village (9km SW of Toos Weyne). Reports indicate that elders have started negotiating with al Shabaab to secure their release. According to latest reports, the staff and their driver were transferred from Buulo Xaawo village to Diinsoor for further interrogations. They are all from Leysan sub clan of Rahanweyn.

Al Shabaab fighters abducted two local NGO staff members in Toos Weyne (52km W of Baidoa) on 24/11. The abducted staffs were on a mission to visit a health facility in the area and were taken to Buulo Xaawo village (9km SW of Toos Weyne). Reports indicate that elders have started negotiating with al Shabaab to secure their release.
2 youths were kidnapped from a convoy traveling from Algeria to Gao. They were taken by armed men near Anefis. Reports disagree about motives for the kidnapping.

An Ijaw leader is kidnapped in Ethiope East LGA while returning from Kokori following a conference. Many in the Ijaw community blame Kokori residents for his disappearance, and threaten to "invade" the town. Despite the circumstantial evidence the perpetrators are not officially known.
A journalist is abducted in Abia State, location unknown. The man was later released.
Unidentified gunmen kidnap the son of a former PDP chairman.
The CEO of Libyas main shipping company, the General National Maritime Transport Company and the dean of the faculty of economics were kidnapped in Tripoli.

actor1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
assoc_actor_2: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: A former ZANU-PF Harare provincial youth chairman is abducted and severely beaten by men suspected of being ZANU-PF members belonging to a rival faction. State agents are apparently involved in the abduction.
4 civilians were abducted in Tawila market by Rizaygat militiamen. Government troops attempted to pursue the militiamen but were not able to catch them.

actor1: Military Forces of Gambia (1996-2017) National Intelligence Agency
notes: A man suspected of homosexuality was detained by NIA agents, held for eight days at NIA headquerters and then detained at Mile 2 prison for nine months with another man, subject to regular abuse at the hands of NIA officials for "unnatural acts". They were relased in July 2015
Unidentified gunmen have kidnapped the younger brother to the former Chairman of the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) and governorship aspirant in Adamawa State.
A member of the Islamist political organisation Salafi Front was kidnapped. His arrest/disappearance has been blamed on the Ministry of Interior.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: The head doctor of the health zone of Rwanguba and his driver were kidnapped while in the town of Rukoro in Rutshuru territory by unidentified assailants.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 15 women and 5 men who are part of the Yira Cultural Council have disappeared and are believed to have been kidnapped.

assoc_actor_2: MSF: Doctors Without Borders; Aid Workers (Central African Republic); Health Workers (Central African Republic)
notes: Following a similar event the previous day, a second MSF truck was held up by the same armed group. The team leader was taken away and held captive, and forced to negotiate a payment.

assoc_actor_2: MSF: Doctors Without Borders; Aid Workers (Central African Republic); Health Workers (Central African Republic)
notes: A truck carrying medical supplies that was clearly identified as working for MSF was stopped and the crew was held captive by an armed group on the route linking Paoua in the north to the capital Bangui, between the towns of Yaloke and Bossembele. A sum of money was demanded for the vehicle and its crew to be freed.

Al Shabaab fighters took a businessman hailing from Jilible sub clan of Rahanweyn from his home in Makuudo village (7kms SW of Baidoa) in the morning of 06/11, the man was accused of spying for the SNG and was taken to unknown location. His whereabouts is so far unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters abducted 6 district health board staff in Carro Case village (33Km SE of Belet-Xaawo) in the afternoon of 06/11. They were travelling from Belet Xaawo to Garbahaarey town when they were arrested. Two women among the six were released on the same day while the rest were released two days later.

Al Shabaab fighters abducted 6 district health board staff in Carro Case village (33Km SE of Belet-Xaawo) in the afternoon of 06/11. The staff were travelling from Belet Xaawo to Garbahaarey town. The two women in the group were released, but the other four travellers were conducted to unknown locations and remain in captivity.
The new mayor of the Tripoli suburb of Swani Ben Adem [also Al-Sawani Bin-Adam] was kidnapped by armed men.
Unidentified attackers, suspected to be from a neighbouring village, attack Afam Uku, kidnap two and destroy buildings. The attack is believed to have been motivated in reprisal for an unknown issue.
Gunmen from Madhiban abducted a taxi driver (Habar-Gidir/Sa'ad Hillowle with his car and taken to unknown destination (04/11).
An unidentified armed group kidnapped 3 people and released them after a few days. These people were then arrested by the police for questioning.
A vehicle was burned and two passengers taken as hostages by an unidentified armed group 15 km from Baboua.
Party members hold that Laljan Baloch of the Baloch National Party was abducted by authrities
The head of the office for the Libyan Deputy Minister of Housing was kidnapped Wednesday while on a trip to Cairo and released 12 hours later.

A freelancer was abducted in Tripoli on 29 October 2014 by a militia affiliated to Fajr Libya on the grounds that he was said to have been a supporter of the former Gaddafi regime. It is reported that he is still held in Misrata.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A woman was kidnapped by a group of armed men in military uniforms, but managed to escape. The men were believed to have been from the DRC.

Unidentified gunmen believed to be Dhulbahante/Bihina-Farah sub-clan attacked a vehicle belonging to Warsangeli/Bihi-dor sub-clan in Damale Xagare village (115km SE of Ceerigaabo) in the afternoon of 27/10 and abducted four men.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Border Guards
notes: Border Guards members kidnapped a Salamat tribal leader at the Hamidiya bus station in Zalingei.
A PDP candidate for Nasarawa governor is abducted from his home several hours after he and two others were attacked by fellow PDP members who were displeased with his candidacy.
A displaced man from Ronga Tas camp for IDPs was abducted by 12 gumen on motorcycles. They later demanded a ransom.
An unidentified armed group from the Central African Republic kidnapped the chief of Dole.

An unidentified armed group from the Central African Republic ambushed two trucks near the village of Yokosire between Oct.24-25, kidnapping 7 Cameroonians. While on their way back to CAR, they also kidnapped a shepherd.
A Hay Andalus councillor was seized from the local council building by armed intruders.

A group of Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked a private lorry, transporting fuel and food in Xamiir Gub (27km SE of Bulo Burte) in the afternoon of 22/10 and kidnapped the driver and other passengers. The whereabouts of the vehicle and its passengers are currently unknown.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: Armed men abducted the Libyan army head of protocol, who was drinking coffee with a friend in the Sariyah Cafe on Martyrs Square.

assoc_actor_2: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
notes: The local Red Crescent Secretary Nasir Muhammad Daw al-Alwani and a journalist were abducted in Tripoli.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
notes: A prosecutor was abducted on 21 October 2014 by the Zawiya Martyrs Brigade while on his way home from an outing. He was abducted in the Fuwaihat area of Benghazi, in front of the al-Arab Medical University. It is believed he continues to be detained at the Zawiya Martyrs Brigade base in Tabalino and has suffered an injury to his hand from ill-treatment in detention.
A student was abducted by the Egyptian security forces at the Al Azhar University campus in Cairo on 20 October 2014. She was released on 6 November with signs of torture.

assoc_actor_2: Christian Group (Central African Republic); Civilians (Central African Republic)
notes: Anti-Balaka abducted a Belgian religious man leading Caritas NGO and some of his colleagues in Fafara village near Kaga Bandoro. They were released soon after, but the assaillants took away their vehicle and property.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram abducts 60 following an attack on Waga Mangoro and Garta villages in Madagali Local Government Area. 40 women were said to have been abducted from Waga Mangoro, 20 were forcibly uprooted from their homes in Garta.No reported dead.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram abducts 60 following an attack on Waga Mangoro and Garta villages in Madagali Local Government Area. 40 women were said to have been abducted from Waga Mangoro, 20 were forcibly uprooted from their homes in Garta.No reported dead.

assoc_actor_2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
source: Radio Tamazuj; Agence Frence Presse -- English
notes: A South Sudanese UN contractor with the WFP was kidnapped at Malakal airport by 8 men in plain clothes. There are conflicting reports whether the men were intelligence security agents or part of a pro-government militia.
An armed group abducted a Chinese oil engineer in the vicinty of Beleila oil field.

Al Shabaab fighters seized a businessman hailing from Rahaweyn/Hadame from Kurta Village (40km NE of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 15/10 and took him to their al Shabaab base in Labatan Jirow Village (48km N of Baidoa). The motive is unknown.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 2 Kenyans and 1 Congolese were taken hostage while traveling on the road between Rutshuru and Butembo by unidentified armed men and released the next day.
About 13 pro-government militia in a land cruiser attacked Hassahissa camp resident and leader Saeed Yagoub Abdelshafi, seized him at gunpoint, and took him in the direction of Jebel Bum.

actor1: FDPC: Democratic Front for the People of the Central African Republic
notes: Father Mateusz Dziedzic, the pastor of Baboua, of Polish nationality, was abducted by members of the FDPC of Abdoulaye Miskine. They are demanding the release of their leader. He was later released on 26th November 2014, along with 15 Cameroonians who had been kidnapped on other occasions. It is assumed, but not confirmed, that this was arranged in return for the release of Abdoulaye Miskine.

Five passengers in two Miraa [mild narcotic] vans from Lamu to Ijara town were during the morning hours hijacked by suspected al Shabaab militia, which was later confirmed. The incident took place between Milimani and Basuba area in Lamu East sub-county. The five were taken to an unknown location. Kenyan security forces launched a search mission in response.

assoc_actor_2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
source: Radio Tamazuj; Agence Frence Presse -- English
notes: 3 South Sudanese UN contractors were kidnapped by 20 gunmen in civilian clothes in Malakal. 2 were later released but a third is still missing.
A Benghazi man was kidnapped outside his home by masked gunmen in Fuwayhat district.

A TV presenter with Alassema TV station was reported to have been seized in Tripoli by an armed group dressed in military uniform and taken to an unknown destination. A poet was also reported to have been kidnapped but released several hours later.

A few hours after an attack by Mayi Mayi Simba fighters, about 28 women and 7 boys were abducted in Bakaiko in Mambasa territory by Manu militiamen (at least 40 women total were kidnapped over the two attacks).

An armed group kidnapped four brothers and their two cousins from the family's farm near Tripoli's Airport Road. It is thought that the six, who are involved in supporting human rights and Operation Dignity, were being held somewhere in Tripoli's Al-Falah district.
Gunmen abducted 2 Sudanese engineers traveling from Ed Daein to Khartoum on the Abu Sufyan-El Fado road and seized their vehicle.

Gunmen kidnap a 80-year old monarch, the Waziri of Jajere, Hussaini Biriri, on the night of 10/06 - 11:00 p.m. in Biriri town of Tarmuwa Local Council of the state. The demands of the abductors are not known.
Unidentified gunmen kidnap the brother of the monarch of the of Kolokuma Kingdom, their demands not known.

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: SPLA-IO has been accused of forcibly recruiting civilians on the Upper Nile-Sudan border, including about 20 taken by opposition fighters near Joda North checkpoint and taken to a training centre near Jenbelain area of Sudans White Nile.

Seven hunters and a twelve year old were attacked by the LRA 30km from Obo. They kidnapped one hunter and the twelve year old, while the rest escaped. The kidnapped hunter escaped the following morning. The LRA still have the boy.

Militia inside Libya are holding 65 Egyptian truck drivers hostage in the city of Ajdabiya. The hostage takers are demanding the release of a Libyan prisoner held in Egypt for attempting to enter the country without permission while possessing unlicensed weapons.

The office manager of the Deputy Governor of the Central Bank of Libya was kidnapped in Tripoli. It may be that this is a political abduction. It is reported that he had received threats some days ago. A writer and activist was also kidnapped from his central Tripoli hotel. He was a harsh critic of the Qaddafi regime and played an active role in the February 17 Revolution.

source: Deutsche Welle (Bonn); Sahara Media news agency
notes: A French national was kidnapped on Sunday in Algeria, in the region of Tizi Ouzou by militants from the Soldiers of the Caliphate. Sahara Media news agency reported that one of the kidnappers was Mauritanian.

actor1: FDPC: Democratic Front for the People of the Central African Republic
source: Voice of America (Washington, DC); Agence France Presse
notes: Fighters from CAR kidnapped 15 Cameroonians and are demanding a prisoner exchange for ransom. Originally, it was unclear which group made the kidnappings, but later it was revealed to be the FDPC.
Pro-government militiamen abducted 3 displaced men in Kijunga area, north of Kabkabiya

Unidentified militiamen abducted a nurse and his family members in Birkat Seira, Saraf Umra, claiming that a militia member died after the nurse gave him an injection and demanding 'blood money' from the nurse.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: FRPI fighters robbed a group of women returning from the Nyamavi market, and abducted 4.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri

actor1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
