Five people were taken hostage and property looted by the LRA in Maboussou village. After traveling a few kilometers, four of the hostages were released. One hostage remains with the LRA.
Unconfirmed reports reveal that armed men abducted two young relatives of Libya's ambassador to the UK in a raid on his Tripoli home.

actor1: FDPC: Democratic Front for the People of the Central African Republic

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram abducts a group of 50 women and children from Gulak. "[Boko Haram] started loading our women and children into their vehicles, threatening to shoot whoever disobeyed them. Everybody was scared," a witness stated. The date of the attack was not included in the report, but is likely to have occured on 13/09 or 14/09.
Raia Mutomboki (Sisawa group) raided Lugungu market and took 22 civilians hostage following clashes with military forces
Janjaweed militiamen intercepted a passenger lorry between El Fasher and Kabkabiya, in Abu Nabag area North Darfur. They seized the lorry and abducted the driver and a passenger.
NDC forces abducted 6 people from Mpofi
NDC forces stole motorbikes and abducted 2 girls around Mubea, Walikale.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda

The SPLA is suspected of taking hostage several local leaders and journalists in Wano Village, Moyo district during a national census exercise .
A lawyer was kidnapped outside a courtroom in Tripoli.
Two Tunisian journalists were abducted in Brega near Ajdabiya.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces

A Libyan human rights activist was kidnapped at gunpoint in Western Tripoli. He was later released on 11th September.
Government-backed militia intercepted and detained 3 traders and killed their donkeys on the road between Souni village and Talba, north of Deribat
The manager of the Solidarity Fund office in Germa was kidnapped in the southern town of Obari on Tuesday.
Four Egyptians were kidnapped in Libya, near Sirte, targeted specifically because they were Christians.

Al Shabaab fighters seized three pastoralists over disagreement on payment of Zakat in Gelaf (25km E of Tabta Village) in the afternoon of 27/8. One pastoralist was later released but the whereabouts of the other two is unknown.
Militiamen detained 13 displaced people, holding them as ransom after abducting them from Gumba area, near Mershing

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A pastor was kidnapped in Kauli locality, in Luongo area, by unidentified assailants.

actor1: MFDC: Movement of Democratic Forces of Casamance
notes: Armed kidnappers believed to be part of the MFDC took 9 community outreach workers and a soldier prisoner. They were released about 15 hours later with no harm done to them.
Libya Dawn militias on August 25 raided a company because of its connection to Alassema TV, seizing two civilians who are both still missing.
Three journalists and media workers affiliated with Al-Asimah TV were abducted on Monday [25 August] from different locations around Tripoli and Benghazi.
Three journalists and media workers affiliated with Al-Asimah TV were abducted on Monday [25 August] from different locations around Tripoli and Benghazi.

source: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information (Cairo)
notes: On Sunday, August 24, the militias of Fajr Libya Group raided the headquarters of "Alassema TV" in Tripoli, kidnapped its workers and damaged its contents.
The LRA carried out a major raid in the locality of Baime, kidnapping 14 people.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) National Intelligence Agency

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

Al-Shabaab fighters have reportedly kidnapped 22 people from North-eastern Kenyan district of Mandera. The perpetrators later released the group after taking their possessions.
Militiamen beat and abducted 4 people, and beat 3 others, from Abdel Shakur village, north of Kutum town, reportedly linked to stolen camels
Militiamen abducted a man from his house in Kafi village, near Kutum town

LRA forces kidnapped 20 people from Nambili village and Gungu river area between Aug 11-12.
Mayi Mayi Raia Mutomboki forces kidnapped a local chief from Kambale, Bunyakiri area, following clashes with government forces.

A group of youth abducted 9 Chinese oil workers at Zarga Um Hadid and Jid El Sayed oil fields in El Mazarob, Adila locality, reportedly in response to the lack of compensation for farmlands by the oil companies. The workers were released the next day following negotations the the local commissioner.
Elements of the LRA kidnapped two fishermen from Ngalu village. 1 managed to escape.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction

2 young people were captured by LRA in Bitakpo, 5km from Ango town. 1 managed to escape.
LRA elements looted Zangapay village (NE of Banda) and abducted civilians. Most hostages were later released, although 2 disappeared.
Pro-government militiamen kidnapped a man from Korma camp for the displaced in El Fasher, and beat a number of other residents as well as taking more than 1000 cattle from the camp.
The First Deputy Mayor of Kidal was kidnapped by unidentified armed men, but was later released.
LRA rebels attacked Zangabayi and used two disabled people to help them carry loot before releasing them.
A five-member TV crew from Ajdabiya were kidnapped while returning from Tobruk. Ansar al-Sharia are suspected of being involved.
A Dahalo raid reportedly captured eleven zebu in the Ambroasary-Sud area.

Gunmen in the early hours of the day abducted the younger brother to the Speaker of Bayelsa House of Assembly. The abduction comes at a time when as House Speaker in enduring possible impeachment proceedings.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Armed men abducted 3 agents of a forestry company in Mambasa territory

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: A human rights organisation accused soldiers and police officers of kidnapping one of their members and 10 other people in Brikin quarter, Ngaliema municipality, Kinshasa. 8 were released in 12/08/14. Militiamen seized 22 Tawerghan civilian men between mid-July and August 30 as they fled the Zawiyah area.
Mai Mai Bakata Katanga abducted a CENI agent in Manono territory and confiscated his material before releasing him.
Gunmen kidnapped a former deputy prime minister and newly-elected MP at his Tripoli home.
On 29-July-2014, in Kutkai township, Shan state, the Myanmar army 99th LID captured a civilian and forced him to serve as a porter.

PF militia abducted the leader of a Kabwe based NGO, Youth Meet Leaders Group and threatened to kill him if he continues to denounce PF bad governance standards.
A member of the former legislature has been held by members of the Zintani- aligned Barq al-Nasr militia since July 21.
LRA rebels attack and abduct a group of hunters 20km from Obo. The hunters were stripped of all their belongings before being released the next morning.
Militiamen beat and abducted 2 farmers and seized their tractor in Dankoj area, Central Darfur. The farmers were released 2 days later.

Maltas Ministry of Foreign Affairs confirmed on Friday that a 42-year-old Maltese worker was abducted by Libyan rebel militias outside Tripoli. A retired captain of the Armed Forces, was abducted by rebel militia while he was on his way to work on the outskirts of Tripoli on July 17.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: Approximately 20 FRPI militiamen attacked Mandibe village, Irumu territory, and kidnapped 3 people.
Pro-government militiamen abducted a school teacher and stole a large amount of money near Kass town, at Lufa Kasara area en route from Nyala to Zalingei.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

Following the abduction two members of a local organized militia group pursued the captors, but were shot and killed as they fled.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: 10 heavily armed men believed to be Boko Haram members ransacked the home of an influential Cameroonian Muslim spiritual leader and kidnapped two of his teenaged children

In July 2014, Anti-Balaka captured 34 Peuhl herders near Ngbaina as they tried to reach Cameroon with their cattle. They beat them, stole their cattle, and threatened to kill them if they did not pay US$3,750 ransom. Three months later, they were released when relatives in Cameroon organised to pay a reduced ransom. The Anti-Balaka took all but one of the Peuhl herders to Yaloke. The remamining man had not yet been released as of December 2014.
Rwandan marine forces allegedly kidnapped 4 Congolese fishermen, threw 2 in the water, and confiscated 2 boats around Idjwi Island in Lake Kivu.
Militiamen abducted 2 passengers from a lorry in Omu El Madrasa area, north of Kutum.

assoc_actor_2: UN: United Nations; Aid Workers (Central African Republic)
notes: A convoy of eight humanitarian UN workers were stopped outside Boali, abducted and held by armed elements for a few hours. Following negotiations, the staff were released.
Mai Mai Raia Mukombozi forces kidnapped 5 peole from Mugoma village, Mulamba groupement, over the course of the past week.
Mai Mai Simba attacked Motomoto Fungamukaba village (4km NE of Salate forest), kidnapping 32 civilians.
Unidentified gunmen abduct a State lawmaker. The victim is a member of All Progressives Congress (APC) and representing Etche Constituency in the state assembly.
The LRA carried out an attack in Kpangou, a village located 100 km from Nzako. Several persons have been taken hostage by the rebels and possessions of the local population have been looted.
A staffer from the International Organisation for Migration was abducted in South Darfur. No other details were provided.
Janjaweed militia abducted 2 displaced men in Amar area, 6km W of Kass town.
Anti-Balaka abducts two village chiefs on the Kaga Bandoro axis as part of their progression to track Seleka militiamen, asking for a ransom of 100,000 CFA francs each.
An Italian engineer working in Libya was kidnapped. Two other Europeans were reported missing in the same attack.
Abbala tribesmen kidnapped 5 women in El Marra area, SE of El Sareif town, El Sareif Beni Hussein locality, after 48 Abbala cows went missing
An Imam was kidnapped in front of his home, close to the Abu-Minjal mosque where he preached on Umar Mukhtar Street on [4 July].

Between 30th June and 3rd July 2014, the LRA attack the villages of Taguia, Nambo and Kamanda, resulting in the wounding of one person, and the abduction of 11 others. 10 of the captives, who were abducted from Kamanda on 3rd July, were later released on 7th July 2014.

A group of armed masked men in Sinai kidnapped at gunpoint a Christian engineer who works at a cement factory in the Peninsula on Monday.
Pro-government militiamen abducted a boy in Nierteti locality, 1km east of Nierteti town.

Al Shabaab fighters kidnapped 20 football players, most of them teenagers, in the vicinity of Bohol Bashiiro Village (25km SE of Luuq) in the morning of 27/06. The boys were taken with the mini bus they were travelling with, towards Ceel Boon (38km E of Luuq) while other sources state that they were driven to Labaatan Jirow (an al Shabaab base) located (47km N of Baidoa). The footballers were travelling to Yurkud to play a friendly match with a team in Yurkud. The incident happened after al Shabaab operatives received a tip off regarding the teams travel.
Government-backed militiamen abducted a trader in Kass town
Abbala gunmen attacked Hileila village, Kabkabiya locality, after finding one of the members dead in a neighbouring area. They kidnapped a man and beat other Hileila residents.

It is believed the al Shabaab fighters abandoned the traders but took two vehicles and their cargo (khat) belonging to the traders. A group of al Shabaab militiamen reportedly reached Buscbusc area (30km S of Badhaade) on 30/08 and announced to the villagers that the production of charcoal would be banned. Two local charcoal burners were reportedly arrested after they expressed their dissatisfaction. One was later found after having apparently been beaten. The second one remained missing.

Rwandan who was a former bodyguard for Kagame went missing and was believed abducted for political reasons

Kidnappers abduct six individuals along Ekpoka-Igbanke road, including Uhumnwonde Local Government Council, Edo State, Mr. Walter Aiwekhoe. The group was later liberated by police in neighbouring Delta, presumably the same day.

Civil society members have accused the M23 of kidnapping their leader from Rutshuru Thursday.
An unidentified five-man gang kidnaps the wife a traditional ruler of Nkwumeto community. Several suspects were later arrested.

Three unidentified men wearing military uniforms onboard a Toyota Carib forcefully abducted two young women walking along the former pasta factory (Heliwa District) in the end of the afternoon of 14/08. The whereabouts of the two women is unknown.
Four Thai expatriates and two Nigerians are kidnapped in Buguma, Asaritoru local government area of Rivers state. Pertinent details vague.

The gunmen were said to have stormed the premises during the school hours and started shooting sporadically, in the process hitting a parent, who came to check on his child. No causalities reported.

Eight women were abducted and over 170 head of cattle stolen on Monday from South Sudans Unity state by a group of raiders allegedly from neighbouring Lakes state. The women were taken while searching for food along the river side, with communities in Unity states Payinjiar county facing severe hunger as a result of last years poor harvest. Payinjiar was among the worst affected counties during heavy floods last June which washed away crops.

The incident is thought to be linked to the ongoing tit-for-tat abductions between the two clans in the town and elsewhere in Mudug.

Six gunmen intercepted the tourists car and forced them into their truck, the officials said. The pair had been travelling between the resort of Taba, on the border with Israel, and Dahab further south
Father and son were kidnapped in South Darfur in line with a "new extortion method" in which militants are accusing the child of stealing 18 goats from them.

A group of Ijaw youths capture and hold a boat carrying about 300 Itsekiri. The group demanded an Ijaw slot for the chairmanship seat of Warri North Local Government Area in return for the safety of the kidnapped.

A member of the Anambra State House of Assembly representing Onitsha South 1, Dr. Emeka Aniebonam (AC), was kidnapped by unknown attackers. It is unclear if she was attacked for ransom or political reasons.

The abduction is part of an escalating tit-for-tat kidnapping between the Majerten and the Habargedir/ Saad clans.

Members of the Issa Mohamud clan kidnap a young Saad boy in Garsoor, causing ethnic tensions in the area. Tensions were further strained by a carjacking by Saad men 85km south of Galkacyo the following day. The boy was released on 29/03.

Security forces at South Sinai Security Directorate liberate two British tourists who were kidnapped while traveling to Ras Sidr.

Dozens of Libyan militiamen stormed the headquarters of a private TV network on Thursday in Tripoli, looting and smashing equipment before abducting staffers. Kromer, a father of three, was snatched on Jan. 29 as he drove home from his practice in the village of Nazlet el-Amoden. For the next 27 hours, he endured beatings, insults and threats to his life, while blindfolded, a bandage sealing his mouth and cotton balls in his ears. Kromers case is part of a dramatic rise of kidnappings targeting Christians, including children, in Egypts southern province of Minya, home to the countrys largest concentration of Christians but also a heartland for Islamist hard-liners.

Indian workers continue to be held against their will in the cement factory in which they work after management refused to let them leave after the labor group threaten strike over work conditions. The laborers have been held for several days.

The five men were travelling to the Frontier Region Tank, close to the tribal area of South Waziristan, when gunmen intercepted their vehicle in the Maghzai village. There was no immediate claim of responsibility or demand for ransom from any group. However, officials speculated that militant factions present in the area could be behind the abductions.

source: Human Rights Watch; Radio Ndeke Luka

A Misratah militia based in Tripoli captures two British journalists and accuses them of being spies. In the following month they were turned over to legitimate military and then cleared of all charges.

Sudanese police arrested hundreds of students in a pre-dawn raid on dormitories in the University of Khartoum on Friday, in a crackdown on a campus that has been at the center of recent anti-government protests in late 2011.
On 12 February, four indigenous people including a Union Parishad (UP) member were kidnapped by an unidentified group from two villages in Baghaichari upazila in Rangamati, Chittagong.
A armed group kidnapped three villagers near Tabet location.
Seleka rebels looted Kaga Bandoro and Dounkoumbe village, including public offices. In the latter, they abducted the family of the hygiene centres chief over failure to find their motorcycles.

The Mozambican police in the northern Mozambican city of Nampula are trying to persuade the leadership of the former rebel movement Renamo to release a man who has been imprisoned at the Renamo Nampula headquarters for the past three weeks, on allegations of spying on the group.

Egyptian Bedouins seized two female American tourists and their Egyptian tour guide on the road to the historic monastery of St Catherines in Sinai. The location was known as Wadi al-Soal. The two were released several hours later.
A businessman hailing from the Murusade clan was reportedly abducted by unknown militias. Negotiations to release the businessman led by elders was reported to be ongoing.
A second group of Chinese workers are kidnapped by tribal Bedouins. The group was freed several days later.
29 Chinese workers and 9 members of the Sudanese military are kidnapped by the SPLA and held for ransom. The group released a portion of them several days later.

Egyptian Bedouins captured 25 Chinese workers in Sinai to demand the release of relatives detained over bombings in the peninsula between 2004 and 2006. The group threatens torture if their demands are not met.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A German employee of a construction company is kidnapped. Authorities believe Boko Haram is involved, but have not clear evidence until late March when the group demands the governments release of a Muslim in exchange for his release.

A group of Bedouin militants took control of the Aqua Sun resort complex near Taba, demanding a ransom of four million Egyptian pounds (approximately $662,000). No tourists were at the site when it was seized, but Egyptian staff members were taken hostage.
Reports of human trafficking of Eritrean refugees by the Rashaida tribe.
On 23 January, a Union Leader was on his way to Fulbaria Bus Terminal on a rickshaw, when some people abducted him and put him in a vehicle with a Rab sign on it in Dhaka city in Dhaka.

actor1: FPR: Popular Front for the Recovery
notes: Clashes between government forces and FPR rebels in Batafango, forcing FPR to retreat, but enabling the group to abduct 12 women. The clashes came a day after government forces arrested the wife of the groups leader on her way back from Nigeria. Four suspected FPR supporters were arrested after the clashes.

An American-German citizen reported to be a freelance journalist was kidnapped by gunmen while on its way between Galkacyo South and the Galkacyo airstrip in the early afternoon of 21/01. The perpetrators are reported to be part of a pirate group, from the Saad/Niimcaale sub-sub clan. The victim was reportedly travelling in a vehicle belonging to a pirate associated to Mohamed Garfanje, a pirate leader based in Hobyo. The attackers were using a technical and two Land-Cruisers also reported to be belonging to a lieutenant of Mohamed Garfanje. It is believed that the perpetrators benefited from the complicity of the escort used by the victim and were in fact part of the escort the journalist had used when travelling to Hobyo. A Somali-German national who was assisting the journalist and who was trying to protect him was beaten and left on the scene. The victim is believed to have been taken in the direction of Hobyo or Xarar-Dhere. Separate reports indicate that an attempt to kidnap the journalist had already been made when he was staying in Ambassador Hotel in Galkacyo South, before he travelled to Hobyo, but that the management of the hotel had been informed in advance and had beefed up its security to prevent any attack.

Three men affiliated with the Young Democratic Progressive movement were kidnapped and robbed by a group of thirty armed men before escaping. The attackers have not been detained but several were identified as prisoners recently granted general amnesty by Tunisian President Moncef Marzouki.
After a group of Eritreans kidnapped several German tourists in neighboring Ethiopia they brought them back to Eritrea. They were origionally kidnapped at Erta Ale volcano.

Unknown Khartoum backed rebels kidnap two Catholic priests because the parish was harboring a former member of the Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army. Parishioners also claim there has been ongoing political intimidation directed toward them.

The attack against their three -cars convoy occurred in proximity of the SPU exchange point by the Galkacyo airport, in Galkacyo South. The armed escort used by the INGO did not attempt to resist the attack and may have been involved in its preparation. The abductors are believed to be a group of pirates/local gangs from different sub-clans of central regions. The abductors and their hostages moved south along the Galkcyo-Docol-Camaara road.

The victim was taken to a house in Dharkhenley District and stated that she had escaped in the night from that location and reached a TFG police station early in the morning. She added that her abductors were planning to hand her over to AS in Kaax-Shiiqaal area. The story could not be independently confirmed.

On 16 May a 15-year-old boy was forcibly recruited by a soldier of the Myanmar army.
On May 14, a 71-year-old man was abducted from his home in Mechtras.

Gunmen kidnapped a Briton and an Italian from their lodge in Nigerias northwestern town of Birnin-Kebbi, shooting and wounding one person who tried to prevent the attack. The two men, who were working for a construction company, were seized from their accommodation.

10-15 LRA disguised as SPLA soldiers abducted 7 people from the village of Sangu, S. Sudan while the civilians were attending a funeral on May 9th, 2011. Local police forces pursued the LRA as they fled west towards CAR.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda

A female residing in Hargeisa left her house 17th April 2011 and travelled to Gabiley. When she did not return home within the agreed timeframe her family alarmed the police. The woman later informed her familys neighbour that she was kidnapped by unknown men dressed in civilian clothes. No further information about the case is currently available.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda

Armed kidnappers abducted a priest working for international aid group Caritas in Ivory Coast where violence has broken out between political rivals.

A visiting German national, Yvonne Paperndorf, was on Friday evening abducted by unidentified men while attending a meeting of human rights defenders in Harare. Her whereabouts were unknown until late yesterday when the German ambassador to Zimbabwe Albrecht Conze received information that she had been deported.

Government forces have kidnapped and beaten up residents of Zawiyah since recapturing the city two weeks ago. "They [Gaddafis men] kidnap young men, old men, anyone below the age of 50 or 60, whether an engineer or a simple construction worker, and they are taken to an unknown location," according to a local.
24 tribesmen were kidnapped by TTP militants (supp. Research) on 22 March 2011, along with 55 vehicles. This took place in Baggan, Lower Kurram on 2 March 2011.
A group of armed men raided a foreign ship in Tripoli harbor. It is believed they took the crew hostage.
LRA rebels kidnapped a businessman in Gangala, near Dungu.
Waves of arbitrary arrests and forced disappearances reported around Tripoli.

2 LRA combatants attacked the community of Biagora near Tambura, S. Sudan. They abducted 8 people and stole food. Security forces pursued the LRA after they left the village.
